Invisible ink is a type of ink that can not be seen or read unless it is first activated . Chemical reactions , heat , or special glasses are used to make invisible ink visible .

Some species of lizard also utilize bright colors , such as the iridescent patches on the belly of Sceloporus .
The dewlap is a brightly colored patch of skin on the throat , usually hidden between scales .
When a display is needed , the lizards erect the hyoid bone of their throat , resulting in a large vertical flap of brightly colored skin beneath the head which can be then used for communication .
Sight is very important for most lizards , both for locating prey and for communication . Many lizards have highly acute color vision .
Most lizards rely heavily on body language , using specific postures , gestures and movements to define territory , resolve disputes , and entice mates .
These colors would be highly visible to predators , so are often hidden on the underside or between scales and only revealed when necessary .

In 62 an earthquake shook the city of Pompeii , destroying much of the Temple of Jupiter .
The inside of the temple housed the main room of the temple , which held the statues of Jupiter , Juno , and Minerva , and which only the priests were allowed to enter .
Pompeii was changed into a much more public and open place .

The Temple of Jupiter , Capitolium , or Temple of the Capitoline Triad was a temple in the Roman city of Pompeii in Italy .
At the beginning this temple was dedicated to Jupiter alone , it was built in the mid 2nd century BC at the same time as the temple of Apollo was being worked on - this was the era at which Roman influence over Pompeii was at its height and so Roman Jupiter beat out the Greek Apollo as the town 's highest god .
Public buildings and spaces would eventually be able to be found all over the city .

During the 20th century , architects and decorators have changed the use of the room . In most homes the parlor has been replaced by the living room .
The `` inner parlors '' in 1 Chronicles 28:11 in the Bible were the small rooms or chambers which Solomon built all round two sides and one end of the Temple -LRB- 1 Kings 6:5 -RRB- . Some people think the inner parlors may have been the porch and the holy place .
In modern use , the parlor is a formal sitting room in a large house or mansion .
The word parlor has even been used to describe a coffee shop as the `` coffee parlor . ''
It was generally in the west range of the buildings of the cloister , close to the main entrance .
In the late 19th century , it was often a formal room used only on Sundays or special occasions , and closed during the week .
Parlour -LRB- or parlor -RRB- , comes from the French word parloir , from parler , which means `` to speak '' .
In parts of Great Britain and the United States , parlor is a common name for certain types of restaurants such as `` ice cream parlor '' and `` pizza parlor '' . There are also `` Beer parlors '' , wine parlors , or , in at least one case , a `` spaghetti parlor . ''
The ` outer parlor ' was the room where the monks or nuns could meet a visitor and do business with people from outside the monastery .
The ` inner parlor ' was found off the cloister , next to the chapter house in the east range of the monastery .
In medieval Christian usage , the parlor was one of two rooms in a monastery .
The parlor is a room in a house where people could meet .
The family kept their best furniture , works of art and other things on display in the parlor .
Most religious orders wanted silence in the cloister , which was the place where the monks studied . The inner parlor was a place where the monks could talk without disturbing the others in the cloister .

In the United States Cinco de Mayo is more important than in Mexico .
Cinco de Mayo is celebrated by many Americans , not only by Americans of Mexican origin .
As far away as the island of Malta , in the Mediterranean Sea , revelers are encouraged to drink Mexican beer on May 5 .
Special events and celebrations highlight Mexican culture , especially its music and regional dancing .
Cinco de Mayo is also celebrated outside Mexico and the United States .
For example , a sky-diving club near Vancouver , Canada , holds a Cinco de Mayo skydiving event .
In the Mexican state of Puebla , Cinco de Mayo is celebrated because the Mexican army won the Battle of Puebla from the French army on May 5 , 1862 .
Many people display Cinco de Mayo banners while schools organise events to educate pupils about Mexico .
Cinco de Mayo is not Mexico 's Independence Day , the most important national holiday in Mexico .
Celebrations use both traditional Mexican symbols , like the Virgen de Guadalupe , and prominent figures with Mexican roots in the United States , including CÃ sar ChÃ vez .
Examples include baile folklÃ rico and mariachi demonstrations held every year at the Plaza del Pueblo de Los Angeles , near Olvera Street .
Cinco de Mayo is a regional holiday limited mostly to the state of Puebla .
It is a day to celebrate the culture and experiences of Americans of Mexican ancestry . This is in the same way as other holidays like St. Patrick 's Day , Oktoberfest , and the Chinese New Year are used to celebrate those of Irish , German , and Chinese ancestry .
In the Cayman Islands , in the Caribbean , there is an yearly Cinco de Mayo air guitar competition .

In essence , a change in the environment brings about a change in needs -LRB- besoins -RRB- , resulting in a change in behavior , bringing change in organ usage and development , bringing change in form over time â '' and thus the gradual transmutation -LRB- change -RRB- of the species .
However , as scientist historians such as Michael Ghiselin and Stephen Jay Gould have pointed out , none of these views were original to Lamarck .
The identification of `` Lamarckism '' with the inheritance of acquired characteristics alone is regarded by some as an over-simplification , rehashed in textbooks repeatedly .
Stephen Jay Gould wrote that late 19th century evolutionists `` re-read Lamarck , cast aside the guts of it ... and elevated one aspect of the mechanics â `` inheritance of acquired characters â `` to a central focus it never had for Lamarck himself '' .
Gould advocated defining `` Lamarckism '' more broadly , in line with Lamarck 's overall evolutionary theory .
He argued that `` the restriction of Lamarckism to this relatively small and non-distinctive corner of Lamarck 's thought must be labeled as more than a misnomer , and truly a discredit to the memory of a man and his much more comprehensive system '' .
On the contrary , Lamarck 's contribution was a systematic theoretical framework for understanding evolution .

They are contained within the middle ear space and serve to transmit sounds from the air to the fluid-filled labyrinth -LRB- cochlea -RRB- .
These are ossified -LRB- turned into bone -RRB- portions of cartilage -- called Meckel 's cartilage -- that are attached to the jaw .
These correspond to the quadrate , prearticular , articular , and angular structures in earlier land vertebrates .
The structure is known as the middle ear , and is made up of the incus , stapes , malleus , and tympanic membrane .
Studies have shown that ear bones in mammal embryos are attached to the dentary , which is part of the lower jaw .
Later in development , the bone structure breaks loose from the jaw and migrates to the inner ear area .
The terms mean hammer , anvil , and stirrup .
The absence of the auditory ossicles would constitute a moderate-to-severe hearing loss .
The ossicles are the three smallest bones in the human body .
The ossicles are , in order from the eardrum to the inner ear -LRB- from superficial to deep -RRB- , the malleus , incus , and stapes .
As the embryo develops , the cartilage hardens to form bone .
They may be called ear bones or auditory ossicles .

Gypsum is soft -LRB- -LRB- Mohs hardness 1.5 to 2 -RRB- . It can be easily scratched by a fingernail .
Gypsum is the alabaster of the present day ; calcite is generally the alabaster of the ancients .
Also , calcite effervesces when it is treated with hydrochloric acid . Gypsum does not .
They are attractive to look at . Both have been used for making a variety of artworks and objects , especially small carvings .
Alabaster is a name applied to varieties of two distinct minerals . Gypsum is a hydrous sulfate of calcium , and calcite is a carbonate of calcium .

Kaltag has a week long Stick Dance Festival every two years that draws visitors from many other villages .
In 1900 there were 46 steamboats on the river .
A trading post opened around 1880 . There was a gold rush in 1884-85 .
By 1906 , most of the people looking gold had left for Fairbanks or Nome . The Galena lead mines opened 1919 .
Salmon , whitefish , moose , bear , waterfowl and berries are the main foods .
In 1839 smallpox killed many of the people who lived in the area .
Kaltag was down the river from the mines and grew as a point on the transportation route for the mines .
Most of the people in Kaltag live by hunting and fishing .
Measles and food shortages during 1900 reduced the population of the area by one-third .
It is on an old walking track which led west through the mountains to Unalakleet .
The village of Kaltag began after this when the people who were left in three nearby villages moved to the area .
The first people to live in the area were the Koyokon people , part of the Athabascan nation . They used Kaltag as a cemetery for surrounding villages .
This festival is held by relatives of people who have died , to thank those who helped during their time of mourning .
The Russians named Kaltag after a Koyokon man named Kaltaga .

The Carpathians begin on the Danube near Bratislava .

A major part of the western and northeastern Outer Carpathians in Poland , Ukraine and Slovakia is traditionally called Beskids .
The Carpathians are separated from the Alps by the Danube .

In computing , an arithmetic logic unit -LRB- ALU -RRB- is a digital circuit that performs arithmetic and logical operations .
The ALU is one of basic building block of the central processing unit -LRB- CPU -RRB- of a computer , even the simplest microcontrollers contain one for purposes such as timing .
Linux distributions are made of the Linux kernel and a collection of applications .
The operating system will be made up of the Linux kernel and , usually , a set of libraries and utilities from the GNU project , with graphics that come from the X Window System .
People who used computers wanted to use Linux distributions as replacements to Microsoft Windows operating systems on the PC , Mac OS on the Apple Macintosh and proprietary versions of Unix .
SLS was not well-maintained , so Patrick Volkerding created a distribution based on SLS , which he called Slackware ; released July 16 , 1993 .
Examples of packages include a collection of fonts , or a web browser .
Most of those are in still in development , being improved and changed constantly .
Distributions are normally split into packages .
Distributions that are made to be small may not contain X , but use small window systems like busybox , uclibc or dietlibc .
There are more than three hundred Linux distributions .
Linux distributions started to form after the Linux kernel was starting to be used by people outside the original Linux programmers .
Before the first Linux distributions , a Linux user needed to be a Unix expert , knowing what libraries and executables that were needed to get the system to boot and run .
Each package has a certain application or service .

Charlemagne did intervene in church affairs , not always successfully .
Leo , on December 23 , took an oath of purgation concerning the charges brought against him , and his opponents were exiled .
Leo reported his election to Charlemagne , sent him the keys of Saint Peter 's tomb and the banner of Rome .
The reasons for the coronation , the involvement beforehand of the Frankish court , and the relationship to the Byzantine Empire are all matters of debate among historians .
Charlemagne went to Rome in November 800 , and on December 1 held a council there with representatives of both sides .
Two days later Leo crowned Charlemagne at St. Peter 's tomb .
Leo III -LRB- died June 12 , 816 -RRB- was Pope from 795 to 816 .
Charlemagne replied that it was his function to defend the church and the Pope 's to pray for the kingdom and for victory of the army .

Each lichen is a flat patch bordered by a black line of spores .
If the growth rate is known , the maximum lichen size will give a minimum age for when this rock was deposited .
Map lichen is a lichen widely used by climatologists to determine the relative age of deposits .
Growth rates for different areas and species can be obtained by measuring maximum lichen sizes on substrates of known age , such as gravestones , historic or prehistoric rock buildings , or moraines of known age -LRB- e.g those deposited during the Little Ice Age -RRB- .
Lichenometry is based on the assumption that the largest lichen growing on a rock is the oldest individual .
These patches grow next to each other . This makes the lichen look like a map or a patchwork field .
The map lichen is a species of lichen , Rhizocarpon geographicum . It grows on rocks in areas of low air pollution .
The process is called lichenometry .
A theory about white holes is that they act as an exit for matter sucked in by a black hole , suggesting that black holes are a type of teleporter -LRB- something that can transport objects instantly without traveling through space -RRB- . The black and white holes are connected by a wormhole -LRB- see diagram -RRB- .
In astrophysics , a white hole is the opposite of a black hole .

From Texas the Orbitron was traded to a carnival owner in Ciudad JuÃ rez , Chihuahua , Mexico in 1991 .
The car , which used to be painted blue , had been spray painted in black and was almost complete except for the hood , the television , the fur lining , the cut-off nose and the bubble top . The top had to be destroyed in the early 1970s when it became stuck and trapped someone inside .
The Orbitron is a custom car built by Ed Roth . It was lost for many years until it was found again in Mexico in 2007 .
The original Chevrolet engine with its very special carburetors and Chevrolet Corvette aluminum valve covers has been rebuilt and put back in the Orbitron .
A small tape recorder and tape were found hidden in the cockpit . This was played when the car was new .
It was then sold to Beau Boeckmann , the host of the TV show `` Pimp My Ride . '' He fully restored the Orbitron in 100 days .
It is on the cover of the March 2009 edition of Hot Rod Deluxe , a `` retro '' version of Hot Rod Magazine .
Michael Lightbourn , a man who restores old cars , heard that the Orbitron was in Ciudad JuÃ rez . He discovered it parked in front of an adult bookstore where it was in very poor shape and was being used as a trash can .
Planet Plastics of Chino , California , the original company which made the bubble top , was asked to create a replacement .
Little bits of the car 's original `` candy blue '' color -LRB- similar to a very fancy color called `` candy apple red '' -RRB- were found inside the car .
All the original parts which could not be used and which Mr. Boeckmann removed from the car , including the frame which was too rusted to reuse , were stored away .
The family who owned the bookstore had also owned the carnival in which the car was used .
It had three red , green and blue tinted headlamps .

Pholus was the second Centaur type asteroid to be found and was quickly found to be very red in color . Because it 's very red , it is sometimes called `` Big Red '' .
Astronomers think the color is because of organic compounds on its surface .
Unlike the first Centaur , 2060 Chiron , Pholus has shown no signs of cometary activity .
Close approaches of the object are not common : it has not come within one astronomical unit -LRB- about 150 million km -RRB- of a planet since 764 BC , and will not again until 5290 .
Astronomers think that Pholus ' diameter is about 185 Â 16 km .
Astronomers think that Pholus started out as a Kuiper belt object .
It was found by David L. Rabinowitz , then of the University of Arizona 's Spacewatch Project , and named after Pholus , the brother of the mythological Chiron , after which 2060 Chiron was named to follow the tradition of naming this class of outer planet crossing objects after Centaurs .
5145 Pholus is a Centaur -LRB- minor planetoid -RRB- of the solar system running in a stretched orbit , with a perihelion -LRB- closest approach to the Sun -RRB- less than Saturn 's and aphelion -LRB- farthest approach from the Sun -RRB- farther than Neptune 's .

`` Banyan '' often refers to the Indian Banyan or Ficus benghalensis , the National tree of India . The term actually includes all figs which share their epiphytic life cycle .
Any Ficus species showing this habit may be termed a strangler fig .
Like other Fig species -LRB- which includes the common edible fig Ficus carica -RRB- , banyans have unique fruit structures and are dependent on fig wasps for reproduction .
As the leaf develops the scales fall .
The seeds germinate and send down roots towards the ground . These roots may envelop -LRB- cover -RRB- part of the host tree or building structure , when they get the casual name of `` strangler fig '' .
The leaves of Banyan tree are large , leathery , glossy green and elliptical in shape .
Young leaves have an attractive reddish tinge .
Like most of the fig-trees , the leaf bud is covered by two large scales .
The seeds of banyans are dispersed by fruit-eating birds .
Old trees can spread out laterally using these prop roots to cover a wide area .
The `` strangling '' growth habit is found in a number of tropical forest species , particularly of the genus Ficus , that compete for light .
Older banyan trees have aerial prop roots that grow into thick woody trunks which , with age , can become indistinguishable from the main trunk .

This meeting then added the Canons of Dort to two other documents , the Belgic Confession and the Heidelberg Catechism , which were both commonly used by the Dutch Church at this time .
From 1618 to 1619 , the Dutch government , acting for the Dutch Reformed Church , called a series of meetings that would come to be called the Synod of Dort .
Members from the Netherlands and twenty-seven members from eight other countries met at this Synod to discuss and come to an agreement on their views . This agreement is known as the `` Canons of Dort . ''
The Three Forms of Unity is the name that is given to the Belgic Confession , the Canons of Dort , and the Heidelberg Catechism . These three works , that are about the doctrinal concerns of Continental Calvinism , are considered official statements of Church doctrine by many of the Reformed churches .
The Council of Constance was a council in the 15th century . It was held between 1414 and 1418 .
The thorax is a part of an animal 's body that is between the head and the abdomen .
It starts from the neck and stop at the diaphragm .
In mammals , the parts that make up the thorax are the sternum , the thoracic vertebrae and the ribs .

Mussaurus -LRB- meaning `` mouse lizard '' -RRB- was a small , early , plant-eating prosauropod dinosaur that lived in southern Argentina during the Late Triassic Period , about 215 million years ago .
It gets its name from the small size of the skeletons discovered so far .

He concluded that people apply the term game to a range of different human activities that are only related a little bit .
Ludwig Wittgenstein was probably the first academic philosopher to address the definition of the word game .
In his Philosophical Investigations , Wittgenstein demonstrated that the elements -LRB- parts -RRB- of games , such as play , rules , and competition , all fail to correctly define what games are .
Crawford 's definition may thus be rendered as : an interactive , goal-oriented activity , active agents to play against , in which players -LRB- including active agents -RRB- can interfere with each other .
Its relative minor is -LRB- -LRB- A-sharp minor A minor -RRB- -RRB- , and its parallel minor is -LRB- -LRB- C-sharp minor C minor -RRB- -RRB- .
When a harp is tuned to C-sharp major , it has all its pedals in the bottom position .
Most composers prefer to use the enharmonic equivalent D-flat major because it has just five flats . However , Johann Sebastian Bach actually chose C-sharp major for Prelude and Fugue No. 3 in both books of the Well-Tempered Clavier .
Louis Vierne used C-sharp major in the final piece of Messe solennelle .
In Hungarian Rhapsody No. 6 , Franz Liszt changes key from D-flat major to C-sharp major near the beginning of the piece .
Its enharmonic equivalent is -LRB- -LRB- D-flat major D major -RRB- -RRB- .
Maurice Ravel used C-sharp major as the tonic key of Ondine from his piano suite Gaspard de la nuit .

Of all the twelve trials , this was the one that lasted longest and ended last .
The Ministries Trial -LRB- or , officially , The United States of America vs. Ernst von WeizsÃ cker , et al . -RRB- was the eleventh of the twelve trials for war crimes the US authorities held in their occupation zone in Germany in Nuremberg after the end of World War II .
The indictment was filed on November 15 , 1947 ; the hearings lasted from January 6 , 1948 until November 18 that year , and then the judges took a whole five months to compile their 833-page judgment , which they presented on April 11 , 1949 .
The defendants in this case were officials of various Reich ministries , facing various charges for their jobs in Nazi Germany and responsibility for the numerous atrocities committed both in Germany and in occupied countries during the war .
Of the 21 defendants arraigned , two were acquitted , the others were found guilty on at least one count of the indictment and received prison sentences ranging from three years including time served to 25 years ' imprisonment .
The Chief of Counsel for the Prosecution was Telford Taylor ; the chief prosecutor was Robert Kempner .
Herbert Ernst Backe , the former minister for agriculture who should also have been tried , committed suicide on April 6 , 1947 while in custody awaiting the trial .
The judges in this case , heard before Military Tribunal IV , were William C. Christianson -LRB- presiding judge -RRB- from Minnesota , Robert F. Maguire from Oregon , and Leon W. Powers from Iowa .
This case is also known as the Wilhelmstrasse Trial , because the German Foreign Office was on the Wilhelmstrasse in Berlin .
These twelve trials are known as the `` Subsequent Nuremberg Trials '' or , more formally , as the `` Trials of War Criminals before the Nuremberg Military Tribunals '' -LRB- NMT -RRB- .
The sentences were handed down on April 13 , 1949 .
Stuckart was tried again in 1950 before a denazification court and sentenced as a MitlÃ ufer -LRB- follower -RRB- a fine of DM 50,000 .

Fort Meade is a city of Florida in the United States .
Any problem that is in NP can be changed so that to the Boolean satisfiability theorem . On a deterministic Turing machine this takes polynomial time .
An important consequence of the theorem is that if there exists a deterministic polynomial time algorithm for solving Boolean satisfiability , then there exists a deterministic polynomial time algorithm for solving all problems in NP .
The Cookâ `` Levin theorem is a theorem from theoretical computer science , which says that the Boolean satisfiability problem is NP-complete .
The question of whether such an algorithm exists is called the P versus NP problem and it is widely considered the most important unsolved problem in theoretical computer science .

Banksia is a genus of plants common to Australia , they were named after Joseph Banks . The Banksia are noted for there unique flowering .
As Australian wildflowers and popular garden plants , they are easily recognized by their characteristic flower spikes and fruiting `` cones '' and can vary from woody shrubs to trees up to 30 metres tall .
They are an important food source for all sorts of nectariferous animals , including birds , bats , rats , possums and a host of invertebrates .
Heavy producers of nectar , banksias form a vital part of the food chain in the Australian bush .

This show and Teletubbies are remarkably similar -LRB- For example , both have a `` science fiction '' theme -RRB- .

The Pale Kangaroo Mouse burrows only in fine sand , while the Dark Kangaroo Mouse prefers fine , gravelly soils but may also burrow in sand or sandy soil .
A kangaroo mouse is either one of the two species of jumping mouse -LRB- genus Microdipodops -RRB- native to the deserts of the Southwestern United States . Most of them can be found in the state of Nevada .
Kangaroo mice are nocturnal , and are most active in the two hours following sunset .
The kangaroo mice are closely related to the kangaroo rats , which belong to the same subfamily , Dipodomyinae .
Interestingly , the mouse never drinks water , instead deriving it metabolically from the foods it eats .
They are believed to hibernate during cold weather .
The kangaroo mouse collects food and maintains large stocks in their burrows . These burrows are excavated to a length of between 3 and 8 feet -LRB- 1 to 2.5 meters -RRB- .
The name `` kangaroo mouse '' refers to the species ' extraordinary jumping ability , as well as its habit of bipedal locomotion .
The burrow , the entrance to which the mouse covers during daylight hours , is also used to raise litters of between 2 and 7 young .
The Dark Kangaroo Mouse is also known to feed occasionally on insects and carrion .
Both species of kangaroo mouse live in sandy desert ecosystems . They forage for seeds and vegetation amongst the scrub brush of their native habitat .
The two species are :

Motor Racing Developments Ltd. , commonly known as Brabham , was a British company that built racing cars . It also ran a racing team in Formula One .
Ecclestone sold the team in 1988 .
British businessman Bernie Ecclestone owned Brabham during most of the 1970s and 1980s , and later become responsible for administrating the commercial aspects of Formula One .
The team won two more Formula One drivers ' championships in the 1980s with Brazilian Nelson Piquet , and became the first to win a drivers ' championship with a turbocharged car .
In the 1970s and 1980s , Brabham introduced innovations such as the controversial but successful ` fan car ' , in-race refuelling , carbon brakes , and hydropneumatic suspension .

ChessBase GmbH is a German company that markets chess software . It also has a chess news website , and uses a server for online chess .
Anoxic events occur when the Earth 's oceans become completely depleted of oxygen -LRB- O2 -RRB- below the surface levels .
Although anoxic events have not happened for millions of years , the geological record shows that they happened many times in the past .
There are several places on earth today that show the features of anoxic events on a localized level .
` Dead zones ' exist off the East Coast of the United States in the Chesapeake Bay , in the Scandinavian strait Kattegat , the Black Sea , in the northern Adriatic and off the coast of Louisiana .
It is believed oceanic anoxic events are strongly linked to climate warming and greenhouse gases .
They may be called Oceanic anoxic events or Deep ocean anoxic events .
Anoxic events may have caused mass extinctions .
Typically , oceanic anoxic events last for under half a million years , before a full recovery .
These mass extinctions were so characteristic that they have been used by geologists as markers in biostratigraphic dating .
He was Lord Chancellor , once from June 1475 to September 1475 and then again from October 1485 to March 1487 .
John Alcock -LRB- c. 1430 â `` 1 October 1500 -RRB- was an English churchman .
Alcock died on 1 October 1500 and lies buried in the Alcock Chantry in Ely Cathedral .
He founded a charity at Beverley and a grammar school at Kingston upon Hull , he restored many churches and colleges ; but his greatest achievement was the building of Jesus College , Cambridge .
Alcock was one of the leading pre-Reformation churchman ; he was a man of deep learning and also a great architect .
He became Bishop of Rochester on 15 March , Bishop of Worcester on 15 July 1476 and of Ely on 6 October 1486 .
In 1461 he was made dean of Westminster , and his subsequent promotion was rapid in both church and state .
He was born at Beverley in Yorkshire , son of Sir William Alcock , Burgess of Kingston upon Hull and educated at Cambridge .
In 1461 he was made Master of the Rolls , and in 1470 was sent as ambassador to the court of Castile .
Campton is a city of Kentucky in the United States .
Since 1980 , the chert has been examined by the MÃ 1\/4 nster group , and from 1987 by Aberdeen University . They showed the chert was indeed produced by a hot spring setting .
They showed the chert was indeed produced by a hot spring setting . Cores were drilled in 1988 and 1997 .
The chert was formed when silica-rich water from volcanic springs rose and rapidly petrified the early terrestrial ecosystem in situ . Organisms are petrified that way by hot springs today , although that quality of preservation has not been found in recent deposits .
The chert is exposed near the village of Rhynie , Aberdeenshire , Scotland . A second unit , the Windyfield chert , is located some 700 m away .
Hot springs , with temperatures between 90 t , were active ; the water had probably cooled to under 30 C before it reached the fossilised organisms .
The Rhynie chert is an Lower Devonian sedimentary deposit , part of the Old Red Sandstone . It has extraordinary fossil details , and is a LagerstÃ tte .
The chert was discovered by William Mackie while mapping the western margin of the Rhynie basin in 1910 â `` 1913 .
The deposits are interbedded with sands , shales and tuffs , which speaks of local volcanic activity .
Deposition was very rapid .
The Rhynie chert contains exceptionally preserved plant , fungus , lichen and animal material preserved in place by an overlying volcanic deposit .
The oldest known insect -LRB- Rhyniognatha hirsti -RRB- , which resembles the modern springtails , was found in the Rhynie chert , pushing dates for the origination of insects back to the Silurian period .

The Piperaceae , also known as the pepper family , is a large family of flowering plants .
The vast majority of peppers can be found within the two main genera : Piper -LRB- 2000 species -RRB- and Peperomia -LRB- 1600 species -RRB- .
The group contains roughly 3,610 currently accepted species in five genera .

Mikhail Vasilyevich Nesterov -LRB- , Ufa â `` October 18 , 1942 , Moscow -RRB- was a Russian painter . He was a very important painter for religious Symbolism in Russian art .
From 1890 to 1910 , Nesterov lived in Kiev and St Petersburg , working on frescoes in St. Vladimir 's Cathedral and the Church on Spilt Blood , respectively .
As a devout Orthodox Christian , he did not accept the Bolshevik Revolution but remained in Russia until his death , painting the portraits of Ivan Ilyin , Ivan Pavlov , Otto Schmidt , and Vera Mukhina , among others .
His canvas The Vision of the Youth Bartholomew -LRB- 1890 â `` 91 -RRB- is often considered to mark the inauguration of the Russian Symbolist movement . This painting shows the conversion of Sergii Radonezhsky .

Ferdinand attempted to retain the regency permanently , but was rebuffed by the Castilian nobility and replaced with Joanna 's husband , who became Philip I of Castile .
The succession of his grandson Charles , who inherited not only the Spanish lands of his maternal grandparents , but the Habsburg and Burgundian lands of his paternal family , would make his heirs the most powerful rulers on the continent .
He married Infanta Isabella , the sister by a different mother and heiress of Henry IV of Castile , on October 19 , 1469 in OcaÃ a. He became Ferdinand V of Castile when Isabella succeeded her brother as Queen of Castile in 1474 .
Instead , the Holy League was formed , in which all the powers now joined together against France .
In November 1511 Ferdinand and his son-in-law Henry VIII of England signed the Treaty of Westminster , pledging mutual aid between the two against France .
After Philip 's death in 1506 , with Joanna mentally unstable , and her and Philip 's son Charles of Ghent only six years old , Ferdinand resumed the regency , ruling through Francisco Cardinal Jimenez de Cisneros , the Chancellor of the Kingdom .
Ferdinand served as the latter 's regent during her absence in the Netherlands , ruled by her husband Archduke Philip .
Another less famous `` conquest '' took place in 1502 , when Andreas Paleologus , de jure Emperor of the Eastern Roman Empire , left Ferdinand and Isabella as heirs to the empire , thus Ferdinand became de jure Roman Emperor .
Although the French were victorious against Venice at the Battle of Agnadello , the League soon fell apart , as both the Pope and Ferdinand became suspicious of French intentions .
The agreement soon fell apart , and over the next several years , Ferdinand 's great general Gonzalo FernÃ ndez de CÃ rdoba conquered Naples from the French , by 1504 .
The latter part of Ferdinand 's life was largely taken up with the so-called Italian Wars , disputes over control of Italy with successive Kings of France .
In 1494 , Charles VIII of France invaded Italy and expelled Ferdinand 's cousin , Alfonso II , from the throne of Naples .
The Holy League was generally successful in Italy , as well , driving the French from Milan , which was restored to its Sforza dukes by the peace treaty in 1513 .
After Isabella 's death , her kingdom went to her daughter Joanna .
Ferdinand 's alliance with various Italian princes and with Emperor Maximilian I , expelled the French by 1496 and installed Alfonso 's son , Ferdinand , on the Neapolitan throne .
The French were successful in reconquering Milan two years later , however .
In 1508 , war resumed in Italy , this time against Venice . All the other powers on the peninsula , including Louis XII , Ferdinand , Maximilian , and Pope Julius II joined together against as the League of Cambrai .
Ferdinand succeeded his father as King of Aragon in 1479 and the Crown of Castile and the various territories of the Crown of Aragon were united in a personal union . For the first time since the 8th century this created a single political unit which might be called Spain , although the various territories were not properly administered as a single unit until the 18th century .
Ferdinand II the Catholic -LRB- Spanish : Fernando V de Castilla -RRB- -LRB- March 10 , 1452 â `` June 23 , 1516 -RRB- was king of Aragon -LRB- 1479-1516 -RRB- , Castile , Sicily -LRB- 1468-1516 -RRB- , Naples -LRB- 1504-1516 -RRB- , Valencia , Sardinia and Navarre and Count of Barcelona .
Earlier that year , Ferdinand had conquered the southern half of the Kingdom of Navarre , which was ruled by a French nobleman , and annexed it to Spain .
In 1501 , following the death of Ferdinand II of Naples and his succession by his uncle Frederick , Ferdinand of Aragon signed an agreement with Charles VIII 's successor , Louis XII . Louis had just successfully asserted his claims to the Duchy of Milan , and they agreed to partition Naples between them , with Campania and the Abruzzi , including Naples itself , going to the French and Ferdinand taking Apulia and Calabria .
The two young monarchs had initially to fight a civil war against Juana , princess of Castile -LRB- also known as Juana la Beltraneja -RRB- , the purported daughter of Henry IV .

That plant has a completely different taste . This is because phenolic compounds are missing in its essential oil .
Some breeds show a flavor intermediate between oregano and marjoram .
Additionally , oregano has shown antimicrobial activity against food-borne pathogens such as Listeria monocytogenes -LRB- PMID 16218659 -RRB- .
The taste varies in intensity ; good quality is so strong that it almost numbs the tongue , but the cultivars adapted to colder climates have often unsatisfactory flavor .
Oregano is high in antioxidant activity , because of a high content of phenolic acids and flavonoids -LRB- PMID 16218659 , PMID 12730411 -RRB- .

The class of drugs containing Amphetamine includes prescription drugs commonly used to treat attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder -LRB- ADHD -RRB- .
These drugs increase the level of dopamine and norepinephrine in the brain , which can create euphoria .
It is also used to treat symptoms of traumatic brain injury -LRB- TBI -RRB- and the daytime drowsiness symptoms of narcolepsy , amongst others .
The name amphetamine is derived from its chemical name : alpha-methylphenethylamine .
The European Monitoring Centre for Drugs and Drug Addiction reports the typical retail price of amphetamine in Europe varied between â 3 and â 15 -LRB- $ 4 to $ 21.55 USD -RRB- a gram in half of the reporting countries .

Parallel computer programs are more difficult to program than sequential ones , because concurrency introduces several new classes of potential software bugs , of which race conditions and dead locks are the most common .
It has been used for many years , mainly in high-performance computing , with a great increase in its use in recent years , due to the physical constraints preventing frequency scaling .
Parallel computers can be classified according to the level at which the hardware supports parallelismâ '' with multi-core and multi-processor computers having multiple processing elements inside a single machine , while clusters , blades , MPPs , and grids use multiple computers to work on the same task .
Parallel computing has become the main model in computer architecture , mainly in the form of multicore processors . However , in recent years , power consumption by parallel computers has become a concern .
But still Communication and synchronization between the different subtasks is difficult while achieving good parallel program performance .
Parallel computing is a form of computation in which many instructions are carried out simultaneously -LRB- termed `` in parallel '' -RRB- , depending on the theory that large problems can often be divided into smaller ones , and then solved concurrently -LRB- `` in parallel '' -RRB- .

In the Caspian provinces of Gilan and Mazandaran , several types of roe are used .
Herring roe is sold in many British supermarkets but it is not very popular .
Called Ashpal or Ashbal , roe can be eaten grilled , cured , salted , or mixed with other things .
The roe is usually deep-fried . Other ways of cooking it such as mashed roe where the roe crushed along with oil , onion & pepper , or curry of roe could also be found .
If salted or cured , it is eaten as a condiment .
Roe from Carp is less common and Barbel roe is also used at times .
Another commonly eaten roe is that from the cod -LRB- torsk -RRB- .
Caviar is a name for sturgeon roe which is eaten as a delicacy .
Roe eaten in the United Kingdom is usually soft roe instead of hard roe .
In the state of Kerala , roe is deep fried in coconut oil and is a delicacy .
Smoked and salted cod roe paste is very popular in Sweden .
Among the tribal populace , deeply-roasted roe in open fire -LRB- much like marshmallows -RRB- is a delicacy .
Soft roe or white roe is not roe .
In this region , the roe of rohu is also delicacy .
Roe from the Hilsa fish is a delicacy in West Bengal and Bangladesh .
Roe from Kutum -LRB- also known as Caspian White Fish or Rutilus Frisii Kutum -RRB- , Roach -LRB- called `` Kuli '' in Gileki -RRB- , Bream -LRB- called `` Kulmeh '' in Gileki -RRB- , and Caspian Salmon are liked very much .
Bottarga is the salted and dried roe pouch of Gray Mullet .
Lumpfish -LRB- stenbider -RRB- roe is used in Danish cuisine . It is served on top of halved or sliced hard-boiled eggs , on top of piles of shrimp , or with other fish or seafood .
Roe is the ripe eggs of fish and certain marine animals , for example sea urchins , shrimp and scallop .
Battered cod roe can also be bought within many fish and chip shops , mainly around the London area .
Tarama is carp roe used to make taramosalata . Taramosolata is a Greek and Turkish food that is made of tarama mixed with lemon juice , bread crumbs , onions , and olive oil .
If used fresh , it is usually grilled , steamed , or mixed with eggs and fried to make a custard-like dish called `` Ashpal Kuku '' .
Dennis Brain -LRB- born 17 May 1921 ; died London , 1 September 1957 -RRB- was a British horn player .
Brain was made principal horn player in both .
The trio toured Scotland twice and there were plans to tour Australia in the winter of 1957 .
He was still only 24 .
By 1945 , Brain was the most famous horn player in England .
Later , he left the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra because he did not have time .
He kept up his organ playing -LRB- his teacher had hoped he would become an organist -RRB- and in July 1954 , again conducted by Karajan , Brain performed the organ part in a recording of the Easter hymn from Pietro Mascagni 's Cavalleria rusticana .
In November 1953 Brain recorded the Mozart Horn Concertos Nos. 1 â `` 4 for EMI with the Philharmonia Orchestra with Karajan conducting .
Brain often asked composers to write new works for him to perform .
Dennis played a Leopold Mozart horn concerto by blowing through rubber hose pipes . He cut the hose to the length he needed with garden shears so that it was perfectly in tune .
In 1955 Brain became known to millions of people when he presented a radio program called The Early Horn .
At first he played a French instrument , a Raoux piston-valve horn , similar to that used by his father .
His recordings include the four horn concertos by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart which he recorded with the Philharmonia Orchestra conducted by Herbert von Karajan .
This group got bigger and toured to Germany , Italy and Austria .
Among them were Benjamin Britten Serenade for Tenor , Horn and Strings , Canticle III , Malcolm Arnold Horn Concerto No. 2 , Paul Hindemith Concerto for Horn and Orchestra , York Bowen Concerto for Horn , Strings and Timpani , Peter Racine Fricker Horn Sonata -LRB- Dennis was at school with Peter -RRB- , Gordon Jacob Concerto for Horn and String Orchestra , MÃ tyÃ s Seiber Notturno for Horn and Strings , Humphrey Searle Aubade for Horn and Strings , Ernest Tomlinson Rhapsody and Rondo for Horn and Orchestra , Romance and Rondo for Horn and Orchestra , Lennox Berkeley Trio for Horn , Violin and Piano and Elisabeth Lutyens .
He was the second to perform the Horn Concerto No. 2 in public in 1948 .
His Alexander horn was badly damaged in his fatal crash . Normally it would have been thrown away , but it was saved and was restored by Paxmans of London and can be seen in the Royal Academy of Music 's free museum .
His Mozart recordings inspired Flanders and Swann 's Ill Wind and his classical playing .
Many composers wrote for him without even being asked .
Brain also started a trio with the pianist Wilfrid Parry and violinist Jean Pougnet .
Brain played a lot of chamber music , forming a wind quintet with his brother in 1946 .
Brain also made the two horn concertos by Richard Strauss very popular .

The British Rail Class 37 is a diesel-electric locomotive .
It is also known as the English Electric Type 3 . The Class was ordered as part of the British Rail modernisation plan .
They also performed well on secondary and inter-regional services for many years .
The Class 37 is known by railway enthusiasts as a `` Tractor '' . This nickname came from the similarity of the sound of the locomotive .
The Class 37 became a familiar sight on many parts of the British Rail network . They were on Inter-City services in East Anglia and within Scotland .
Amir Abdollah Muhammad Mu ` izzi -LRB- 1048-1125 -RRB- was an 11th century and 12th century poet .
He lived in the courts of Malik Shah I and Sultan Sanjar .
He was from Persia , and was the poet laureate of Sanjar .
He was accidentally shot by Sanjar .
His divan of 18,000 distichs remain .
He was from the village of Nisa . He is considered one of the great masters of the Persian panegyric qasideh .
Mu ` izzi is said to have died by an arrow shot by the King 's son in 1125 for unknown reasons .

The visible-wavelength -LRB- 0.435-0 .925 micron -RRB- spectra data was gathered between August 1993 and March 1999 .
It was named in honor of Adolf Berberich -LRB- 1861-1920 -RRB- , a German astronomer .

776 Berbericia is a minor planet orbiting the Sun in the asteroid belt .

Karl Arnold -LRB- born 21 March 1901 in HerrlishÃ fen , died 29 June 1958 in DÃ 1\/4 sseldorf -RRB- was a German politician .
On 29 January 1946 Arnold was appointed mayor of DÃ 1\/4 sseldorf by the American Military Government . He was elected mayor in the first free elections on 26 October 1946 .
He became Secretary of the DÃ 1\/4 sseldorf District of the Christian trade union in 1924 .
Karl Arnold was buried in DÃ 1\/4 sseldorf 's South Cemetery .
He was Minister President of North Rhine-Westphalia from 1947 to 1956 .

Al-Majid was captured after the 2003 invasion of Iraq and was charged with war crimes , crimes against humanity and genocide .
Repressive measures included deportations of the population and mass killings ; al-Majid was dubbed `` Chemical Ali '' by Iraqi Kurds for his use of chemical weapons in attacks against them .
He was convicted in June 2007 and was sentenced to death for crimes committed in the al-Anfal campaign of the 1980s .
He was a first cousin to the President of Iraq Saddam Hussein . During the 1980s and 1990s , he became notorious for his role in the Iraqi government 's campaigns against internal opposition forces , namely the ethnic Kurdish rebels of the north , and the Shia religious dissidents of the south .
He was also the governor of occupied Kuwait during the Gulf War .
Ali Hassan Abd al-Majid al-Tikritieh -LRB- , 30 November 1941 â `` 25 January 2010 -RRB- was an Iraqi minister .
However , the prevalence and importance of HGT in the evolution of multicellular eukaryotes remain unclear '' .
In the mid-1980s , Syvanen predicted that lateral gene transfer existed , had biological significance , and was involved in shaping evolutionary history from the beginning of life on Earth .
However , Richardson and Palmer -LRB- 2007 -RRB- state : `` Horizontal gene transfer -LRB- HGT -RRB- has played a major role in bacterial evolution and is fairly common in certain unicellular eukaryotes .
As Bapteste et al . -LRB- 2005 -RRB- observe , `` additional evidence suggests that gene transfer might also be an important evolutionary mechanism in protist evolution '' .
As Jain , Rivera and Lake -LRB- 1999 -RRB- put it : `` Increasingly , studies of genes and genomes are indicating that considerable horizontal transfer has occurred between prokaryotes '' .
Most thinking in genetics has focused on vertical transfer , but there is a growing awareness that horizontal gene transfer is a significant phenomenon . Amongst single-celled organisms it may be the dominant form of genetic transfer .
Artificial horizontal gene transfer is a form of genetic engineering .
Horizontal gene transfer -LRB- HGT -RRB- -LRB- or Lateral gene transfer -RRB- is any process in which an organism gets genetic material from another organism without being the offspring of that organism .
There is some evidence that even higher plants and animals have been affected and this has raised concerns for safety .
By contrast , vertical transfer occurs when an organism gets genetic material from its ancestor , e.g. , its parent or a species from which it has evolved .
Horizontal gene transfer was first described in Japan in a 1959 publication that demonstrated the transfer of antibiotic resistance between different species of bacteria .
The phenomenon appears to have had some significance for unicellular eukaryotes as well .

There is a tendency for males to be larger than the females
Species of forest , woodland , or bush tend to be sedentary , but many of the plains species undertake huge migrations .
Many antelope are sexually dimorphic .
A group of antelope is called a herd .
The gnus and gazelles of East Africa perform some of the most impressive mass migratory circuits of all mammals .
No antelope are native to North America : the Pronghorn is a member of the family Antilocapridae , another family .
These migrations enable grass-eating species to follow the rains and therefore their food supply .
True antelope have horns which are unbranched and never shed , while Pronghorns have branching horns , and shed annually .
There are 91 species of antelope , most of which are native to Africa , in about 30 genera .
It includes the old-world species which are not cattle , sheep , buffalo , bison , or goats .
In most species , both sexes have horns , but those of males tend to be larger .

Bosons are different from Fermions , which are particles that make up matter , because they obey Bose-Einstein statistics .
The three gauge bosons are as follows : photons for electromagnetism , gluons for strong force , and W and Z bosons for weak force .
Bosons are named after a man called Satyendra Nath Bose .
The British Rail Class 35 is a class of mixed traffic B-B diesel locomotive with hydraulic transmission .
On account of their Mekydro-design hydraulic transmission units , the design became known as the Hymeks .
Their early withdrawal was caused , primarily , by BR classifying the hydraulic transmission as non-standard .
Four examples survived into preservation .
Withdrawal from service began in 1971 , and by 1975 all had been withdrawn .
None of the class was named .
One hundred and one of the class were built between 1961 and 1964 when it became apparent that there was a requirement for a medium power diesel-hydraulic design for both secondary passenger work and freight duties .
They were allocated to Bristol Bath Road , Cardiff Canton and Old Oak Common .
The type was developed for the Western Region of British Railways , which had opted for lightweight locomotives with hydraulic transmission when allocated funds under the British Railways Modernisation Plan of 1955 .

Theodor Holm Nelson -LRB- Ted Nelson , born 1937 -RRB- is an American sociologist , philosopher , and pioneer of information technology .
He coined the terms `` hypertext '' and `` hypermedia '' in 1963 and published it in 1965 .
The word suggests the society-of-text envisioned by theorists like Shoshana Zuboff and Jay David Bolter , a writing space in which traces of authority persist only as local and contingent effects , the social equivalent of the deconstructed author-function .
-- Ted Nelson -LRB- Ted Nelson one-liners -RRB-
In 2007 he celebrated his 70th birthday by giving an invited birthday lecture at the University of Southampton .
Nelson started Project Xanadu in 1960 .
Ted Nelson is currently working on a new information structure , ZigZag . More information about ZigZag is on the Xanadu project website .
The anime Serial Experiments Lain cites Project Xanadu as a precursor to The Wired -LRB- a fictional internet-like communications network and augmented reality system -RRB- and mentions Nelson as the originator of hypertext .
He has spent much of his adult life working on Project Xanadu and telling people about its benefits .
He wrote about the project in his books Computer Lib\/Dream Machines -LRB- 1974 -RRB- and Literary Machines -LRB- 1981 -RRB- .
A `` populite '' culture might mark the first step toward realization of Jean-Francois Lyotard 's `` game of perfect information '' where all have equal access to the world of data , and where '' -LRB- g -RRB- iven equal competence -LRB- no longer in the acquisition of knowledge , but in its production -RRB- , what extra performativity depends on in the final analysis is ` imagination , ' which allows one either to make a new move or change the rules of the game . ''
Nelson earned a Bachelor 's degree in philosophy from Swarthmore College in 1959 , a Master 's degree in sociology from Harvard University in 1963 and a Doctorate in Media and Governance from Keio University in 2002 .
Nelson co-founded Itty bitty machine company , or `` ibm '' , which was a small computer retail store operating from 1977 to 1980 in Evanston , Illinois .
From a pessimist viewpoint , Ted Nelson promotes four maxims : `` most people are fools , most authority is malignant , God does not exist , and everything is wrong '' .
He is the son of the late Emmy Award-winning director Ralph Nelson and the Academy Award-winning actress Celeste Holm .
In 2004 he was appointed as a Fellow of Wadham College , Oxford , and associated with the Oxford Internet Institute , where he is currently conducting his research .
He is a visiting fellow at Oxford University - based at the Oxford Internet Institute - where he works in the fields of information , computers , and human-machine interfaces .
This is the utopia of information-in-process , the ultimate wetware dream of the clerisy : discourse converted with 100 percent efficiency into capital , the mechanism of that magical process being nomology or rule-making -- admittedly a rather specialized form of `` imagination . ''
He told the audience that it was the first award that he had ever received for his work .

In vascular plants , phloem is the living tissue made up of small tubes which carry watery sap containing sugar and other organic nutrients to all parts of the plant where the nutrients are used for growth , or stored until needed .
Aphids -LRB- Greenfly -RRB- and other insects feed on the phloem by inserting a fine tube into the plant , penetrating the tiny phloem cells deep within the plant . The very high pressure in the phloem tubes forces the phloem sap into the insect .
The very high pressure in the phloem tubes forces the phloem sap into the insect .
In trees , the phloem is the innermost layer of the bark , therefore the name , that comes from the Greek word Ï Î '' Î Î Î Ï -LRB- phloios -RRB- for `` bark '' .

Shells are commonly colored brown , black , or olive green .
The color of a turtle 's shell may vary .
One of the most colorful turtles is the eastern painted turtle . It has a yellow plastron and a black or olive shell with red markings around the rim .
In some species , shells may have red , orange , yellow , or gray markings and these markings are often spots , lines , or irregular blotches .
The largest chelonian is a marine turtle , the great leatherback sea turtle , which reaches a shell length of 200 cm -LRB- 80 inches -RRB- and can reach a weight of over 900 kg -LRB- 2,000 lb , or 1 short ton -RRB- . Freshwater turtles are generally smaller , but with the largest species , the Asian softshell turtle Pelochelys cantorii , a few individuals have been reported to measure up to 200 cm or 80 in -LRB- Das , 1991 -RRB- .
Most turtles that live in the water have webbed feet like a duck . Tortoises have thick legs like elephants and sea turtles have flippers .
Some turtles can live for up to a year without eating . Turtles drink water often .

Dromornis are part of a family of giant birds called Dromornithidae that lived from 15 million years ago until less than 30,000 years ago .
Dromornis is a genus of fossil flightless birds .
It lived in Australia from the late Miocene to the early Pliocene .
Its legs were powerful , but it was not a fast runner .
D. stirtoni had a long neck and stub-like wings , so it was flightless .
However , others have argued that the size of the beak suggests that the bird was a carnivore .
The animals of Australia had evolved very slowly in almost complete isolation from the animals of other continents .

Dromornis had a huge beak and jaw capable of great force . It did not have the typical beak and claws of a carnivore , and its life style is not certain .

The Joint United Nations Programme on HIV\/AIDS -LRB- UNAIDS -RRB- , the World Health Organization -LRB- WHO -RRB- and the United Nations Children 's Fund -LRB- UNICEF -RRB- , use the term `` AIDS orphan '' to talk about children whose mothers died of AIDS before the child 's 15th birthday , whether the child 's father is still alive or not .

Because of this , some people say that 80 % of all `` AIDS orphans '' still have one parent who is still alive .
An AIDS orphan is a child who became an orphan because at least one of their parents died of AIDS .

The 1953 Korean War armistice is a major example of an armistice which has not yet been followed by a peace treaty .
The word comes from the Latin arma , meaning weapons and statium , meaning a stopping .
An armistice is not the same as a peace treaty , which may take months or even years to agree on .
A truce or ceasefire usually refers to a temporary stop of hostilities for an agreed limited time or within a limited area .
A truce may be needed in order to negotiate an armistice .
The most famous armistice is the Armistice with Germany at the end of World War I , on 11 November , 1918 , signed near CompiÃ gne , France , and effective at the `` eleventh hour of the eleventh day of the eleventh month . ''
An armistice is the effective end of a war , when the parties agree to stop fighting .
Armistices are always negotiated between the parties themselves and are thus generally seen as more binding than UN cease-fire resolutions in modern international law .
The United Nations Security Council often demands cease-fire of parties in modern conflicts .

The Edict of Milan was a letter signed by the Roman emperors Constantine and Licinius , that proclamation religious toleration in the Roman Empire .
The two emperors were in Milan to celebrate the wedding of Constantine 's sister with Licinius .
The letter was issued in 313 , shortly after the end of the persecution of Christians by the emperor Diocletian .
But by the Edict of Milan the meeting places and other properties which had been taken from the Christians were to be returned : ... the same shall be restored to the Christians without payment or any claim of recompense and without any kind of fraud or deception ...
The Edict of Milan was issued in 313 AD , in the names of the Roman Emperors Constantine I , who ruled the western parts of the Empire , and Licinius , who ruled the east .
Wherefore , for this our indulgence , they ought to pray to their God for our safety , for that of the republic , and for their own , that the commonwealth may continue uninjured on every side , and that they may be able to live securely in their homes .

He is also known for making Christianity the official state religion of the Roman Empire .

A regular n-simplex may be made from a regular -LRB- n 1 -RRB- - simplex by connecting a new vertex to all the other vertices .
The 0-simplex is the point , the 1-simplex is the line segment -LRB- line connecting two points -RRB- .
In geometry , a simplex -LRB- plural : simplices or simplexes -RRB- , sometimes called n-simplex is the n-dimensional analog figure of the triangle .
A regular simplex is a simplex that is also a regular polytope .
The 3-simplex is the tetrahedron , and the 4-simplex is the pentachoron .

Badwater Basin is the lowest point in North America , at 282 f below sea level .
During the Holocene , when the regional climate was less dry , streams that ran from mountains in the area slowly filled Death Valley until it was 3 feet -LRB- 1m -RRB- deep . Eventually , there was a 80 m long lake , Lake Manly .

The Moral Code was made at the 22nd Congress of the CPSU in 1961 , as part of the new Party Programme .
The Moral Code of the Builder of Communism was a set of twelve rules . It was made in the Soviet Union by the Communist Party of the USSR .
For example , `` You shall not commit adultery '' of Moses loosely corresponds to `` Mutual respect in a family , concern about the upbringing of children '' of the Code .
-LRB- An example is ` One for all , and all for one ' -LRB- '' Ð Ð Ð Ð Ñ Ð Ð Ð Ð Ñ Ð Ñ
The Code contained a number of popular Soviet cliches ; in fact it was intentionally formulated to contain catch phrases , either invented by Soviet ideologists , or borrowed .
For example , the `` Do not steal '' may be loosely matched to `` Concern of everyone about the preservation and multiplication of the common wealth '' .
Four of the rules , making up one-third of the Code , are of a political character .
The rules were thought more as guidelines . In contrast , the Ten Commandments were made to be rules of conduct , and perhaps even laws .
The very first moral principle was `` Devotion to the cause of communism '' .

They attempt to show that the assumed propositions lead to a logical contradiction and can not therefore all be correct .
Arguments such as these are about the logical problem of evil .
Since the aim is only to defeat the assertion that God and evil are logically incompatible , even a highly implausible instance of God 's coexistence with evil is sufficient for the purpose .
Some philosophers accept that arguments such as `` God allows evil in order to achieve the greater good of free will '' are logically possible and thus solve the logical problem of evil .
Responses include the argument that if there is free will , evil must necessarily exist ; that humans can not understand God ; that evil is simply being without god ; or that there is evil because the world is corrupted and fallen -LRB- from grace -RRB- .

Connective tissue -LRB- CT -RRB- is found throughout the body .
Connective tissue is a fibrous tissue .
It is one of the four traditional classes of tissues -LRB- the others being epithelial , muscle , and nervous tissue -RRB- .
Collagen is the main protein of connective tissue in animals and the most abundant protein in mammals , making up about 25 % of the total protein content .
Connective tissue makes up a variety of physical structures including , tendons , blood , cartilage , bone , adipose tissue , and lymphatic tissue .
CT is classified into three subtypes ; Embryonic CT , Proper CT , and Special CT .

A groove may be through , meaning that it passes all the way through the surface and its ends are open , or stopped , meaning that one or both of the ends finish before the groove meets edge of the surface .
Typically , a groove is used to house the panels in frame and panel construction and the bottoms drawers .
In joinery , a groove is a slot or trench cut into a member which runs parallel to the grain .
Grooves are used for several purposes in cabinet making and other woodworking fields .
A groove is something else than a dado , which runs across the grain .

The easiest firmware to update is usually the system boot-related firmware , such as the BIOS in PCs . Some devices , such as video adapters and modems , frequently rely on firmware that is loaded by the operating system device drivers , and thus is updated by the operating system not by the user .
Some computer viruses and hackers use operating system firmware update facilities to damage the firmware . An electronic device is said to be `` bricked '' if it is unable to start due to firmware issues .

When he realized that Severus had other intentions , Albinus had himself declared Emperor in 195 but was defeated by Severus at the Battle of Lugdunum on 19 February 197 .
However , three other prominent Romans challenged for the throne : Pescennius Niger in Syria , Clodius Albinus in Britain , and Severus in Pannonia .
The Year of the Five Emperors refers to the year 193 AD , in which there were five claimants for the title of Roman Emperor .
The five were Pertinax , Didius Julianus , Pescennius Niger , Clodius Albinus and Severus .
Clodius Albinus initially supported Septimius Severus believing that he would succeed him .
Consolidating his power , Severus battled Pescennius Niger at Cyzicus and Nicea in 193 and then defeated him at Issus in 194 .
Later that same day , Didius Julianus outmaneuvered Titus Flavius Sulpicianus -LRB- Pertinax 's father-in-law and also the new City Prefect -RRB- for the title of Emperor .
The year 193 opened with the murder of Commodus on New Year 's Eve , 31 December 192 . The City Prefect Pertinax was proclaimed Emperor on New Year 's Day , 1 January 193 .
Didius Julianus however offered 25,000 to each soldier to win the auction and was proclaimed Emperor by the Roman Senate on 28 March .
Flavius Sulpicianus offered to pay each soldier 20,000 sestertii to buy their loyalty -LRB- eight times their annual salary ; also the same amount offered by Marcus Aurelius to secure their favors in 161 -RRB- .
Radio 4 costs Â # 71.4 million a year , and is the BBC 's most expensive national radio network . Many people think of it as the corporation 's flagship .
The current controller of Radio 4 is Gwyneth Williams .
The station has also been designated as the UK 's national broadcaster in times of national emergency such as a war , meaning that even if all other radio stations were forced to close , Radio 4 would still carry on broadcasting .
Because the longwave service can be received clearly at sea around the coasts of Britain and Ireland , Radio 4 also carries regular weather forecasts for shipping and gale warnings .
It replaced the BBC Home Service in 1967 .
BBC Radio 4 is a domestic UK radio station which broadcasts a wide variety of spoken-word programs including news , drama , comedy , science and history .
There are occasional concerts on Radio 4 , and ball-by-ball commentaries of most test matches played by England cricket are broadcast on longwave .
She is also in charge of its sister station BBC Radio 4 Extra .
Radio 4 is the second most popular British domestic radio station after Radio 2 . It was named `` UK Radio Station of the Year '' at the 2008 Sony Radio Academy Awards , an award it had also won in 2003 and 2004 , .

Fermions can be thought of as the building blocks of matter because atoms are made up of fermions .
There are 6 different types of quarks -LRB- called `` flavors '' -RRB- and 6 different types of leptons .
Fermions are special because you can not put two of them in the same place at the same time . This is because the Pauli exclusion principle says that no two fermions can have the same quantum numbers , such as spin numbers , at the same time .
Fundamental fermions -LRB- fermions that are not made up of anything else -RRB- are either quarks or leptons .

The Gasterosteidae are a family of fish which include the sticklebacks .
However several of the species have a number of recognized subspecies , and the taxonomy of the family is thought to be in need of revision .
The males construct a nest from vegetation held together by secretions from their kidneys .
The males then attract females to the nest who lay their eggs inside , where the male fertilise them .
The male then guards the eggs until they hatch .
Sticklebacks have strong separated spines in the dorsal fin .
FishBase currently recognizes sixteen species in the family , grouped in five genera .
An unusual features of sticklebacks is that they have no scales , although some species have bony armor plates .

The seal 's design is used in national documents , such as passports , by the United States military , and flags .
As a coat of arms , it has the national colors of the United States , but the material seal itself only has a basic black and white design -LRB- like when used on paper -RRB- .
The Great Seal of United States is the official coat of arms of United States , and it 's placed in official documents from United States Government .
The Great Seal of United States is the official coat of arms of United States , and it 's placed in official documents from United States Government . The name is used both for the coat of arms , and the material seal itself , which is made by the United States ' executive power .
The Victoria Cross -LRB- VC -RRB- is the highest military medal given for bravery `` in the face of the enemy '' to members of the defense forces of Commonwealth countries , and former British Empire territories .
Since then , the medal has been given 1,356 times to 1,353 people .
Because of this , the Victoria Cross is sometimes called the `` British Victoria Cross '' or the `` Imperial Victoria Cross '' . .
The VC was begun on 29 January 1856 by Queen Victoria for acts of bravery during the Crimean War .
Only 13 medals , nine to members of the British Army , and four to the Australian Army have been presented since the Second World War .
It is the most important medal , more important than all other orders , decorations and medals .

The Don has given its name to the Don Cossacks who settled the fertile valley of the river in the 16th and 17th centuries .
It rises in the town of Novomoskovsk 60 km southeast from Tula , southeast of Moscow , and flows for a distance of about 1,950 km -LRB- 1,220 miles -RRB- to the Sea of Azov .
In modern literature , the Don figures centrally in the works of Mikhail Aleksandrovich Sholokhov , a Cossack from the stanitsa of Veshenskaya .
In antiquity , the river was seen as the border between Europe and Asia .
In the Hebrew Book of Jubilees , it is mentioned as being part of the border , beginning with its westernmost point up to its mouth , between the allotment of Japheth to the north and that of Shem to the south , sons of Noah .
The Khazar fortress of Sarkel used to dominate this point in the Middle Ages .
105 km -LRB- 65 miles -RRB- -RRB- , connecting both rivers , has been a major waterway .
This part of the river saw Operation Uranus , one of the turning points of the Second World War .
Tanais appears in ancient Greek sources as the name of the river and of a city on it , situated in the Maeotian marshes .
During the times of the old Scythians it was known in Greek as the TanaÃ s , and has been a major trading route ever since .
The name derives however from Scythian -LRB- Iranian -RRB- DÄ nu `` river '' , akin to modern Ossetic don `` river '' .
At its easternmost point , the Don comes near the Volga , and the Volga-Don Canal -LRB- length ca .
From its source , the river first flows southeast to Voronezh , then southwest to its mouth .
The main city on the river is Rostov on Don , its main tributary , the Donets .

The term heterodox is occasionally used by some Christians to refer to themselves when they are in disagreement with orthodox understandings .
By contrast , a denial of the doctrine of `` Original Sin '' -LRB- thereby negating the necessity of baptism for children -RRB- or Papal Infallibility -- would be labeled heretical .
As an adjective , heterodox is used to describe a subject as `` characterized by departure from accepted beliefs or standards '' -LRB- status quo -RRB- .
Many Roman Catholics profess some heterodox views , either on doctrinal or social issues .
A heterodox Catholic might profess the belief that unbaptized infants are offered the option to accept or deny salvation by God at their judgment .
The belief is not orthodox , as the Church does not profess a belief as to what happens to unbaptized infants ; however , it is also not heresy , as the Church accepts that such a scenario might be possible .
The heterodox Christians remain in the tradition and attempt a constructive dialog around issues with which they disagree .
Heterodoxy means a position that is not within the standards of orthodoxy or to put it precisely `` any opinions or doctrines at variance with an official or orthodox position '' .
In the Eastern Orthodox Church , the term is used to refer to Christian churches not belonging to the Eastern Orthodox communion , but have no positions that are as different from those of Orthodox Christianity to thought to be as false as heresy .
For example , the orthodox Catholic position on unbaptized infants is that their fate is uncertain , and `` the Church can only entrust them to the mercy of God '' -LRB- Catechism of the Catholic Church 1261 -RRB- .
Heterodoxy in the Roman Catholic Church in a similar way means views that differ from strictly orthodox views , but retain sufficient faithfulness to the original doctrine to avoid heresy .
Nicknamed `` Tige , '' Anderson was noted as one of Robert E. Lee 's hardest-fighting subordinates .
George Thomas Anderson -LRB- February 3 , 1824 -- April 4 , 1901 -RRB- was a general in the Confederate States Army during the American Civil War .

The Dhund Abbasi are a tribe of northern Pakistan , they are mainly settled in Abbottabad District and Murree Tehsil .
The tribe claims descent from Dhond Khan and ` Abbas ibn ` Abd al-Muttalib and so are known as Dhund Abbasi .
The rule of the Abbasids extended eastwards across Afghanistan into the South Asian subcontinent -LRB- covering the eastern part of modern-day Pakistan -RRB- .
The descendants of Abbas rose to power removing and replacing the Umayyad rulers , they and their followers were known as the Abbasids , this dynasty and governed for 500 years from Baghdad , Iraq .
The tribe is spread throughout Circle Bakote , Poonch District , Bagh , Kashmir -RRB- and the Murree Hills area of Pakistan .
The tribe speak the Dhundi-Kairali dialect .
Although the tribe traces its roots back directly to Abbas himself , it is more likely that the Dhund Abbasi people are descended from the Abbasid dynasty .

Many more are currently in different stages of planning and building -LRB- as shown in the latest system map -RRB- .

The three separate Presidency Armies continued to exist , and their European officers continued to be listed as members of the Bengal , Madras or Bombay Army rather than the British Army . However , the Presidency Armies began to be described as the Indian Army .
The three separate Presidency Armies continued to exist , and their European officers continued to be listed as members of the Bengal , Madras or Bombay Army rather than the British Army .
These troops are often referred to as â H.M. â s Regimentsâ or â Royal regimentsâ .
Following the Indian rebellion of 1857-58 and the end of the East India Company , its European regiments were joined in 1860 with the British Army , but its â Nativeâ regiments were not .
Also from the mid-eighteenth century the British government began to send regiments of the regular British Army to India to reinforce the Companyâ s armies .
All three armies had both European regiments in which both the officers and men were Europeans , and a larger number of â Nativeâ regiments in which the officers were Europeans and the ordinary soldiers were Indians .
Eventually all three presidency armies were merged into the Indian Army .
However , the Presidency Armies began to be described as the Indian Army .
The presidency armies were the armies of the three presidencies of British India .
The Bengal Army , Madras Army , and Bombay Army were quite different , each with its own list of Regiments and European officers .
From the mid-eighteenth century , the East India Company began to keep armies at each of its three main stations , or â Presidenciesâ , in India at Calcutta -LRB- Bengal -RRB- , Madras and Bombay .
The presidency armies , like the presidencies themselves , belonged to the East India Company until the Indian Mutiny , when the British government took over all three presidencies .

The 8-day Blackpool Dance Festival is the world 's first and most famous annual ballroom dance competition of international significance . It has been held in the Winter Gardens , Blackpool , England since 1920 -LRB- except for war-time -RRB- .
It covers Ballroom dance , including Latin dances . The Festival includes the British Open Championships in categories of adult amateur and professional couples and formation teams .
It is also the largest regular ballroom competition : in 2003 , 1539 couples from 54 countries took part in the festival .
The annual World Professional Championship in either Ballroom or Latin dance is often held in Blackpool -LRB- 4 times between 1989 and 2005 -RRB- , but is not connected with the Dance Festival .
As of the early 21st century the festival is held in May .
In 2005 two new categories were introduced : the British Rising Star Amateur Ballroom and Latin Competitions .
Two invitation events , the Professional Team Match and the Exhibition Competition , create much interest .
The Junior Dance Festival , Blackpool Sequence Dance Festival , and British National Dance Festival are also held annually in Blackpool .

Below is a timeline of the 2006 Atlantic hurricane season , listing all the storm formations , strengthening , weakening , landfalls , extratropical transitions , as well as dissipation .
The timeline also includes information which was not operationally released , meaning that information from post-storm reviews by the National Hurricane Center , such as information on a storm that was not operationally warned on , have been included .

A second or third subdivision level is referred to with another number each .
It was made by the European Union , so it only covers the member states of that union in detail .
NUTS , in some ways are similar to the ISO 3166-2 standard , as well as the FIPS standard of the United States .
In case the subdivision has more than 9 entities , capital letters are used to continue the numbering .
Note that not all countries have every level of division , depending on their size .
There are three levels of NUTS . Some with two levels of local administrative units -LRB- LAUs -RRB- below .
These were called NUTS levels 4 and 5 until July 2003 , but were changed due to official regulations although they are sometimes still described as such .
In addition to the full three levels for the European Union countries , all countries have a NUTS code with a two-letter code for a continent and two numbers for the country , and for the USA , Canada and Australia the states , provinces , and territories are numbered separately .
The Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics , -LRB- NUTS -RRB- for the French nomenclature d'unit Ã s territoriales statistiques , is a geocode standard that shows the administrative divisions of countries for statistical purposes .
The subdivision of the country is then displayed by one number .
A NUTS code begins with a two-letter code referencing the country , and is identical to the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code -LRB- the only difference is UK instead of GB for the United Kingdom -RRB- .
Each numbering starts with 1 , as 0 is used for the upper level .
Religious violence means violence against a group of people of one religion by a group of people of another region . This type of violence is religiously motivated .
The Bantu languages came from the region of eastern Nigeria or Cameroon .
Parts of the Bantu area include languages from other language families -LRB- see map -RRB- .
Zulu comes second with 10.3 million speakers .
About 2000 years ago the Bantu people spread southwards and eastwards , introducing agriculture and iron working and colonizing much of the continent .
The Bantu language with the largest number of native speakers is Shona with 13.8 million speakers in Zimbabwe , Mozambique , Botswana and Zambia .
Some words from various Bantu languages have been borrowed into western languages .
The Bantu languages -LRB- or Narrow Bantu languages -RRB- are a branch of the Niger-Congo languages .
Bantu languages are spoken largely east and south of the present day country of Cameroon ; i.e. , in the regions commonly known as central Africa , east Africa , and southern Africa .
