The Red Army Faction or RAF -LRB- German Rote Armee Fraktion -RRB- , was one of postwar West Germany 's most active and prominent militant left-wing groups .
The RAF was formally founded in 1970 by Andreas Baader , Gudrun Ensslin , Horst Mahler , Ulrike Meinhof , Irmgard MÃ ller and others .
It described itself as a communist `` urban guerrilla '' group engaged in armed resistance , while it was described by the West German government as a terrorist group .

Peake has received include the Distinguished Service Medal , Silver Star , Defense Superior Service Medal , Legion of Merit -LRB- with three oak leaf clusters -RRB- , Bronze Star with `` V '' device -LRB- with one oak leaf cluster -RRB- , Purple Heart -LRB- with one oak leaf cluster -RRB- , Meritorious Service Medal -LRB- with two oak leaf clusters -RRB- , Air Medal , Joint Services Commendation Medal , Army Commendation Medal with `` V '' device -LRB- with one oak leaf cluster -RRB- , Humanitarian Service Medal , the Armed Forces Expeditionary Medal , Combat Infantryman Badge , Navy Meritorious Unit Commendation , Joint Meritorious Unit Award -LRB- with one oak leaf cluster -RRB- , Senior Parachutist Badge , Pathfinder Badge , Ranger Tab , Combat Medic Badge and Army Staff Identification Badge .
After retiring from the Army , Dr. Peake served as Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer of Project Hope , a non-profit international health foundation operating in more than 30 countries .
His father joined the Army as an enlisted man , and became an officer who spent most of his 30-year career in the Medical Service Corps .
Peake received his Bachelor of Science degree from U.S. Military Academy at West Point in 1966 and was commissioned a second lieutenant in the U.S. Army Infantry .
While at Project HOPE he helped to supervise the use of civilian volunteers aboard the Navy Hospital Ship Mercy as it responded to the Tsunami disaster in Indonesia and also as part of the Hurricane Katrina response aboard the Hospital Ship Comfort .
He retired from the Army in 2004 , as a Lieutenant General .
James Benjamin Peake -LRB- born June 18 , 1944 -RRB- was United States Secretary of Veterans Affairs from 2007 to 2009 .
Peake served for four years as the United States Army Surgeon General .
He was awarded a medical doctorate in 1972 .
Just before to his nomination as Secretary of Veterans Affairs , Peake served as a member of the Board of Directors for QTC , one of the largest private providers of government-outsourced occupational health and disability examination services in the United States .
After Vietnam , he attended Cornell University 's Weill Cornell Medical College .
He was confirmed by the United States Senate on December 14 , 2007 and sworn in at VA headquarters by Vice President Dick Cheney on December 20 .
Peake 's selection as VA secretary was announced on October 30 , 2007 .
He also served as the 40th Surgeon General of the United States Army .
Following service in Vietnam with the 101st Airborne Division where he was awarded the Silver Star , a Bronze Star with â Vâ device and the Purple Heart with oak leaf cluster , Peake entered medical school at Cornell University in New York .
Key assignments include Commander , U.S. Army Medical Department Center and School and Installation Commander , Fort Sam Houston , Texas ; Deputy Commander , U.S. Army Medical Command , Fort Sam Houston , Texas ; Commanding General , Madigan Army Medical Center\/Northwest Health Service Support Activity , Tacoma , Washington ; Commanding General , 44th Medical Brigade\/Corps Surgeon , XVIII Airborne Corps , Fort Bragg , North Carolina ; Deputy Director , Professional Services\/Chief , Consultant , Office of the Surgeon General , Falls Church , Virginia ; Commander , 18th Medical Command and 121st Evacuation Hospital\/Command Surgeon , Seoul , Korea ; Deputy Commander for Clinical Services , Tripler Army Medical Center , Honolulu , Hawaii ; Assistant Chief , Cardiothoracic Surgery , Brooke Army Medical Center , Fort Sam Houston , Texas ; Staff General Surgeon\/Chief , General Surgery Clinic , DeWitt Army Hospital , Fort Belvoir , Va. ; and General Surgery Resident , Brooke Army Medical Center , Fort Sam Houston , Texas .
He also served as commander of several Army medical units .
Peake was born in Saint Louis , Missouri .
He is also a graduate of the United States Army War College , in 1988 .

Schrock is a member of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences , National Academy of Sciences and was elected to the Board of Overseers of Harvard University in 2007 .
Schrock carbenes are named after Schrock .
Schrock was the first scientist to make sense of ` black box ' olefin metathesis .
He was given a B.A. degree in 1967 -RRB- from the University of California , Riverside and a Ph. D. , in 1971 , from Harvard University .
In 2005 Professor Schrock received the Nobel Prize in Chemistry , along with Robert H. Grubbs and Yves Chauvin , for his work on olefin metathesis , which is a method of organic synthesis .
In 1972 , he began working for George Parshall in the Experimental Station of the E. I. du Pont de Nemours and Company in Wilmington , Delaware .
He married Nancy Carlson in 1971 and has two children , Andrew and Eric .
At Harvard he was a student of J. A. Osborn .
Nancy Schrock is the Thomas F. Peterson , Jr. .
Schrock now works as the Frederick G. Keyes Professor of Chemistry , at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology -LRB- MIT -RRB- . He has worked there since 1989 .

Conservator of Special Collections for the MIT Libraries .
Professor Schrock was born in Berne , Indiana , and went to Mission Bay High School in San Diego , California .
He joined the faculty of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 1975 and became a professor in 1980 .
The family live in Winchester , Massachusetts .
Composers such as Orlando Gibbons , John Blow and Henry Purcell wrote voluntaries , although sometimes they preferred to use other titles such as fancy -LRB- an English form of the Italian word fantasia -RRB- , or even fugue .
The music that an organist plays before and after a service is always called a voluntary .
In music a voluntary is a piece of music , usually for organ , which is played as part of a church service .
However , these fugues were not composed in the proper fugue style : they just started off with imitation as in a fugue , but continued in a freer style .
The title was often used by English composers in the late Renaissance or Baroque periods for a piece of organ music that was free in style , i.e. it did not have to be composed in a strict form such as sonata form or a fugue .
The word â voluntaryâ can be used for the title of a piece of music .

Gulf County is a county located in the panhandle of the U.S. state of Florida .
Males had a median income of $ 27,539 versus $ 20,780 for females .
Gulf County is heavily Democratic .
Gulf County , created in 1925 , was named for the Gulf of Mexico .
Its county seat is Port St. Joe , Florida .
25.50 % of all households were made up of people living alone and 11.40 % had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older .
The U.S. Census Bureau 2005 estimate for the county is 13,975 .
The median income for a household in the county was $ 30,276 , and the median income for a family was $ 36,289 .
Other examples include Idaho County , Idaho , and Malheur County , Oregon , having parts in both Mountain and Pacific Time Zones as well as Cherry County , Nebraska which is in both the Mountain and Central Time Zones .
The population density was 24 people per square mile -LRB- 9\/km Â -RRB- .
As of 2000 , the population was 13,332 .
2.03 % of the population were Hispanic or Latino of any race .
However , the county tends to vote Republican in statewide and national elections .
In 2004 , Gulf County re-elected President George W. Bush by a 2 to 1 margin .
The per capita income for the county was $ 14,449 .
Despite remaining a Democratic stronghold , In the 2008 Presidential election John McCain carried the county with 69 % of the vote .
Gulf County is one of a few counties in the United States to be in two time zones , Eastern and Central in this case .
For every 100 females age 18 and over , there were 116.70 males .
For every 100 females there were 114.60 males .
Wewahitchka was its first county seat and the 1927 Gulf County Courthouse is still there .
The average household size was 2.42 and the average family size was 2.87 .
According to the 2000 census , the county has a total area of 744.59 s , of which 554.60 s -LRB- or 74.48 % -RRB- is land and 190.00 s -LRB- or 25.52 % -RRB- is water .
The racial makeup of the county was 79.89 % White , 16.94 % Black or African American , 0.65 % Native American , 0.40 % Asian , 0.05 % Pacific Islander , 0.53 % from other races , and 1.55 % from two or more races .
About 13.70 % of families and 16.70 % of the population were below the poverty line , including 20.80 % of those under age 18 and 14.10 % of those age 65 or over .
In 1965 , the county seat was moved to Port Saint Joe , which under its original name Saint Joseph , had been the site of Florida 's first Constitutional Convention in 1838 .
Republican Steve Southerland represents the county in the US House of Representatives .
In the county the population was spread out with 21.70 % under the age of 18 , 6.80 % from 18 to 24 , 29.40 % from 25 to 44 , 26.00 % from 45 to 64 , and 16.20 % who were 65 years of age or older .
There were 4,931 households out of which 28.40 % had children under the age of 18 living with them , 55.50 % were married couples living together , 11.90 % had a female householder with no husband present , and 28.30 % were not related .

The Leader of the Opposition in New Zealand is the politician who leads the MPs that are not in government in the New Zealand Parliament .
Often , these relate to national security matters , which are supposed to go past party politics - the New Zealand Security Intelligence Service , for example , has to talk to the Leader of the Opposition as well as the Prime Minister about certain matters .
The Leader of the Opposition does not have a large official role , but there are several ways in which the Leader of the Opposition takes part in affairs of state .
The Leader of the Opposition also receives a higher salary than other members of the Opposition , being paid the same amount as a Cabinet Minister .
In the debating chamber the Leader of the Opposition sits directly opposite the Prime Minister .
At present , the Leader of the Opposition is Phil Goff of Labor .
Usually , the Leader of the Opposition is the leader of the largest party of the Opposition .

The physics affecting the bullet once it leaves the barrel , is called ` external ballistics ' .
The primary factors affecting the aerodynamics of a bullet in flight are the bullet 's shape and the rotation imparted by the rifling of the gun barrel .
The make-up and density of the target material , the angle of incidence , and the velocity and make-up of the bullet itself are all factors .
Mould manufacturers such as RCBS , Paul Jones Moulds , and David Mos offer many different calibers and designs .
Bullets must be produced to a high standard , as surface imperfections can affect firing accuracy .
With a mould , bullets can be made at home for reloading one 's own ammunition , where local laws allow .
Bullets must have a surface which will form this seal without causing excessive friction .
Actual bullet shapes are many and varied , and an array of them can be found in any reloading manual that sells bullet moulds .
Cast and jacketed bullets are also commercially available from numerous manufacturers for hand loading and are much more convenient than casting bullets from bulk lead .
The bullet must also engage the rifling -LRB- spiral marks on barrel -RRB- without damaging the gun 's bore .
These unstable bullets tumbled erratically and provided only moderate accuracy , however the aerodynamic shape changed little for centuries .
Bullets are generally designed to penetrate , deform , and\/or break apart .
They must form a seal with the gun 's bore -LRB- inner surface of barrel -RRB- .
Bullet designs have to solve two primary problems .
Bullet design affects what happens when a bullet hits an object .
These interactions between bullet and bore are termed ` internal ballistics ' .
Any asymmetry in the bullet is largely canceled as it spins .
With smooth-bore firearms , a spherical shape was optimum because no matter how it was oriented , it presented a uniform front .
Rotational forces stabilize the bullet gyroscopically as well as aerodynamically -LRB- spinning keeps it on track -RRB- .
Hand-casting , however , is only time - and cost-effective for solid lead bullets .
If a strong seal is not achieved , gas from the propellant charge leaks past the bullet , reducing efficiency .
For a given material and bullet , the strike velocity is the primary factor determining the result .

Tikal -LRB- or Tikâ al , according to modern orthography -RRB- is the largest of the ancient ruined cities of the Maya civilization .
The reliance on seasonal rainfall made Tikal open to drought . This is now thought to play a major part in the Classic Maya Collapse .
In this period , Tikal was in charge of the Maya region politically , economically , and militarily . This is because it was linked with areas throughout Mesoamerica , such as central Mexican , the center of Teotihuacan .
The ruins are on lowland rainforest , but Tikal had no water other than what was collected from rainwater and stored underground .
However , Tikal did well with intense agricultural techniques . These were more advanced than the slash & burn methods originally theorized by archeologists .
Archaeologists working in Tikal during the last century used the underground facilities to store water for their own use .

Hershey and Chase used T2 phage , a bacteriophage , for their experiments .
The Hersheyâ `` Chase experiments were a series of experiments started in 1952 by Alfred Hershey and Martha Chase .
The phage infects a bacterium by attaching to it and injecting its genetic material into it .

Eukaryotic cells are usually much bigger than prokaryotes .
In most eukaryotes , the vesicles with proteins inside fuse with piles of flattened vesicles called the Golgi bodies , where the proteins inside are changed again .
In the complicated plants , most of the inside of a plant cell is taken up by a central vacuole . That central vacuole is the main thing that keeps osmotic pressure so the cell can hold its shape .
The proteins made by the ribosomes attached to the rough ER go to the inside the rough ER , called the lumen .
In multicellular organisms , hormones are often made in vesicles .
In eukaryotic cells , there are many things with membranes around them . All of them together are called the endomembrane system .
Many cells take in food and other things using something called endocytosis . In endocytosis , the membrane closest to the outside bends inwards and then pinches off to make a vesicle .
Simple bags , called vesicles or vacuoles , are sometimes made by budding off other membranes , just like how children make bubbles with their toys .
The cytoskeleton is made up of microtubules and microfilaments . Those parts are very important in the cell 's shape .
After that , they usually go into vesicles , which grow and pinch off from the smooth ER .
Eukaryotic DNA is put in bundles called chromosomes , which are separated by a microtubular spindle during cell division .

In ballet , a rÃ pÃ titeur teaches the steps and interpretation of the roles to some or all of the company performing a dance .
The word RÃ pÃ titeur is a French word which comes from the verb `` rÃ pÃ ter '' meaning : `` to repeat '' . The meaning here is `` to rehearse '' , because when a musician rehearses -LRB- practices -RRB- he will go over the music many times until he has learned it really well .

Zhytomyr is a city in Ukraine , the administrative center of Zhytomyr oblast .
The city lies on a historic way that connects the city of Kiev with the west through Brest .

Today it connects Warsaw with Kiev , Minsk with Izmail , and several major cities of Ukraine .
Zhytomyr is divided into two districts . It is located on the Teteriv River .

The Inca road system -LRB- El Camino Inca -RRB- of Peru was the most extensive among the many roads and trails that were constructed in pre-Columbian South America .
Because the Incas did not make use of the wheel for transportation , and did not have horses until the arrival of the Spanish in Peru in the 16th century , the trails were used almost exclusively by people walking , sometimes accompanied by pack animals , usually the llama .
The Camino Real went across the mountain ranges of the Andes , with peak altitudes of more than 5,000 m. El Camino de la Costa , the coastal trail , with a length of 4,000 km -LRB- 2,420 mi -RRB- , ran parallel to the sea and was linked with the Camino Real by many smaller routes .
It began in Quito , Ecuador , passed through Cusco , and ended in what is now TucumÃ n , Argentina .
The most important Inca road was the Camino Real , as it is known in Spanish , with a length of 5,200 km -LRB- 3,230 mi -RRB- .

Friedrich Kurt Fiedler -LRB- 8 March 1894 -- 11 November 1950 -RRB- was a German graphic designer .
The home of Kurt Fiedler was completely destroyed during Bombing of Dresden in World War II on 13 February 1945 . After the war , Kurt Fiedler belonged to the directorate of the association of fine arts in Dresden .
During World War I Fiedler served as front-line soldier in France .
After the war , Ferdinand Avenarius introduced him to the DÃ 1\/4 rerbund .
Many of his works can be found in Deutsches Historisches Museum , Akademie der KÃ 1\/4 nste and the German Federal Archive .
From 1911 to 1915 Fiedler got a grant to study as master scholar of Richard Guhr and Josef Goller .
The Nazis hindered Kurt Fiedler because he was known as an active social democrat . During World War II Kurt Fiedler served as translator for French prisoners of war .

The Arch of Constantine -LRB- Italian : Arco di Costantino -RRB- is an arch in Rome , found between the Colosseum and the Palatine Hill .
The main inscription was made of bronze letters .
To the Emperor Caesar Flavius Constantinus , the greatest , pious , and blessed Augustus : because he , inspired by the divine , and by the greatness of his mind , has delivered the state from the tyrant and all of his followers at the same time , with his army and just force of arms , the Senate and People of Rome have dedicated this arch , decorated with triumphs .
It is the latest of the triumphal arches in Rome .

The garden dormouse -LRB- Eliomys quercinus -RRB- is a rodent in the dormouse family .
In the Netherlands , it is nearly extinct . In 2007 only nine animals were found in two woods in Limburg .
They open their eyes after about eighteen days . They are nursed until they are one month old .
The babies are usually born in litters of three to seven , after a gestation period of 23 days .
This article includes information from the English Wikipedia which was originally translated from the German and French Wikipedias .
Garden dormice are often found in the Alps , in the Bavaria Forest , and in the Ore Mountains .
At night they look for food like larger insects -LRB- grasshoppers and beetle -RRB- , snails , eggs , baby birds , small mice , and spiders . They also eat berries , fruit , and nuts -LRB- like acorns and beechnuts -RRB- .
The mating period is from April to June .
Garden dormice are mostly nocturnal . They sleep in spherical nests in trees during the day .
Cannibalism sometimes happens when the animal is coming out of hibernation .
Male Garden dormice may eat a rival dormouse during the mating season .
They also think that climate change might be a reason , because it interrupts the Dormice 's hibernation .
The garden dormouse 's main habitat is the forest -LRB- and not usually gardens -RRB- , though it can also be found in fruit-growing regions .
It is very common in southern Europe , but its range -LRB- the area in can be found -RRB- goes up to the north of Europe .
While omnivorous , the diet of dormice contains a bit more animal protein than vegetation .
The garden dormouse has black eye marks , large ears -LRB- for a rodent -RRB- , short hair , and a white tassel at the end of the tail .
Garden Dormice are usually 10 t in length , with the tail adding another 8 t. It weighs 60 t. The coat is gray or brown and it is white underneath .

It was , however , never far from criticism as a foreign , vulgar dance .
The follower 's steps are mirrored .
The famous ballroom dancing guru , Alex Moore , said that he had `` never seen anything uglier '' .
In the UK variations in technique led to styles such as Boogie-Woogie and Swing Boogie , with ` Jive ' gradually emerging as the generic term .
English instructors developed the elegant and lively ballroom Jive , danced to slightly slower music .
In the United States the term ` Swing ' became the most common word used to describe the dance .
Leader : Normally the male
The basic step -LRB- Jive Basic -RRB- is a six beat pattern , comprising eight weight changes .
Normally the female
The modern form of ballroom jive in the 1990s-present , is a very happy and boppy dance , the lifting of knees and the bending or rocking of the hips often occurs .
It is a lively and uninhibited variation of the earlier forms of Swing dance such as the Jitterbug .
American soldiers brought Lindy Hop\/Jitterbug to Europe around 1942 , where this dance quickly became popular among the young .
It originated in the United States from African-Americans in the early 1940s .
In 1968 it was adopted as the fifth Latin dance in International competitions .
After the war , the boogie became the dominant form for popular music .
Jive is a dance , one of the five International Latin ballroom dances .

The British Rail Class 373 or TGV-TMST train is an electric multiple unit that operates Eurostar 's high-speed rail service between Britain , France and Belgium via the Channel Tunnel .
Part of the TGV family , it has a smaller cross-section to fit within the constrictive British loading gauge , was originally able to operate on the UK third rail network , and has a lot of fireproofing in case of fire in the tunnel .
This is both the longestâ '' 394 mâ '' and fastest train in regular UK passenger service .

SFB is the first professional ballet company in the United States .
The company is currently based in the War Memorial Opera House in San Francisco , California under the direction of Helgi Tomasson who has been directing it since 1985 .

The Hellenistic period began with Alexander , when Greek became the lingua franca far beyond Greece itself , and Hellenistic culture came in contact with the cultures of Persia , Central Asia , India and Egypt .
It is the period in which Greek and Roman literature -LRB- such as Aeschylus , Ovid , Homer and others -RRB- flourished .
The Roman Forum was the central area around which ancient Rome developed .
Determining the precise end of the Republic is a task of dispute by modern historians ; Roman citizens of the time did not recognize that the Republic had ceased to exist .
Successive invasions of Germanic tribes meant the thr end of the Western Empire in the 5th century , but the Eastern Empire persisted throughout the Middle Ages as the Byzantine Empire .
The Hellenistic period ended with the rise of the Roman Republic to a super-regional power in the 2nd century BC and the Roman conquest of Greece in 146 BC .
Respect for the ancients of Greece and Rome affected politics , philosophy , sculpture , literature , theater , education , architecture and even sexuality .
The republican period of Ancient Rome began with the overthrow of the Monarchy at about 509 BC and lasted over 450 years until its subversion , through a series of civil wars and the Imperial period .
Classical antiquity -LRB- also the classical era or classical period -RRB- is a broad term for a long period of cultural history at the Mediterranean . It includes the civilizations of Ancient Greece and Ancient Rome , known as the Greco-Roman world .
The classical period of Ancient Greece was from the fall of the Athenian tyranny in 510 BC to the death of Alexander the Great in 323 BC -RRB- .
During Late Antiquity Christianity rised under Constantine I , and finally became the Roman imperial cult in 393 .

Canine distemper is a viral disease that affects animals in the families Canidae , Mustelidae , Mephitidae , Procyonidae and some Felidae -LRB- though not domestic cats is a different virus exclusive to cats -RRB- .
It is a single-stranded RNA virus of the family paramyxovirus , and thus a close relative of measles and rinderpest .
Despite extensive vaccination in many regions , it remains a major disease of dogs .
It is most commonly associated with domestic animals such as dogs and ferrets , although it can infect wild animals as well .

Like the other Dominions , Australia gained legislative independence from the Parliament of the United Kingdom through the Statute of Westminster 1931 . This came into force in Australia in 1942 , but back dated to 3 September 1939 .
The federal nature of the Commonwealth and the structure of the Parliament of Australia were the subject of long negotiations among the colonies .
The cabinet meets not only in Canberra but also in other Australian state capitals , most often Sydney and Melbourne .
The possibility of the British Parliament making laws to overturn the Australian Constitution was also removed .
Section 2 of the Australian Constitution says that a Governor-General shall represent the Queen in Australia .
This practice has been continued by all governments except the Whitlam Government .
Each State has its own constitution , so that Australia has seven sovereign Parliaments , none of which can take over the powers of any other .
With more ministers added in the 1940s and 1950s this made the cabinet too big . In 1956 Robert Menzies created a two level ministry , with only senior ministers in the Cabinet .
The Commonwealth Parliament Offices in Sydney are located in Phillip Street .
With the Royal Style and Titles Act 1953 , the Australian Parliament gave the Queen the title Queen of Australia . In 1973 her Australian title no longer included her status as Queen of the United Kingdom and Defender of the Faith .
The Commonwealth of Australia is a federal constitutional monarchy with a parliamentary democracy .
These `` transfer '' laws may have a `` sunset clause '' .
The third level of government after Commonwealth and State\/Territory is Local government .
The Labor Prime Ministers had a lot of influence over who was elected to Labor ministries , although the leaders small groups inside the party also had a lot of power .
The Sovereign of Australia is currently Queen Elizabeth II . She is also the Sovereign of fifteen other Commonwealth Realms including the United Kingdom .
When the Liberal Party and its predecessors -LRB- the Nationalist Party and the United Australia Party -RRB- have been in coalition with the National Party or its predecessor the Country Party , the leader of the junior Coalition party has had the right decide his party 's members of the Coalition ministry , and to work with the Prime Minister to give them their responsibilities .
The Legislature makes the laws , and supervises the activities of the other two arms with a view to changing the laws if needed .
Members of the Executive Council are entitled to be styled `` The Honourable '' , a title which they retain for life .
The Constitution of Australia does not mention the Cabinet , and its decisions have no legal force .
His party won the election and he chose the ministry , as he said he would .
The proposal was defeated .
The Judiciary interprets the laws , using as a basis the laws as enacted and what was said in the Legislature while the laws were being passed .
The Governor-General retains reserve powers similar to those possessed by the Queen in the United Kingdom .
The Commonwealth Parliament can propose changes to the Constitution .
Section 51 of the Constitution sets out the Commonwealth Government 's legislative powers and gives certain powers and responsibilities -LRB- known as `` heads of power '' -RRB- to the federal government .
When the non-Labor parties have been in power , the Prime Minister has made all Cabinet and ministerial appointments .
The largely uninhabited Coral Sea Islands was set up as a Territory of the Commonwealth in 1969 . The Ashmore and Cartier Islands has been a territory since 1933 run under the laws of the Northern Territory .
Section 61 of the Constitution says that ` The executive power of the Commonwealth is vested in the Queen and is exercisable by the Governorâ ` General as the Queenâ s representative , and extends to the execution and maintenance of this Constitution , and of the laws of the Commonwealth ' .
Australian law is now only decided on in Australia , and the High Court of Australia is the highest court of appeal .
The Commonwealth of Australia was formed in 1901 when the six self-governing British colonies , agreed to join together as one nation . These colonies became the six states of Australia .
The Governor-General represents Australia internationally , making and receiving State visits .
The members of the House of Representatives are elected by preferential voting from single-member areas spread among the states and territories roughly in proportion to population .
In practice , the Governor-General carries out all the tasks usually done by a head of state , without asking the Queen .
These are rarely exercised , but during the Australian constitutional crisis of 1975 Governor-General Sir John Kerr used them independently of the Queen and the Prime Minister .
Prior to the 2007 general election , Kevin Rudd , said that he and he alone would choose the ministry if he become Prime Minister .
The Federal Executive Council consists of the Governor-General , the Prime Minister and Ministers .
There are times when the government acts in a `` caretaker '' capacity , principally in the period prior to and immediately following a general election .
The legislatures of these territories have powers given to them by the Commonwealth . The Commonwealth Parliament keeps the power to overturn territorial legislation and to give or take powers .
That is why there is always a member of the ministry holding the title Vice-President of the Executive Council .
All members of the ministry must be sworn as members of the Federal Executive Council . This council is chaired by the Governor-General and which meets solely to approve and give legal force to decisions already made by the Cabinet .
The written agreement is the Australian Constitution . This was written at a Constitutional Convention and voted for by the people of the colonies .
This can be done by an amendment to the Constitution through a referendum .
The Australian Parliament is bicameral , made up of the Queen , a 76-member Senate and a 150-member House of Representatives .
General elections are held at least once every three years .
The question of whether the Queen is Australia 's head of state became a political one during the 1999 Australian republic referendum , when opponents of the move to make Australia a republic claimed that Australia already had an Australian as head of state in the person of the Governor-General , who since 1965 has invariably been an Australian citizen .
Though in many respects the Governor-General is the Queen 's representative , and exercises various constitutional powers in her name , they are also independently vested with many important constitutional powers by the Constitution .
In the Westminster system , the leader of the political party or group of parties that holds the support of a majority of the members in the House of Representatives is asked to form a government and is named Prime Minister .
The Australian Republican Movement continues to call for an end to the monarchy in Australia , opposed by Australians for Constitutional Monarchy .
In 2009 Prime Minister Kevin Rudd called the Governor-General the Australian head of state . He said an overseas visit by Quentin Bryce '' ... to Africa of this scale by Australia 's Head of State will express the seriousness of Australia 's commitment '' .
The former Governor-General , Major General Michael Jeffery , said in 2004 : `` Her Majesty is Australia 's head of state but I am her representative and to all intents and purposes I carry out the full role . ''
In practice , the role of head of state of Australia is divided between two people , the Queen of Australia and the Governor-General of Australia . The Governor - General is appointed by the Queen on the advice of the Prime Minister of Australia .
The day-to-day business of the house is usually worked out between a senior Minister , who holds the title Leader of the House , and an Opposition frontbencher known as the Manager of Opposition Business .
The government , because it has a majority of members in the lower house of the legislature , can usually pass its legislation and control the workings of the house . The Opposition can slow down the process and obstruct government business if it chooses .
Under the Westminster system the Governor-General 's powers are almost always used on the advice of the Prime Minister or other ministers .
Instead , these territories are governed by federal laws , with Christmas Island and the Cocos Islands also having local governments .
Senators from the territories are also elected using preferential voting , however , their term of office is not fixed : it starts on the day of a general election for the House of Representatives and ends the day before the next such election day .
The Prime Minister and the Cabinet are responsible to the Parliament , of which they must be members .
Twelve Senators from each state are elected for six-year terms , using proportional representation and the single transferable vote -LRB- known in Australia as `` preferential voting '' , with half elected every three years .
However , in 2005 , he declined to name the Queen as head of state , instead saying in response to a direct question , `` The Queen is the Monarch and I represent her , and I carry out all the functions of head of state . ''
Local governments are made up of elected representatives -LRB- known as either councilor or alderman depending on the State -RRB- , usually serving on a part-time basis .
In ordinary legislation , the two chambers have the same powers , but all laws for spending money or charging taxes must come from the House of Representatives .
This was so the Senators of the smaller States could form a majority and change or even reject laws from the House of Representatives .
It is a formal body which exists to give legal effect to decisions made by the Cabinet , and to carry out various other functions .
Kevin Rudd said he wanted the Cabinet to meet in other places , such as major regional cities .
Until 1956 all members of the ministry were members of the Cabinet .
The ACT and the NT elect two senators each .
The Governor-General usually presides at Council meetings , but a Minister with the title Vice-President of the Executive Council serves as the link between the government and the Council .
The Commonwealth Constitution also says that the States can agree to give any of their powers to the Commonwealth .
In 1907 , however , the party decided that future Labor Cabinets would be elected by the members of the Parliamentary Labor Party , the Caucus . The Prime Minister would allocate their responsibilities .
While Australian citizens living in the Australian Capital Territory and the Northern Territory are represented in the Commonwealth Parliament , Norfolk Islanders are not .
Australia has several territories , three of which are self-governing : the Australian Capital Territory -LRB- ACT -RRB- , the Northern Territory -LRB- NT -RRB- and Norfolk Island .
The Prime Minister can advise the Governor-General to call an election for the House of Representatives at any time , but Senate elections can only be held within certain periods set out in the Constitution .
The proposal would have removed the Queen from the Constitution and replaced the Governor-General with a President nominated by the Prime Minister , but needing the approval of a two-thirds majority of both Houses of the Parliament .
The most recent general election was on 21 August 2010 .
All remaining responsibilities are kept by the six States .
The House of Representatives is elected on a basis which shows the different sized populations of the States .
In a 1999 referendum , the Australian people voted on a proposal to change the Constitution .
Before the Australia Act 1986 , and matching legislation in the parliament of the United Kingdom , some Australian cases could be sent to the Judicial Committee of the Privy Council for final appeal .
Section 1 of the Australian Constitution sets up a democratic legislature , the bicameral Parliament of Australia . This is the Queen and two houses , the Senate and the House of Representatives .
But the Senate is elected on a basis of equality among the States : all States have 12 Senators , regardless of population .
To become law , the proposals must be put to a referendum of all Australians of voting age . The changes must get a `` double majority '' : a majority of all votes , and a majority of votes in a majority of States .
They have a recognized Leader of the Opposition , usually the leader of the largest party outside the government . There is also a Shadow Cabinet of Opposition members who `` shadow '' each member of the Ministry , asking questions on matters about the Minister 's responsibilities .
The Australian Constitution was written in 1901 , when the Dominions of the British Empire were not independent countries , and does not use the words `` head of state '' .

These large sketches , with their free and vigorous brushwork , were revolutionary at the time .
He told Leslie , `` When I sit down to make a sketch from nature , the first thing I try to do is to forget that I have ever seen a picture '' .
Although Constable produced paintings throughout his life for the market of patrons and R.A. exhibitions , on-the-spot studies were essential .
Constable 's idea was to use nature itself , rather than imagination .
The sketches were the first ever done in oils directly from the subject in the open air .
To convey the effects of light and movement , Constable used broken brushstrokes , often in small touches , which he worked over lighter passages . This gave an impression of sparkling light over the landscape .
John Constable -LRB- East Bergholt , Suffolk 11 June 1776 -- London , 31 March 1837 -RRB- was a famous English painter and artist .
p68 `` I have done a good deal of skying '' , Constable wrote to Fisher on 23 October 1821 .
When he exhibited it in 1836 , Constable appended a text to the title : `` The mysterious monument of Stonehenge , standing remote on a bare and boundless heath , as much unconnected with the events of past ages as it is with the uses of the present , carries you back beyond all historical records into the obscurity of a totally unknown period '' .
Possibly more than any other aspect of Constable 's work , the oil sketches reveal him to be an avant-garde painter , one who showed that landscape painting could be taken in a totally new direction .
`` The world is wide '' , he wrote , `` no two days are alike , nor even two hours ; neither were there ever two leaves of a tree alike since the creation of all the world ; and the genuine productions of art , like those of nature , are all distinct from each other '' .
Constable painted many full-scale preliminary sketches of his landscapes in order to test the composition in advance of finished pictures .
p110 In this habit he is known to have been influenced by the pioneering work of the meteorologist Luke Howard on the classification of clouds .
Constable once wrote in a letter to Leslie , `` My limited and abstracted art is to be found under every hedge , and in every lane , and therefore nobody thinks it worth picking up '' .
In addition to the full-scale oil sketches , Constable completed numerous studies of landscapes and clouds , to become more scientific in his recording of atmospheric conditions .
One of the most expressionistic and powerful of all his studies is Seascape Study with Rain Cloud , painted in around 1824 at Brighton , which captures with slashing dark brushstrokes an exploding shower at sea .
The oil sketches of The Leaping Horse and The Hay Wain study convey a vigor missing from his finished paintings of the same subjects .
Constable 's watercolors were also remarkably free for their time . The almost mystical Stonehenge , 1835 , with its double rainbow , is often considered to be one of the greatest watercolors ever painted .
p129 He could never have imagined how influential his honest techniques would turn out to be .
Constable 's art inspired not only contemporaries like GÃ ricault and Delacroix , but the Barbizon School , and the French impressionists of the late nineteenth century .
The The Chain Pier , 1827 , for example , prompted a critic to write : `` the atmosphere possesses a characteristic humidity about it , that almost imparts the wish for an umbrella '' .
To the sky studies he added notes , often on the back of the sketches , of the prevailing weather conditions , direction of light , and time of day , believing that the sky was `` the key note , the standard of scale , and the chief organ of sentiment '' in a landscape painting .
p128 Constable also became interested in painting rainbow effects , for example in Salisbury Cathedral from the Meadows , 1831 , and in Cottage at East Bergholt , 1833 .

Irreducible Mind : Toward a Psychology for the 21st Century is a 2007 book .
The book talks about the scientific psychology proposed by Frederic William Henry Myers .
The authors come from various fields of psychology , science studies , and psychical research .
Lead author Edward F. Kelly is Professor of Research in the Division of Perceptual Studies at the University of Virginia .

There was a slow decline in their numbers between about 1800 and 1870 , followed by a catastrophic decline between 1870 and 1890 .
Others argue that the species had not been common in the Pre-Columbian period , but their numbers grew when devastation of the American Indian population by European diseases led to reduced competition for food .
At the time , passenger pigeons had one of the largest groups or flocks of any animal , second only to the Rocky Mountain locust .
The Passenger Pigeon -LRB- Ectopistes migratorius -RRB- or wild pigeon was a species of pigeon that was once the most common bird in North America .
Some estimate that there were three billion to five billion passenger pigeons in the United States when Europeans arrived in North America .
The term passenger pigeon in English derives from the French word passager , meaning to pass by .
Some reduction in numbers happened because of habitat loss when the Europeans started settling further inland .
In the 18th century , the passenger pigeon in Europe was known to the French as tourtre ; but , in New France , the North American bird was called tourte .
The species went from being one of the most usual birds in the world during the 19th century to extinction early in the 20th century .
Martha , thought to be the world 's last passenger pigeon , died on September 1 , 1914 , in Cincinnati , Ohio .
The passenger pigeon , or , wild pigeon was a species of bird , Ectopistes migratorius , that was once common in North America .
The primary factor emerged when pigeon meat was commercialized as a cheap food for slaves and the poor in the 19th century , resulting in hunting on a massive scale .
In modern French , the bird is known as the pigeon migrateur .
In Algonquian languages , it was called amimi by the Lenape and omiimii by the Ojibwe .

These probes were built at JPL and were funded by NASA .
It consists of a pair of unmanned scientific probes , Voyager 1 and Voyager 2 .
Although they were officially used to study just Jupiter and Saturn , the two probes were able to continue their mission into the outer solar system .
Both missions have gathered large amounts of data about the gas giants of the solar system , of which little was known before .

Hoverflies are harmless to most other animals despite their mimicry of the black and yellow stripes of wasps . This is an example of warning colouration which serves to ward off predators .
In other species , the larvae are insectivores and prey on aphids , thrips , and other plant-sucking insects .
As their common name suggests , they are often seen hovering or sucking nectar at flowers . The adults of many species feed mainly on nectar and pollen , while the larvae -LRB- maggots -RRB- eat a wide range of foods .
Some adult syrphid flies are important pollinators .
About 6,000 species in 200 genera have been described .
Hoverflies are common throughout the world and can be found on most continent except Antarctica .
Aphids alone cause tens of millions of dollars of damage to crops worldwide every year . Hoverflies are important natural enemies of these pests , and can be used in biological control .
In some species , the larvae are saprotrophs , eating decaying plant and animal matter in the soil or in ponds and streams .

Persian limes are less acidic than key limes and do not have the bitterness that lends to the key lime 's unique flavor .
Persian Lime -LRB- Citrus x latifolia -RRB- , also known as Tahiti lime or Bearss lime is a kind of citrus fruit .
The Persian lime became more important when key lime orchards were wiped out by a hurricane in 1926 . Persian lime orchards themselves were devastated by Hurricane Andrew in 1992 .
Very often , it has slightly nippled ends . It is usually sold quite green , although it yellows as it reaches full ripeness .
U.S. Persian lime imports from Mexico are handled mostly through McAllen , Texas .
Persian limes are sold primarily in six sizes , known as 110 's , 150 's , 175 's , 200 's , 230 's and 250 's .
The Persian lime is bigger than the key lime , and has fewer seeds .
It is larger , thicker-skinned , and less aromatic than the key lime .
Large numbers of Persian limes are grown , processed and exported every year primarily from MartÃ nez de la Torre , Veracruz , Mexico , to the American , European and Asian markets .

Procopius of Caesarea -LRB- , c. 500 â `` c. 565 -RRB- was a prominent Eastern Roman scholar .
Procopius was the author of a history in eight books of the wars fought by Justinian I , a panegyric on Justinian 's public works throughout the empire , and a book known as the Secret History -LRB- Greek : Anekdota -RRB- that claims to report the scandals that Procopius could not include in his published history .
A number of historical novels based on Procopius ' works -LRB- along with other sources -RRB- have been written , of which the best , Count Belisarius , was written by poet and novelist Robert Graves in 1938 .
He is commonly held to be the last major historian of the ancient world .

The manual was developed from systems for collecting census and psychiatric hospital statistics , and from a manual written by the US Army . A lot of changes were made to it in 1980 .
There have been five revisions since it was first published in 1952 . Each time , more mental disorders were added , although some have been removed and are no longer seen as mental disorders .
The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders -LRB- DSM -RRB- is a guide to grouping mental disorders . It is published by the American Psychiatric Association .
It is used in the United States and around the world by doctors , researchers , health insurance companies , companies which make medicine , and others .
The last time it was greatly changed was the fourth edition -LRB- `` DSM-IV '' -RRB- , published in 1994 , but small changes to text were made in a 2000 version .

Colonel Loammi Baldwin -LRB- January 10 , 1744-October 20 , 1807 -RRB- was a noted American engineer , politician , and a soldier in the American Revolutionary War .
His son Benjamin worked on the Boston Mill Dam for before an early death at age 43 .
Until the end of 1775 , Baldwin and his men stayed near Boston , but in April 1776 , he was ordered with his command to New York City .
Baldwin is known as the Father of American Civil Engineering .
In 1774 Baldwin enlisted in a regiment , and commanded the Woburn militia at the Battle of Lexington and Concord as a major .
His son Cyrus continued his father 's work on the Middlesex Canal as an agent for the canal company .
Baldwin and his regiment participated in both the crossing and the fight .
He later worked on Boston 's fortifications .
In 1777 , Baldwin resigned from the army because of ill health .
From 1778-1784 , he represented Woburn in the Massachusetts General Court -LRB- the state legislature -RRB- .
At the beginning of the war he enlisted in the 26th Continental Regiment commanded by Colonel Samuel Gerrish .
In 1794 , he was a candidate for election to the United States House of Representatives , and obtained all the votes cast in Woburn but one .
He was appointed high sheriff of Middlesex County in 1780 , and was the first to hold office after the adoption of the state constitution .
On the night of December 25 , 1776 , in the face of a violent and extremely cold storm of snow and hail , General Washington and his army crossed the Delaware to the New Jersey side , and fought the Battle of Trenton .
He surveyed and built the Middlesex Canal , but today he is perhaps best remembered for the Baldwin apple which he discovered when surveying the Middlesex Canal , and then developed at his farm

From the 1830s to 1853 , Van Diemen 's Land was the main penal colony in Australia . When Britain stopped sending prisoners to New South Wales , all convicts were sent to Van Diemen 's Land .
Because the name Van Diemen 's Land was seen to be tied up with convicts and it sounded like the word `` demon '' , Van Diemen 's Land was renamed in 1856 . It was called Tasmania after Abel Tasman .
From the 1830s to 1853 , Van Diemen 's Land was the main penal colony in Australia .
When Britain stopped sending prisoners to New South Wales , all convicts were sent to Van Diemen 's Land .
Many went to the new free colony of Victoria . The free settlers in towns such as Melbourne did not like the ex-convicts coming to their town .
Convicts who had finished their time in prison or had been well behaved and given a ticket-of-leave often left Van Diemen 's Land .
Female convicts worked as servants in free settler 's houses or were sent to a female factory -LRB- women 's workhouse prison -RRB- .

Apple incorporated several features in the design of the MacBook Air , such as the reduction of toxic chemicals like lead , to make it more environmentally friendly .
The full-sized keyboard , weight of three pounds , thinness , and Multi-Touch trackpad were appreciated in reviews , while the limited configuration options , slow speed -LRB- in the non-SSD models -RRB- , non-user replaceable battery , small hard drive , and price were criticized .

They also enjoy feeding on vegetables .
These mounds will often appear in vegetable gardens , lawns , or farms , as gophers like moist soil .
Their presence is unambiguously announced by the appearance of mounds of fresh dirt about 20 cm in diameter .
Pocket Gophers are widely distributed in North America , extending into Central America .
Gophers can collect large hoards .
They are larder hoarders , and their cheek pouches are used for transporting food back to their burrows .
They may also damage trees in forests .
These are the `` true '' gophers . Several ground squirrels of the family Sciuridae are often called gophers as well .
Their most characteristic feature is their large cheek pouches . The pocket in their name comes from these pouches .
They extend from the side of the mouth well back onto the shoulders .
The name `` Pocket Gopher '' on its own is used for a number of subspecies of the family .
A few species reach weights approaching 1 kg .
Although they will attempt to flee when threatened , they may attack other animals , including cats and humans , and can inflict serious bites with their long , sharp teeth .
All pocket gophers are burrowers .
There has been much debate among taxonomists about which races of pocket gopher should be recognized as full species , and the following list can not be regarded as definitive .
These pouches are fur-lined , and can be turned inside out .
Most gophers have brown fur which often closely matches the color of the soil in which they live .
They have small eyes and a short , hairy tail which they use to feel around tunnels when they walk backwards .
Some sources also list a genus Hypogeomys , with one species , but this genus name is normally used for the Malagasy Giant Rat , which belongs to the family Nesomyidae .
The pocket gophers are burrowing rodents of the family Geomyidae .
For this reason , some species are considered agricultural pests .

During the Manhattan Project , which was when the United States , the United Kingdom , and Canada worked together during World War II to make the first nuclear weapons , there was much nuclear espionage in which scientists or technicians working for the project sent information about bomb development and designs to the Soviet Union .
There has been much disagreement over the exact details of these cases , though some of this was settled when VENONA Project transcripts were made public . These were secret messages between Soviet agents and the Soviet government that were discovered and decoded .
The investigations described in the report eventually led to the arrest of Wen Ho Lee , a scientist at Los Alamos , who was at first accused of giving weapons information to China .
Pakistan 's government says that they had no part in the espionage , but refuses to turn Khan over for questioning by the International Atomic Energy Agency .
While some of the information given , such as information given by Klaus Fuchs , could probably have been very helpful , the way the people in charge of the Soviet bomb project actually used the information has led later scholars to think it did not actually speed up the Soviet Union 's process of making bombs much .
On February 5 , 2004 , the president of Pakistan , General Pervez Musharraf , said that he had pardoned Khan .
These people are often called the Atomic Spies , and their work continued into the early Cold War .
Some issues remain unsettled , however .
The report said that China had `` stolen classified information on all of the United States ' most advanced thermonuclear warheads '' since the 1970s , including the design of advanced warheads , the neutron bomb , and `` weapons codes '' which allow for computer simulations of nuclear testing -LRB- and allow China to advance their weapon development without doing its own tests -RRB- .
No other arrests from the theft of the nuclear designs have been made .
There are also rules that keep countries who have signed non-proliferation agreements -LRB- which are meant to stop the spread of nuclear weapons -RRB- from sharing information about such weapons with the public .
The United States apparently did not know of this until 1995 .
Whether Vanunu was technically involved in espionage is debated : Vanunu and his supporters say that he should be called as a whistle-blower -LRB- someone who was exposing something secret and illegal -RRB- , while his opponents think that he is a traitor and that what he did helped enemies of Israel .
Khan had previously been said to have taken gas centrifuge designs from a uranium enrichment company in the Netherlands -LRB- URENCO -RRB- which he used to help Pakistan 's own nuclear weapons program get started .
Nuclear espionage is sharing a country 's secrets about nuclear weapons to other countries without permission .
In a 1999 report of the United States House of Representatives Select Committee on U.S. National Security and Military\/Commercial Concerns with the People 's Republic of China , chaired by Rep. Christopher Cox -LRB- called the Cox Report -RRB- , it was revealed that U.S. security agencies thought there was nuclear espionage going on by the People 's Republic of China -LRB- PRC -RRB- at Americans nuclear weapons design laboratories .
The case against Lee eventually fell apart , however , and he was eventually charged only with mishandling of data .
Since nuclear weapons have been invented , there have been many cases of known nuclear espionage , and also many cases where it has thought to have happened , but has not been proven .
Israel has never said that it does or does not have a nuclear weapons program , and Vanunu was kidnapped and smuggled to Israel , where he was convicted of treason and espionage .
In January 2004 , Dr. Abdul Qadeer Khan , a Pakistani nuclear scientist , admitted selling restricted nuclear weapons technology to Libya , Iran , and North Korea .
After Vanunu left Israel , he did not give his information right away . He traveled for about a year before doing so .
In 1986 , Mordechai Vanunu , who had worked at a nuclear facility in Israel , gave information about Israel 's nuclear weapons program to the British press . People had thought before that Israel had an advanced and secretive nuclear weapons program and collection , but now they knew for sure .
Because nuclear weapons are usually considered the most important of state secrets , all nations with nuclear weapons have strict rules against sharing information about how nuclear weapons are designed , where they are kept , and other things about them .
According to his testimony and reports from intelligence agencies , Khan sold designs for centrifuges used to enrich uranium and Chinese designs for a nuclear warhead , and sold centrifuges themselves to these three countries .
Other people and groups arrested or fined were scientist Peter Lee -LRB- not related to Wen Ho Lee -RRB- , who was arrested for allegedly giving submarine radar secrets to China , and Loral Space & Communications and Hughes Electronics , who gave China missile secrets .

Collisions are made from two smaller sections called elastic and inelastic collisions .
An elastic collision generally occurs when an elastic or hard object experiences a collision that bounces off another elastic or hard object , where the kinetic energy and momentum are the same before and after the collision .
In the case of a two dimensional collision , the rules in elastic and inelastic collision are still the same , but vectors are used to find the momentum before or after a collision .
An inelastic collision generally occurs when a soft object experiences a collision that does not result in a bounce . Kinetic energy is lost during this type of collision because the energy is transformed into other forces .
Bryology is the study of Bryophytes : Mosses , liverworts and hornworts .

The wet season lasts from December to March .
The Gulf is also a breeding ground for tropical cyclones from November and April .

The Gulf of Carpentaria is a large , shallow sea surrounded on three sides by northern Australia . Its north edge is the Arafura Sea ; the sea between Australia and New Guinea .
The dry season lasts from about April until November and is has very dry southeast to east winds , caused by winter high pressure systems to the south .

However , in the Italian War of 1859 , French forces were able to defeat the longer range of Austrian rifle muskets by quick , small attacks and bayonet attacks at close range .
Musket calibres ranged from 0.5 i to 0.8 i. A smooth bore musket , firing at a single target , was only accurate to about 50 y to 70 y. Rifled muskets in the 1850 's were much better , able to hit a man sized target at up to 500 y. The advantage of this longer distance was shown at the Battle of Four Lakes , where Springfield Model 1855 rifled muskets killed Indian warriors before they could get close enough with their smooth bore muskets .
In the 1800 's , better ammunition and ways of firing the gun , meant that rifling was practical for military use , and the rifled musket became common . A few years later , the use of cartridges , breechloading , and multiple rounds of ammunition meant the `` rifled musket '' gave way to `` rifle '' , and `` muskets '' were no longer used .
Muskets were made for use by infantry .
By the start of 1700 's , a lighter type of musket took over from the arquebus . When the bayonet was added , there was no longer a need for pikemen , and almost all infantry soldiers became musketeers .
A soldier armed with a musket was called a musketman or musketeer .
A musket is a muzzle-loaded , smoothbore long gun , which is meant to be fired from the shoulder .
In the 1500 's , soldiers armed with a heavy arquebus , called a musket , supported the arquebusiers and the pikemen .

The nave of a church goes from the entry to the chancel . It is flanked by aisles separated from the nave by an arcade .

An automatic feathering system was first brought out into the open on the Martin 4-0-4 aircraft , which was a piston engine airplane .
When the power being made by the engine falls to the point where it is not helping add to the thrust , the propeller will go into a feathered mode to help lower the amount of drag .
Autofeather is a feature of the engines on turboprop or piston engine aircraft .
The system was made to automatically feather an engine that failed during takeoff or the initial climb of the plane to its cruising altitude .

Team Lotus was the motorsport sister company of English sports car manufacturer Lotus Cars .
Under the direction of founder and Chief Designer Colin Chapman Lotus was responsible for many innovative and experimental developments in motorsport , in both technical and commercial arenas .
More than ten years after its last race Team Lotus remains one of the most successful racing teams of all time , winning seven Formula One Constructors ' titles , six Drivers ' Championships , and the Indianapolis 500 in the United States , between 1962 and 1978 .
The team ran cars in many motorsport series including Formula One , Formula Two , Formula Ford , Formula Junior , IndyCar and sports car racing .
In 2010 Lotus has returned to F1 as Lotus Racing .

This dry river stretches for sixty miles from the Grand Coulee Dam to Soap Lake .
The Grand Coulee used to be a river in the U.S. state of Washington .
The Upper Grand Coulee was dammed and made Banks Lake .
The Lower Grand Coulee contains the Park , Blue , Alkali , Lenore , and Soap lakes .
Until recently , the Upper Coulee was dry .
The area surrounding the Grand Coulee is shrub land . It has a rainfall of twelve inches per year .
The Columbia Basin Project dammed the river in 1952 . It used the Grand Coulee as an irrigation network .
The lake is filled by pumps from the Grand Coulee Dam . Banks Lake feeds a hundred mile -LRB- 160 km -RRB- irrigation system .
In principle , then , the only remaining problem was to be sure that a public key actually belonged to its claimed owner , this is not a problem easy to solve ; specially when the two users involved have never met and know nothing about each other .
In particular , it has not yet been solved for the modern situation of two previously unknown users attempting to communicate electronically , as , for instance , in electronic commerce .
If two parties wish to exchange encrypted messages , each needs to know how to decrypt received messages and to encrypt sent messages .
Public key infrastructures have been proposed go around the problem of `` identity authentication '' .
If an asymmetric key cipher with the public\/private key property , both will need the other 's public key .
Key exchange is any method in cryptography by which cryptographic keys are exchanged between users , allowing use of a cryptographic system .
Each user is responsible for verifying any certificate from another user before using that certificate to communicate with the user who claims to be associated with the particular public key in a certificate , -LRB- see digital signatures -RRB- .
If they use a code , both will require a copy of the same codebook .
Some of the existing work-around designs work , more or less , but are not fully satisfactory .
The key exchange problem is how to exchange whatever keys or other information needed so , in such a way , that no one else can obtain a copy .
The problem of key exchange has not yet been solved .
However , Diffie-Hellman key exchange did not address the `` identity authentication '' problem of being sure of the actual identity of the person or an entity .
With the arrival of -LRB- public key \/ private key -RRB- cipher algorithms , the encrypting key -LRB- aka , the public key -RRB- could be made public , since -LRB- at least for `` high quality '' ciphers -RRB- no one without the decrypting key -LRB- aka , the private key -RRB- could decrypt the message .
The information they require to do so depends on the encryption technique they might use .
In their most usual implementation , each user applies to a `` certificate authority '' for a digital certificate which serves for other users as a correct -LRB- termed : non-tamperable -RRB- authentication of identity .
In 1976 , Whitfield Diffie and Martin Hellman published a cryptographic protocol , -LRB- Diffie-Hellman key exchange -RRB- , which allows users to establish secure channels in order to exchange keys , even if an attacker is monitoring that communication channel .
If the cipher is a symmetric key cipher , both will need a copy of the same key .
Usually , this required trusted secure channel .
If they use a cipher , they will need appropriate keys .

University College London -LRB- UCL -RRB- is a public research university in London . It is the largest college of the federal University of London .
UCL had a total income of Â # 762 million in 2009\/10 , of which Â # 275 million was from research grants and contracts .
UCL has over 100 departments , institutes and research centres in eight faculties .
UCL was the first university institution to be founded in London and the first in England to be established on an entirely secular basis .
UCL 's main campus is in the Bloomsbury area of Central London , with a number of institutes and teaching hospitals located elsewhere in Central London .
It forms part of the ` Golden Triangle ' of British universities .
There are currently 36 Fellows of the Royal Society , 26 Fellows of the British Academy , 10 Fellows of the Royal Academy of Engineering and 78 Fellows of the Academy of Medical Sciences amongst UCL academic and research staff .
UCL has over 4,000 academic and research staff and 648 professors , the highest number of any British university .
UCL is ranked 21st in the world -LRB- and 3rd in Europe -RRB- in the 2010 Academic Ranking of World Universities , 4th in the world -LRB- and 2nd in Europe -RRB- in the 2010 QS World University Rankings and 22nd in the world -LRB- and 5th in Europe -RRB- in the 2010 Times Higher Education World University Rankings .
UCL is a major center for biomedical research ; it is part of three of the 12 biomedical research centres established by the NHS in England and is a founding member of UCL Partners , the largest academic health science center in Europe .

The oldest known document in Maltese is `` Il Cantilena , '' a poem from the 15th century written by Pietro Caxaro . For centuries , Maltese was mainly a spoken language .
Most of the television , radio , and literature in Malta is also in Maltese .
The language has borrowed many words from Sicilian , Italian , and English .
Maltese became an official language of Malta in 1936 , alongside English . Before that year , the only official language of Malta was Italian .
Maltese is the language of Malta , and a language of the European Union .
Very many plants can be either shrubs or trees , depending on the growing conditions .
In botany and ecology a shrub is more specifically used to describe the particular physical structural or plant life-form of woody plants which are less than 8 meters high and usually have many stems arising at or near the base .
For example , a descriptive system widely used in Australia is based on structural characteristics based on life-form , plus the height and amount of foliage cover of the tallest layer or dominant species .

Poison dart frog is the common name of a group of frogs in the family Dendrobatidae . They are native to Central and South America .
Although all dendrobatids are at least somewhat toxic in the wild , levels of toxicity vary greatly from one species to the next , and from one population to another .

At the boundary , the western edge of the Pacific Plate is subducted beneath the small Mariana Plate .
The Mariana Trench is the deepest known submarine trench . It is also the deepest known location on Earth itself .
The movement of these plates is also responsible for the formation of the Mariana Islands .
Because the Pacific plate is the largest of all the tectonic plates on Earth , crustal material at its western edge has had up to 170 million years to compact and become very dense ; hence its great height-difference relative to the higher-riding Mariana Plate , at the point where the Pacific Plate crust is subducted .
This deep area is the Mariana trench proper .

The Tollense is a river in Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania in northeastern Germany , right tributary of the Peene .
The Tollense is -LRB- -RRB- long and empties into the river Peene in Demmin .
Hundreds of bone fragments , as well as wooden weaponry and flintstone arrowheads have been discovered .

The core of that work is to measure , interpret , and describe some events in the world and spot patterns within them .
The field shares much common history with social science , but often with a greater view on complex mathematical methods .
Typical work might involve developing a model and sampling plans , analyzing survey results , or making agricultural or econometric forecasts .
Statistics was employed in ancient Egypt in censuses of population and cattle .
A statistician is someone who works with theoretical or applied statistics .
Many professional statisticians have a PhD .
They often are employed to support managerial decisions or to supervise quality control in manufacturing .
Of these people , approximately 30 % worked for governments -LRB- federal , state , or local -RRB- .
The profession exists in both the private and public sectors .
The applications are varied .
Civilizations have used the work of statisticians for thousands of years .
According to the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics , as of 2008 , there were 22,600 jobs listed as statistician in the United States .
Statisticians apply their knowledge to production , research , finance , medicine , insurance , census-taking , government , etc. .
Additionally , there are substantial numbers of persons who use statistics in their work but have job titles other than statistician .
It is common to combine statistical knowledge with expertise in other subjects .
The job of statistician is considered a profession .
Most employment as a statistician requires a minimum of a masters degree in statistics or a related field .
Most statisticians work in offices and have regular working hours and can therefore be considered to be white-collar workers .
A lower number of statisticians are self-employed as statistical consultants .

Her chief legal complaint was that she had been neither asked for permission for the adaptation nor paid any royalty .

The case dragged on for some years , with Mrs Stoker demanding the destruction of the negative and all prints of the movie .

Epicureanism is a philosophy based on the teachings of Epicurus . Epicureanism was started around 307 BC .
Epicureanism was originally a challenge to Platonism , though later it became the main opponent of Stoicism .
Epicurus was a materialist who believed there were atoms . The teaching about atoms was first started by Democritus .
Epicurus spoke favorably about the enjoyment of simple pleasures ; He also meant abstaining from bodily desires , such as sex and appetites , almost like asceticism .
Epicurus and his followers shunned politics .
After the death of Epicurus , his school was headed by Hermarchus ; later many Epicurean societies flourished in the Late Hellenistic era and during the Roman era -LRB- such as those in Antiochia , Alexandria , Rhodes and Ercolano -RRB- .
Some scholars consider the epic poem On the Nature of Things by Lucretius to present in one unified work the core arguments and theories of Epicureanism .
Epicureanism is a form of hedonism , because it declares that pleasure is the only good there really is .
He argued that when eating , one should not eat too richly , for it could lead to dissatisfaction later , such as the grim realization that one could not afford such delicacies in the future .
Some writings by Epicurus have survived .
Likewise , sex could lead to increased lust and dissatisfaction with the sexual partner .
In the Epicurean view , the highest pleasure -LRB- tranquility and freedom from fear -RRB- was obtained by knowledge , friendship and living a virtuous and temperate life .
Epicurus did not articulate a broad system of social morality that has survived .
The poet Lucretius is its most known Roman proponent .
By the end of the Roman Empire , having undergone Christian attack and repression , Epicureanism had all but died out , and would be resurrected in the 17th century by the atomist Pierre Gassendi , who adapted it to the Christian doctrine .
At least some are thought to have belonged to the Epicurean Philodemus .
Many of the papyrus scrolls unearthed at the Villa of the Papyri at Herculaneum are Epicurean texts .
New eruptions at the volcano since 1927 have built a new island , called Anak Krakatau -LRB- child of Krakatoa -RRB- .
A Plasma window is a field of plasma that fills an area of space .
The Plasma Valve is related to a plasma window .
The Plasma Window was created at Brookhaven National Laboratory by Ady Hershcovitch . It was patented in 1995 .
The plasma Valve is a layer of gas inside a special shell .
Plasma does not stop radiation , for example lasers , from moving through it . Because of this , scientists can use a plasma window to create an area of vacuum while still letting radiation to move through it .
With current technology , this area of space is quite small .

Black shales form in anoxic -LRB- without oxygen -RRB- conditions . They contain free carbon and iron sulfides such as pyrite .
Mudstones , on the other hand , are similar in composition but do not show the fissility .
The ratio of clay to other minerals is variable .
Shales and mudrocks contain roughly 95 percent of the organic matter in all sedimentary rocks .
Shale is characterized by breaks along thin laminae or parallel layering or bedding less than one centimeter in thickness , called `` fissility '' -LRB- = ~ splitting -RRB- .
Shale is a fine-grained sedimentary rock formed from mud . The mud is a mix of flakes of clay minerals and tiny fragments -LRB- silt-sized particles -RRB- of other minerals , especially quartz and calcite .
However , this amounts to less than one percent by mass in an average shale .

A joystick is an input device consisting of a stick that pivots on a base and reports its angle or direction to the device it is controlling .
A popular variation of the joystick used on modern video game consoles is the analog stick .

Acorns vary from 1 â `` 6 cm long and 0.8 â `` 4 cm broad .
Such large mammals as pigs , bears , and deer also consume large amounts of acorns : they may constitute up to 25 % of the diet of deer in the autumn .
Acorns are one of the most important wildlife foods in areas where oaks grow .
It is a nut , and contains a single seed -LRB- rarely two seeds -RRB- , enclosed in a tough , leathery shell .
Acorns take between about 6 or 24 months -LRB- that depends on the species -RRB- to mature .
In some of the large oak forests in southwest Europe , traditionally called `` dehesas '' , pigs are still turned loose in oak groves in the autumn , to fill and fatten themselves on acorns .
However , acorns are toxic to some other animals , such as horses .
Creatures that make acorns an important part of their diet include birds , such as jays , pigeons , some ducks and several species of woodpeckers .
Small mammals that feed on acorns include mice , squirrels and several other rodents .
The reform was largely carried out by Saint Odo . It spread through France -LRB- Burgundy , Provence , Auvergne , Poitou -RRB- , England and much of Italy and Spain .
William of Aquitaine formed the first Cluny monastery in 910 with the novel stipulation that the monastery would report directly to the pope rather than to a local lord .
The reform is named after the Abbey of Cluny in Burgundy . It started in the Benedictine order there .
This meant essentially that the monastery would be independent , since the pope 's authority was largely theoretical at that distance .
In a direct democracy , which is also called pure democracy the decisions are not taken by representatives .

The name galaxy is taken from the Greek word Galaxia meaning milky , a reference to our own galaxy , the Milky Way .
Typical galaxies range from dwarfs with as few as ten million -LRB- 107 -RRB- stars up to giants with a hundred trillion -LRB- 1014 -RRB- stars , all orbiting the galaxy 's center of mass. .
There are three main types of galaxies : ellipticals , spirals , and irregulars .
In the astronomical literature , the word ` Galaxy ' with a capital G is used for our galaxy , the Milky Way .
The billions of other galaxies are just written as ` galaxy ' with a lowercase g. The term Milky Way first came out in the English language in a poem by Chaucer .
Everything in a galaxy moves around a center . The name galaxy is taken from the Greek word Galaxia meaning milky , a reference to our own galaxy , the Milky Way .
The Sun is one of the stars in the Milky Way galaxy ; the Solar System includes the Earth and all the other objects that orbit the Sun .
Galaxies may contain many multiple star systems , star clusters , and various interstellar clouds .
In Greek mythology , Zeus places his son -LRB- the baby Heracles -RRB- whose mother was a mortal woman on Hera 's breast while she is sleeping so that the baby will drink her divine milk and become immortal .
Many galaxies also continue to form new generations of stars . The Milky Way , and all spiral shaped galaxies like it -LRB- see above image of NGC 2997 -RRB- , produce new stars at a rate of one or two stars per year .
However , Hera wakes up while she is breastfeeding the baby and realizes she is nursing a baby she does not know . According to Greek mythology , she then pushes the baby away and a stream of her milk sprays the night sky , making a faint band of light known as the Milky Way .
