There is a black tuft at the end of the tail , similar to a lion 's tail .
368 of these Macaque are reported to live in zoos .
The lion-tailed macaque -LRB- Macaca silenus -RRB- is an Old World monkey . It lives in the Western Ghats mountains of India .
It is a good climber and spends most of its life in the upper branches .
Unlike other macaques , it avoids humans .
The hair of the Lion-tailed macaque is dark-brown or black .
Many zoos take part in breeding programs to help this species survive .
The BMI was invented by Adolphe Quetelet between 1830 and 1850 .
For example , in the United States in 2007 , 74 % of adults had a BMI above 25 -LRB- Overweight or Obese -RRB- and 27 % of adults had a BMI above 30 -LRB- Obese -RRB- .
BMI is less useful for finding out whether one person is too fat or too thin . BMI does not say how much weight is fat , how much is muscle and how much is bone .
The body mass index -LRB- or BMI -RRB- is a measure which shows whether people have the right weight for their height .
They are too fat but their BMI is normal .
BMI is useful for governments who want to know about the health of their people . For example , in the United States in 2007 , 74 % of adults had a BMI above 25 -LRB- Overweight or Obese -RRB- and 27 % of adults had a BMI above 30 -LRB- Obese -RRB- .
In 1888 , Roux published the results of a series of defect experiments in which he took 2 and 4 cell frog embryos and killed half of the cells of each embryo with a hot needle .
His methodology was to interfere with developing embryos and observe the outcome .
This led him to propose his `` mosaic '' theory : after a few cell divisions the embryo would be like a mosaic , each cell playing its own unique part in the entire design .
After a few years Roux 's theory was refuted by the studies of his colleague Hans Driesch and later , with more precision , Hans Spemann showed that , as a rule , Driesch 's conclusions were correct , but that results like Roux 's may be obtained after intervention in certain planes .
Roux 's research was based upon the notion of Entwicklungsmechanik or developmental mechanics .
Wilhelm Roux -LRB- Jena , Germany , 9 June 1850 â `` 15 September 1924 -RRB- was a German zoologist and pioneer of experimental embryology .
Despite this early lapse Roux 's pioneering mechanical methodology was to prove most fruitful in 20th century biology .
He reported that they grew into half-embryos and surmised that the separate function of the two cells had already been determined .
For ten years he worked in Breslau -LRB- now Wroclaw -RRB- , becoming director of his own Institute of Embryology in 1879 .
Roux 's investigations were performed mainly on frogs ' eggs to research the earliest structures in amphibian development .
His goal was to show Darwinian processes at work on the cellular level .
He was professor at Innsbruck , Austria from 1889 â `` 95 , then accepted a professorial chair at the Anatomical Institute of the University of Halle , a post he retained until 1921 .

Oenothera is a genus of about 125 species of annual , biennial and perennial herbaceous flowering plants , native to North and South America .
Common names include evening primrose , suncups , and sundrops .
It is the type genus of the family Onagraceae .

Ergastic substances may appear in the protoplasm , in vacuoles , or in the cell wall .
The living protoplasm of a cell is sometimes called the bioplasm and something else than the ergastic substances of the cell .
These are usually organic or inorganic substances that are products of metabolism , and include crystals , oil drops , gums , tannins , resins and other compounds that can help the organism in defense , maintenance of cellular structure , or just substance storage .
Ergastic substances are non-protoplasm materials that one can find in cells .

Walker and John Norvell in June 1829 as The Pennsylvania Inquirer and is the third-oldest surviving daily newspaper in the United States .

Thracian troops accompanied neighboring ruler Alexander the Great when he crossed the Hellespont -LRB- which abuts Thrace -RRB- and took on the Persian Empire of the day .
The Thracians were an ancient Indo-European people inhabiting Central , Eastern and Southeastern Europe .
The Thracians did not describe themselves as such and Thrace and Thracians are simply the names given them by the Greeks .
Recent funeral mounds in Bulgaria suggest that Thracian kings did rule regions of Thrace with distinct Thracian national identity .
The indigenous population of Thrace was a people called the Thracians , divided into numerous tribal groups .
Thrace is a historical and geographic area in southeast Europe .
Like Illyrians , Thracian tribes of the mountainous regions had a warrior tradition , while the tribes based in the plains were more peaceable .
Divided into separate tribes , the Thracians did not manage to form a lasting political organization until the Odrysian state was founded in the 4th century BC .
Thrace included areas which are now southeastern Bulgaria , northeastern Greece , and the European part of Turkey .

For more complex fields with preformatted contents that would still be present if a parameter was unset , you can wrap it all in a simple `` if '' statement to make the whole thing vanish when not used .
Each row on the table can either be a `` header '' , or it can have a label\/data pair , or it can just be a data cell .
; name : The template page name that the `` view\/discuss\/edit '' links should point to .
Image is centered by default .
See Infobox for information on how to craft infoboxes in general .
; caption : Text to put underneath the image .
Use full image syntax , for example .
These are mutually exclusive states so if you define a row to be both a header and a label\/data pair , the label\/data pair is overridden .
This template is intended as a meta-template , that is , a template that 's used when constructing other templates .
It 's not meant for use directly in an article .
Usage is similar to , but with an additional distinction .
To make a field optional , use a parameter that defaults to an empty string , like so :
; image : An image to display at the top of the template .
; header -LRB- n -RRB- : Text to use as a header in row n. ; label -LRB- n -RRB- : Text to use as a label in row n. ; data -LRB- n -RRB- : Text to display as data in row n. ; below : Text to put in the bottom cell .
The bottom cell is intended for footnotes , see-also , and other such information .
Here 's a stale example of the output generated by this template .
The content is drawn randomly from a pre-defined list .
This template generates a box for a portal home page .
To see a real time example , see what links here .
Monifieth is a town and former police burgh in the council area of Angus , Scotland .
It also has other names , like Euler 's number -LRB- because of the Swiss mathematician Leonhard Euler -RRB- , or Napier 's constant -LRB- because of the Scottish mathematician John Napier -RRB- .
It is found in the region Pays de la Loire in the Sarthe department in the west of France .
Basement rock is too infertile to be farmed , but provides sporadic forest cover that can be grazed by animals .
It is divided into three federal states within Sudan : Gharb Darfur -LRB- West Darfur -RRB- , Janub Darfur -LRB- South Darfur -RRB- , and Shamal Darfur -LRB- North Darfur -RRB- .
To the north the goz is overtaken by the desert sands of the Sahara .
The region 's main towns are Al Fashir , Nyala , and Geneina .
It is largely an arid plateau with the Marrah Mountains -LRB- Jebel Marra -RRB- , a range of volcanic peaks rising up to 3000 m -LRB- 10,100 ft -RRB- , in the center of the region .
The west of Darfur is dominated by the third feature , basement rock , sometimes covered with a thin layer of sandy soil .
The fourth and final feature are the Marrah Mountains , that rise up to a peak at Deriba crater where there is a small area of temperate climate , high rainfall and permanent springs of water .
In many places the goz is waterless and can only be inhabited where there are water reservoirs or deep boreholes .
A second feature are the wadis , seasonal watercourses ranging from small rivulets that flood only occasionally during the wet season to large wadis that flood for most of the rains and flow from western Darfur hundreds of miles west to Lake Chad .
The whole eastern half of Darfur is covered with plains and low hills of sandy soils , known as goz , and sandstone hills .
There are four main features of the physical geography .
Many wadis have pans of alluvium with rich soil that are also difficult to cultivate .

The last Maya states , the Itza city of Tayasal and the Ko ` woj city of Zacpeten , were continuously occupied . They remained independent of the Spanish until late in the 17th century .
At some point , the ruling dynasties of Chichen and Uxmal declined . Afterwards , Mayapan ruled all of YucatÃ n until a revolt in 1450 .
The Ko ` woj had their capital at Zacpeten .
The area then broke up into competing city-states until the YucatÃ n was conquered by the Spanish .
They traded with many of the other Mesoamerican cultures , such as Teotihuacan , the Zapotec , and other groups in central and gulf-coast Mexico .
They were finally conquered in 1697 .
Some of the important sites in this era were Chichen Itza , Uxmal , EdznÃ , and Coba .
Tayasal ruled over an area extending across the Peten Lakes region , encompassing the community of Eckixil on Lake Quexil .
Well-known cities were Tikal , Palenque , CopÃ n and Calakmul . Lesser-known cities were Dos Pilas , Uaxactun , Altun Ha , and Bonampak , among others .
The maya Itza , Ko ` woj , and Yalain groups of Central Peten survived the `` Classic Period Collapse '' in small numbers . By 1250 , they started to form competing city-states .
One of the Maya kingdoms in this area , the QuichÃ , is responsible for the best-known Maya work of historiography and mythology , the Popol Vuh .
Some of the things the Maya did changed the way other people did the same things , even as far away as central Mexico which is more than km -LRB- 625 miles -RRB- from where the Maya lived .
It was at its strongest and most advanced between 250 AD and 900 AD . This is called the Classic period .
The Maya also made carved stone slabs usually called stelae -LRB- the Maya called them tetun , or `` tree-stones '' -RRB- . These slabs show rulers along with hieroglyphic texts -LRB- a type of writing -RRB- describing their genealogy , military victories , and other things that they did successfully .
The most notable monuments are the pyramids they built in their religious centers and the palaces of their leaders .
The Itza maintained their capital at Tayasal -LRB- also known as Noh PetÃ n -RRB- . The remains of this city are thought to be below the modern city of Flores , Guatemala on Lake PetÃ n ItzÃ .
Some known population centers in the north were Oxkintok , Chunchucmil , and the early occupation of Uxmal .
The palace at CancuÃ n is the largest in the Maya area . There are no pyramids near the palace .
Today , the Maya and their descendants are a big part of the population in the Maya area . They still have many of the same traditions and beliefs that the Maya from classic times had .
For example , archaeologists -LRB- people who study ancient things -RRB- found gold from Panama in the Sacred Cenote of Chichen Itza .
The Maya civilization was from the northern Central American region . It included some of the places that are now known as Guatemala , Belize , western Honduras and El Salvador , as well as the southern Mexican states of Chiapas , Tabasco , and the YucatÃ n Peninsula states of Quintana Roo , Campeche and YucatÃ n.
The area is normally divided into three parts : the southern Maya highlands , the southern -LRB- or central -RRB- Maya lowlands , and the northern Maya lowlands .

Modern Anti-Armenianism is usually associated with either extreme opposition to the actions or existence of the Armenian Republic , and belief in an Armenian conspiracy .
Anti-Armenianism is hostility toward or prejudice against Armenian people , Armenian culture and the Republic of Armenia , which can range in expression from individual hatred to institutionalized persecution .
Several organizations have stated that difficulties currently experienced by the Armenian minority in Turkey are a result of an anti-Armenian attitude by the Turkish government as well as by ultra-nationalist groups such as the Grey Wolves .
For several months in 1994 , Ahmet CoÅ ar going by the alias of Serdar Argic posted thousands of messages , claiming that the Armenian Genocide did not happen or that Armenians massacred Turks , on Usenet newsgroup threads mentioning the word Turkey .
The controversy and emotions surrounding the Armenian Genocide and Nagorno-Karabakh are two examples of intense anti-Armenianism in both countries .
Modern anti-Armenianism often seems to lacks a racial and cultural basis and appears to be based more on geopolitics and history , in addition to diplomatic and strategic interests , involving the modern states of Turkey and Azerbaijan .

A diminutive is a formation of a word used to express smallness of the object or quality that is meant with the word the diminutive is formed from .
Terms such as `` undies '' for underwear and `` movie '' for `` moving picture '' are frequently heard terms in English .
Diminutives are common in most dialects of English .

Mongolia is a landlocked country in East Asia and Central Asia .
During the collapse of the Qing Dynasty in 1911 , Mongolia declared independence , but had to struggle with the Soviet Union 's help , until 1921 before the world accepted its independence .
The area which is Mongolia has been ruled by various nomadic empires until the great ` Mongol Empire ' was founded by Genghis Khan in 1206 .
After the 16th century , Mongolia came under the influence of Tibetan Buddhism and by the end of the 17th century , most of Mongolia had been incorporated into the area ruled by the Qing Dynasty .
After the collapse of the Yuan Dynasty , the Mongols returned to their earlier nomadic lifestyle .
Mongolia 's political system is a parliamentary republic .

Green Park tube station is a London Underground station located on the north side of Green Park , close to the intersection of Piccadilly and the pedestrian Queen 's Walk .
London Buses routes 8 , 9 , 14 , 19 , 22 and 38 serve the station .

It is in Travelcard Zone 1 .
An elective monarchy can sometimes seem to be a hereditary monarch .
Hereditary monarchies most usually arrange the succession by a law that creates an order of succession . This way , it is known beforehand who will be the next monarch .
When that child dies , the crown will be then passed to his or her child , or , if he or she has no child , to a sister , brother , niece , nephew , cousin , or some other relative .
In a hereditary monarchy , all the monarchs come from the same family , and the crown is passed down from one member of the family to another .
It is the most common sort of monarchy , and is the form used by almost all of the world 's monarchies today .
When the king or queen of a hereditary monarchy dies or quits the throne -LRB- abdicates -RRB- , the crown is generally passed to one of his or her children , often to the oldest .
Nowadays , the order of succession in hereditary monarchies is often based on the idea of primogeniture -LRB- oldest born -RRB- , but there have been other methods that were much more common in the past .
The ideal gas law is the equation of a possible ideal gas , first made by BenoÃ t Paul Ã mile Clapeyron in 1834 .
where is the absolute pressure of the gas , is the volume of the gas , is the number of moles of gas , is the universal gas constant , is the absolute temperature .

Louis I of Holland -LRB- Lodewijk Napoleon in Dutch -RRB- -LRB- 1779-1884 -RRB- , was the youngre brother of Napoleon Bonaparte , who made him King of the Kingdom of Holland in 1806 .
After the death of his elder brother Joseph in 1844 , Louis was seen by Bonapartists as the rightful Emperor of the French , although he took little action himself to advance the claim .
Thanks to Napoleon , he was a general by the age of 25 , although he himself felt that he had risen too far in too short a time .
He took his duties as king seriously , calling himself Koning Lodewijk I -LRB- adopting the Dutch form of his name -RRB- He practiced to speak Dutch language and trying hard to be a responsible , independent ruler of Holland .
Napoleon finally removed Louis to the Dutch throne and take over the entire Kingdom of Holland on July i , 1810 .
Upon his return to France , he was involved in Napoleon 's plot to overthrow the Directory .
His attempt at speaking the language earned him some respect from his subjects .
Napoleon made him king of Holland on June 5 1806 .
Two major tragedies occurred during his reign : the explosion of a ship filled with gunpowder in the heart of the city of Leiden in 1807 , and a major flood in 1809 .
His son and heir , Charles Louis-Napoleon Bonaparte , on the other hand , was at that time imprisoned in France for having tried to engineer a Bonapartist coup d' Ã tat .
After becoming first consul , Napoleon arranged a marriage for Louis to Hortense de Beauharnais , the daughter of Empress Josephine and Napoleon 's stepdaughter .
Hortense , who was opposed to the marriage , was convinced by her mother to marry Louis for the sake of the family .
His early career was spent in the army and he served with Napoleon in Egypt .
Napoleon then suggested that Louis should abdicate but his brother refused .
In both instances , Louis personally and effectively oversaw local relief efforts , which helped earn him the nickname of Louis the Good .
It is located about 15 km southeast of Aue , and 35 km southwest of Chemnitz .
These questions affect ethics , politics and theology .
Human nature refers to the characteristics of mankind . This includes ways of thinking , feeling and acting , that humans tend to have naturally .
The complex implications of such questions are also dealt with in art and literature , while the humanities inquire into human nature , and what it means to be human .
Aristotle , Plato 's most famous student , made some of the most famous and influential statements about human nature .
For Aristotle , reason is what is most special about humanity compared to other animals , and is what we achieve at our best .
What these characteristics are , what causes them and how fixed human nature is , are good questions . They among the oldest and most important questions in western philosophy .
Much of Aristotle 's description of human nature is still influential today , but the particular teleological idea that humans are `` meant '' or intended to be something , has become much less popular in modern times .

A laser light is made of waves all lined up . Laser light stays in a straight , concentrated beam .

New members for each organization are elected annually by current members , based on their distinguished and continuing achievements in original research .
The NRC is called the `` working arm '' of the Academies , which serves to collect , analyze , and share information through studies and reports .
The NAS , NAE , and IOM are honorary membership organizations , with a total membership of over 6,000 scientists , engineers , and health professionals .
The National Academies produce independent recommendations and policy reports by enlisting top scientists , engineers , health professionals , and other experts -LRB- not limited to those in Academies membership -RRB- to address important scientific and technical problems .
The external sponsors have no control over the conduct or results of a study , once the statement of task and budget are finalized .
The National Academies do not perform original research ; rather they provide independent advice .

Social studies is a little different than social science , though many of the social sciences are covered in social studies .
Social studies is the name of a course or set of courses taught in primary and secondary schools or elementary , middle , and high schools , but is also sometimes the study of parts of human society at tertiary education schools around the world .
At primary school , social studies is usually about the local community and family .
An object with a higher average density than the fluid has less buoyancy than weight and it will sink .
The net upward buoyancy force is equal to the magnitude of the weight of fluid that is displaced by the body . This force enables the object to float or at least to seem lighter .
A ship floats because although it is made of steel which is more dense than water , it encloses a volume of air and the resulting shape has an average density less than that of the water .

A hydrogen bond is a special type of dipole-dipole bond that exists between an electronegative atom and a hydrogen atom bonded to another electronegative atom .
This type of bond always involves a hydrogen atom .
Hydrogen bonds can occur between molecules -LRB- intermolecularly -RRB- , or within different parts of a single molecule -LRB- intramolecularly -RRB- .
Intermolecular hydrogen bonding is responsible for the high boiling point of water -LRB- 100 Â C -RRB- .
The typical hydrogen bond is stronger than van der Waals forces , but weaker than covalent , ionic and metallic bonds .

Crises are labeled to be negative or bad changes in the security , economic , political , societal or environmental issues , especially when they happen unexpectedly -LRB- with little or no warning -RRB- .
A crisis -LRB- plural : crises -RRB- , coming from the Greek Î Ï Î Ï Î Ï -LRB- krisis -RRB- is any event that is , or expected to lead to , a dangerous or consequential situation affecting one person , an entire group , community or whole society .
An industry term is a type of technical terminology that has a particular meaning within a specific industry .
The phrase industry term implies that a word or phrase is a typical one within a particular industry or business and people within the industry or business will be familiar with and use the term .
The term jargon can , and often does , have pejorative -LRB- negative -RRB- connotations , particularly when aimed at `` business culture '' .
These terms have specific definitions within the field , which is not necessarily the same as their meaning in common use .
Technical terminology is the specialized vocabulary of a field .
The marketing and public relations industries in particular have expanded the vocabulary of jargon that marks the global business environment .
Jargon is similar , but more informal in definition and use , while legal terms of art or words of art have meanings that are strictly defined by law .

Qincheng Prison -LRB- ç å ç ` ç -RRB- is a maximum-security prison located in the Changping District northwest of Beijing in the People 's Republic of China .
The prison was built in 1958 with aid from the Soviet Union and it is the only prison belonging to the Ministry of Public Security .
Famous inmates include Jiang Qing , Bao Tong , Dai Qing , as well as Tibetans such as Choekyi Gyaltsen , the 10th Panchen Lama , and Phuntsok Wangyal .
The American black bear -LRB- scientific name Ursus americanus -RRB- is North America 's smallest and most common species of bear .
The American black bear is listed by the IUCN as Least Concern , because the species has a large global population estimated to be twice that of all other bear species combined .
Black bears usually live in forested areas , but do leave forests in search of food .

Carnarvon is a coastal town about 900 kilometres north of Perth , Western Australia .
The town began in 1883 , as a port and supply center for the surrounding region . It is the administrative center for the Shire of Carnarvon , the town site was officially listed on 4 June 1891 .
Only the foundations of this historical site remain .
The popular Shark Bay World Heritage Site lies to the south of the town .
On 20 May 1988 , the bulk carrier Korean Star ran aground in bad weather near Cape Cuvier , within the port limits of Carnarvon .
The ship was left grounded , however very little of the wreck remains to be seen .
Carnarvon has had three tramways .
Average minimums are 23 Â C and 11 Â C respectively .
Damage was limited to 10 km of remote beaches and coastline .
Around 600 tonnes of fuel oil were spilled into the ocean .
Radio Australia had a shortwave relay station -LRB- built during the 1970s -RRB- that used to relay programming to Europe , South Asia and South East Asia .
Carnarvon has a warm to hot dry climate .
There are five schools in the town , three government-run and two independent .
In 2006 there were 5,283 people living in Carnarvon .
The tracking station was closed in the mid 1970s .
Occasionally tropical cyclones will influence Carnarvon and bring very heavy rain , high tempretures and strong winds . Apart from possible cyclones , summers are usually dry .
It was named after Henry Herbert , 4th Earl of Carnarvon , Under-Secretary of State for the Colonies .

Rye House railway station is in Hoddesdon in Hertfordshire , England .
The typical off-peak service from the station is two trains per hour to London Liverpool Street via Tottenham Hale , and two trains per hour to Hertford East .
It is on the Hertford East branch of the West Anglia Main Line , and train services are provided by National Express East Anglia .

On August 15 , a tropical storm watch was given to the islands of St. Maarten , Saba , St. Eustatius , Antigua , Barbuda , the British Virgin Islands , Montserrat , St. Kitts and Nevis , Anguilla , and the United States Virgin Islands .
Later on August 17 , Puerto Rico , Dominica , Guadeloupe , St. Martin , and St. Barthelemy were also put on tropical storm watch .
Between August 15 and 17 , the National Hurricane Center -LRB- NHC -RRB- gave out tropical storm watches to some Caribbean islands like the Lesser Antilles , Puerto Rico , and the Dominican Republic .
People also reported tornadoes and waterspouts created by Ana in Puerto Rico .
Some streets had to be shut down because of the flooding .
Tropical Storm Ana was the first tropical storm of the 2009 Atlantic hurricane season . It was also the first tropical cyclone to affect the Caribbean during 2009 .
About 6,000 people lost electricity from the storm . Tree branches broke down power lines .
In St. Thomas , wind speeds from Ana were recorded at 28 mph -LRB- 45 km\/h -RRB- and gusts peaked at 40 mph -LRB- 65 km\/h -RRB- .
Ana later reformed and became a tropical storm on August 15 before wind shear tore apart the storm again .

The final and most significant stage of this liberation was the development of oxygen-producing photosynthesis , since the main chemical inputs for this are carbon dioxide and water .
In moist conditions mats are usually held together by slimy substances secreted by the micro-organisms .118 ; 1671-7 Some of the micro-organisms form tangled webs of filaments which make the mat tougher .
Microbial mats were abundant on the shallow seabed until the Cambrian substrate revolution , when animals living in shallow seas increased their burrowing capabilities and thus broke up the surfaces of mats and let oxygenated water into the deeper layers , poisoning the oxygen-intolerant micro-organisms that lived there .
Although usually only a few centimetres thick , microbial mats create a wide range of internal chemical environments . They consist of layers of microorganisms that can feed on or tolerate the chemicals at their level .
Microbial mats were abundant on the shallow seabed until the Cambrian substrate revolution , when animals living in shallow seas increased their burrowing capabilities and thus broke up the surfaces of mats and let oxygenated water into the deeper layers , poisoning the oxygen-intolerant micro-organisms that lived there . Although this revolution drove mats off soft floors of shallow seas , they still flourish in many environments where burrowing is limited or impossible , including rocky seabeds and shores , hyper-saline and brackish lagoons , and are found on the floors of the deep oceans .
Originally they may have depended on hydrothermal vents for energy and chemical `` food '' . The development of photosynthesis gradually liberated them from the ` hydrothermal ghetto ' by proving a more widely-available energy source , sunlight , although initially the photosynthesizing mats still depended on the diffusion of chemicals emitted by hydrothermal vents .
They colonize environments ranging in temperature from â `` 40 Â C to +120 Â C. A few are endosymbionts of animals .
As a result microbial mats began to produce the atmosphere we know today , in which free oxygen is a vital component .
Because of microbial mats ' ability to use almost anything as nutrients , there is considerable interest in industrial uses of mats , especially for water treatment and for cleaning up pollution .
The best known physical forms are flat mats and stubby pillars called stromatolites , but there are also spherical forms .
Microbial mats grow mostly on submerged or moist surfaces but a few survive in deserts .
At around the same time they may also have been the birthplace of the more complex eukaryote type of cell , of which all multicellular organisms are composed .
Microbial mats grow mostly on submerged or moist surfaces but a few survive in deserts . They colonize environments ranging in temperature from â `` 40 Â C to +120 Â C. A few are endosymbionts of animals .
Although this revolution drove mats off soft floors of shallow seas , they still flourish in many environments where burrowing is limited or impossible , including rocky seabeds and shores , hyper-saline and brackish lagoons , and are found on the floors of the deep oceans .

Conditions can be a specific time during development in the life of the organism or limited to a specific tissue , for example .
The construct has the mutated gene or part of it , and a reporter gene , which may be a selectable marker .
Mario R. Capecchi , Martin J. Evans and Oliver Smithies were declared laureates of the 2007 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their work on `` principles for introducing specific gene modifications in mice by the use of embryonic stem cells '' , or gene targeting .
Gene targeting can be permanent or conditional .
The method can be used to delete a gene , remove control sections , add a gene , and introduce point mutations .
First a DNA construct is made , usually in bacteria .
Gene targeting is a genetic technique for replacing an existing gene with a mutated -LRB- changed -RRB- one .

Spider-Man is one of the most well know superheroes ever created . He is normally considered to Marvel Comic 's flagship character .
Marvel has featured Spider-Man in several comic book series such as The Amazing Spider-Man , Spectacular Spider-Man and Sensational Spider-Man and so on over the years .
The series featured Peter Parker , a teenage high school student who sometimes suffered rejection , inadequacy , and loneliness , that most young readers could easily relate to .
Peter Parker has developed himself from shy high school student to troubled but outgoing college student to married high school teacher but his most typical adult role is being a single freelance photographer .
Unlike some teen heroes such as Bucky and Robin , Spider-Man never had any adult mentors Captain America and Batman to teach him to be an superhero and thus he had to learn for himself that `` with great power comes great responsibility '' â '' a quote that he would cherish from his late Uncle Ben after he died .
The first time that Spider-Man -LRB- who is also known as -RRB- Peter Parker appeared was in the Amazing Fantasy # 15 comic book in August 1962 .
Because of the success it had , Spider-Man obtains his own comic book series called The Amazing Spider-Man and others would soon be created such as Spectacular Spider-Man , Sensational Spider-Man and Ultimate Spider-Man .
Spider-Man first appeared in the early 1960s when teenagers in superhero comic books were usually relegated to the role of sidekick to the protagonist .
And then in the Marvel Animation Age in 1994 there was another series about him and there wa an spin off of it called Spider-Man Unlimited . After the Sam Raimi movies there was an animated series of Spider-Man in MTV called Spider-Man : The New Animated Series and in 2008 there is an animated series called The Spectacular Spider-Man .
He has also been adopted in other media such as television and video games and most popularly Sam Raimi 's film trilogy which includes Spider-Man , Spider-Man 2 , and Spider-Man 3 .

The DC-10 was first ordered by launch customers American Airlines with 25 orders , and United Airlines with 30 orders and 30 options in 1968 .
The McDonnell Douglas DC-10 is an American three-engine medium - to long-range widebody airliner , with two engines mounted on underwing pylons and a third engine at the base of the vertical stabilizer .
The DC-10 became McDonnell Douglas 's first commercial airliner after the merger between McDonnell Aircraft Corporation and Douglas Aircraft Company in 1967 .
The DC-10 was succeeded by the related McDonnell Douglas MD-11 which entered service in 1990 .
Production of the DC-10 ended in December 1988 with 386 delivered to airlines and 60 to the U.S. Air Force as air-to-air refueling tankers , designated the KC-10 Extender .
-LRB- 6 -RRB- The DC-10 's similarity to the L-1011 in terms of passenger capacity and launch in the same timeframe resulted in a head to head sales competition which affected profitability of the aircraft .
In 1966 , American Airlines offered a specification to manufacturers for a widebody aircraft smaller than the Boeing 747 but capable of flying similar long-range routes from airports with shorter runways .
Douglas Aircraft began design studies based on its CX-HLS design .
The DC-10 , a series 10 model , made its first flight on August 29 , 1970 .
Following a flight test program with 929 flights covering 1,551 hours , the DC-10 was awarded a type certificate from the FAA on July 29 , 1971 It entered commercial service with American Airlines on August 5 , 1971 on a round trip flight between Los Angeles and Chicago .
The model was a successor to the company 's DC-8 for long-range operations , and competed in the same markets as the Airbus A300 , Boeing 747 , and Lockheed L-1011 Tristar , which has a similar layout to the DC-10 .
United Airlines began DC-10 service on August 16 , 1971 .

The arena opened in 2000 , and right now the Columbus Blue Jackets of the National Hockey League -LRB- NHL -RRB- and the Columbus Destroyers of the Arena Football League -LRB- AFL -RRB- play there .
Rapid deepening is a condition that happens when the minimum sea-level atmospheric pressure of a tropical cyclone goes down at lot very quickly .
The National Weather Service describes rapid deepening as a decrease of 42 millibars in less than 24 hours .

As the HDS is being edited in the three official languages of Switzerland , the template contains links to the German , French and Italian versions of the HDS article .
The ID number is apparent in the URL of the HDS article , for example http://www.hls-dhs-dss.ch/textes/d/D16654.php .
Some articles may not yet be available in all languages , but they are supposed to eventually be .
In articles pertaining to the history of Switzerland , to link to the corresponding online Historical Dictionary of Switzerland -LRB- HDS -RRB- article , usually under the `` References '' or `` Other websites '' heading .
Dead links in one or two languages are therefore no cause for concern .
where ID is the ID number of the HDS article .

dec or Î -RRB- is a word used in astronomy to describe one of the two coordinates of the equatorial coordinate system , the other being either right ascension or hour angle .
Declination -LRB- abbrev .
Dec is comparable to latitude , projected onto the celestial sphere , and is measured in degrees north and south of the celestial equator .

Albert Charles Paul Marie Roussel -LRB- 5 April 1869 - 23 August 1937 -RRB- was a French composer .
His fellow students were Erik Satie and the young Edgard VarÃ se .
After Roussel stopped working with the Navy in 1894 , he began to study music with EugÃ ne Gigout . Albert continued his studies until 1908 at the Schola Cantorum -LRB- one of his teachers there was Vincent d'Indy -RRB- .

The 1997 Qayen earthquake was a large earthquake that struck in Northern Iran 's Khorasan Province on May 10 , 1997 . It was also known as the Quayen , Ardekul or Qaen earthquake .
It was the largest in that area since 1990 and measured 7.3 on the moment magnitude scale .

Mark McGwire and Rafael Palmeiro are the only currently eligible club members not elected to the Hall .
Being a member of the 500 home run club is sometimes described as a guarantee of entry into the Baseball Hall of Fame . Some believe the milestone has become less meaningful in recent years .
Also , several of these recent members have had ties to performance-enhancing drugs .
On August 11 , 1929 , Babe Ruth became the first member of the club .
Ruth ended his career with 714 home runs . This record stood from 1935 until Hank Aaron broke it in 1974 .
Four 500 home run club membersâ '' Aaron , Mays , Eddie Murray , and Rafael Palmeiroâ '' are also members of the 3,000 hit club .
Sheffield 's 500th home run was his first career home run with the New York Mets , the first time that a player 's 500th home run was also his first with his franchise .
Twenty-five players are members of the 500 home run club .
Gary Sheffield is the most recent to reach 500 home runs ; he hit his 500th home run on April 17 , 2009 .
In Major League Baseball -LRB- MLB -RRB- , the 500 home run club is a term given to the group of batters who have hit 500 or more regular-season home runs in their careers .
Some believe the milestone has become less important with the large number of new members ; 10 players joined the club from 1999 to 2009 .
Aaron 's ending career total , 755 , stayed the record until Barry Bonds set the current mark of 762 during the 2007 season .
The San Francisco Giants are the only franchise to have four players reach 500 home runs while on their roster : Mel Ott while the team was in New York , Willie Mays , Willie McCovey , and most recently Bonds .
Eligibility requires that a player has `` been retired five seasons '' or be dead for at least six months . .
Of these 25 players , 13 were right-handed batters , 10 were left-handed , and 2 were switch hitters -LRB- meaning they could bat from either side of the plate -RRB- .
Some believe that by not electing McGwire to the Hall , the voters were starting a `` guideline '' on how they would treat players from the `` Steroid Era '' .
Alex Rodriguez , at 32 years and 8 days , was the youngest player to hit 500 . Ted Williams , at 41 years and 291 days , was the oldest .

Ely Cathedral is an Anglican church in Ely , Cambridgeshire .
It was originally a two-storey structure where liturgical processions could gather before entering the nave . It was opened up into a single vaulted space in the 18th century .
The present cathedral was started by Abbot Simeon -LRB- 1082 â `` 1094 -RRB- in 1083 .
A ` Galilee ' porch was added under Bishop Eustace -LRB- 1198 â `` 1215 -RRB- in the Early English Gothic style .
Northwold 's chancel , completed by around 1252 , adopted several of the stylistic elements already used in the Galilee porch .
The Western transepts and tower were completed in an exuberant Romanesque style with a rich decoration of intersecting arches and complex mouldings .
St Etheldreda 's Shrine was destroyed .
The main transepts were built early on , crossing the nave below a central tower , and are the oldest surviving part of the cathedral .

They originate from the protection symbols .
CSS is used to move a small piece of HTML from the content area of a wikipage to somewhere else on that page , usually in the top-right at the same height as the title of the wikipage .
However , due to how the icons are implemented , they have a tendency to break rather easily , for instance when sitenotices are active .
This is a metatemplate used to help build top icons , little -LRB- usually 15x15 pixels -RRB- icons in the top-right area of -LRB- mostly -RRB- userpages and user talk pages .
Because CSS is used , the icons require specific CSS for each individual skin .
Editors have been increasingly using the same trick to add custom icons to their userpages .
Currently only Monobook , Modern and Vector are supported .
The only supported top icons are the three used in article space ; the protection lock , the spoken article speaker icon and the featured article star .
Note that officially , the top icons on userpages are allowed to break at any time .
However , when sitenotices are active , the icons are likely differently aligned and may cross the header line .
However if you use this template , your icons will be automatically fixed permanently once we do find a solution .
Other technical changes that are important to the entire mediawiki software or changes to article space will always be more important than keeping the userspace top icons working .
The top icons are a hack .
ATM there is no way to fix this , and user top icons have a lower priority than the top icons for articles -LRB- which do work in all cases -RRB- .
This template is therefore meant to simplify support , not to guarantee it .
Any top icons that use this template are safe for sitenotices etc. .
Because it is impossible to correct this for each and every userpage every time the top icons are broken -LRB- not to mention a waste of valuable editor time -RRB- , a new template and class -LRB- topicon -RRB- were introduced to make it simpler to support the icons .

It is also responsible for controlling several major points and autonomic functions of the body :
The medulla contains the cardiac , respiratory , vomiting and vasomotor centers and deals with autonomic functions , such as breathing , heart rate and blood pressure .
It is often referred to as simply the medulla .
The medulla oblongata is the lower , or rear , half of the brainstem .

Lady 's slipper orchids , lady slipper orchids or slipper orchids are the orchids in the subfamily Cypripedioidea .
They are special because of the slipper-shaped orchid pouches of the flowers . The pouch traps insects so that they must climb up past the staminode , where they get or give pollen , fertilizing the flower .
Some people think this subfamily should be different from the Orchidacae as a family Cypripediaceae .
The lady 's slipper is also known in the United States of America as the moccasin flower , because it looks like a shoe or moccasin .

The database schema uses logical formulas to create integrity constraints . It is not possible to insert data into the database that violates these integrity constraints .
Using the database schema , it is possible to create a blueprint of the database .

Yuri Gagarin was born in the village of Klushino near Gzhatsk -LRB- now in Smolensk Oblast , Russia -RRB- , on 9 March 1934 .
Gagarin 's planned flight needed good weather and no outboard tanks .
The first two lines of the song are : `` The Motherland hears , the Motherland knows\/Where her son flies in the sky '' .
Yuri was the third of four children , and his elder sister helped raise him while his parents worked .
Gagarin kept physically fit throughout his life , and was a good sportsman .
At the same time , he began to re-join as a fighter pilot .
On 27 March 1968 , while on a routine training flight from Chkalovsky Air Base , he and flight instructor Vladimir Seryogin died in a MiG-15UTI crash near the town of Kirzhach .
However , no such words appear in the direct record of Gagarin 's talk with the Earth during the spaceflight .
While there he met Valentina Goryacheva . Yuri married her in 1957 , after gaining his pilot 's wings in a MiG-15 .
Ground crew also left fuel tanks on the aircraft .
The town next to Gzhatsk was renamed Gagarin in 1968 in his honor .
Gagarin then became deputy training director of the Star City cosmonaut training base .
As the space explorer Valery Bykovsky wrote :
Approving other theorie , his thoughts are that a Sukhoi jet -RRB- was flying below its minimum allowed altitude , and `` without realizing it because of the terrible weather conditions , he passed within 10 or 20 meters of Yuri and Seregin 's plane while breaking the sound barrier . ''
Soviet people tried to keep him away from any flights , being worried of losing their hero in an accident .
Russian documents opened to the public in March 2003 showed that the KGB had changed their own investigation of the accident . In addition to this , one government and two military investigations .
His two elder siblings were sent out to Nazi Germany for slave work in 1943 , and did not return until after the war .
In 1960 , after the search and selection process , Yuri Gagarin was selected with 19 other space explorers for the Soviet space program .
After starting an apprenticeship in a metalworks as a foundryman , Gagarin was selected for further training at a technical high school in Saratov .
Gagarin was backup pilot for Vladimir Komarov in the Soyuz 1 flight .
Because of the lod weather report , the crew thought their altitude to be higher than it actually was , and could not properly react to bring the MiG-15 out of its spin .
His parents , Alexey Ivanovich Gagarin and Anna Timofeyevna Gagarina , worked on a collective farm .

Once the causes of variation have been quantified , effort is spent in eliminating those causes that are both statistically and practically significant -LRB- i.e. a cause that has only a small but statistically significant effect may not be considered cost-effective to fix ; however , a cause that is not statistically significant can never be considered practically significant -RRB- .
Key tools in SPC are control charts , a focus on continuous improvement and designed experiments .
This is a continuous , ongoing activity .
In mass-manufacturing , the quality of the finished article was traditionally achieved through post-manufacturing inspection of the product ; accepting or rejecting each article -LRB- or samples from a production lot -RRB- based on how well it met its design specifications .
Variations in the process , which might affect the quality of the end-product or service can be detected and corrected , thus reducing waste as well as the likelihood that problems will be passed on to the customer .
The second kind of variation is known as special cause variation , or assignable-cause variation , and happens less frequently than the first .
Much of the power of SPC lies in the ability to examine a process , for the sources of variation in that process , by using tools which give weight to objective analysis over subjective opinions and which allow the strength of each source to be determined numerically .
If this change is allowed to continue unchecked , more and more product will be produced that fall outside the tolerances of the manufacturer or consumer , resulting in waste .
Selden describes how to use SPC in the fields of sales , marketing , and customer service , using Deming 's famous Red Bead Experiment as an easy to follow demonstration .
He discovered how the observed variation in manufacturing data did not always behave the same way as data in nature -LRB- for example , Brownian motion of particles -RRB- .
With its emphasis on early detection and prevention of problems , SPC has a distinct advantage over other quality methods , such as inspection , which apply resources to detecting and correcting problems after they have occurred .
Statistical process control was pioneered by Walter A. Shewhart in the early 1920s .
SPC would account for normal weight variation and better indicate when the person is in fact gaining or losing weight .
If the production process , its inputs , or its environment changes -LRB- for example , the machines doing the manufacture begin to wear -RRB- this distribution can change .
In addition to reducing waste , SPC can lead to a reduction in the time required to produce the product or service from end-to-end .
For example , as its cams and pulleys wear out , the cereal filling machine may start putting more cereal into each box than specified .
For example , a breakfast cereal packaging line may be designed to fill each cereal box with 500 grams of product , but some boxes will have slightly more than 500 grams , and some will have slightly less , in accordance with a distribution of net weights .
However , this notion that SPC is a useful tool when applied to non-repetitive , knowledge-intensive processes , such as engineering processes , has encountered much skepticism , and remains controversial today .
Two kinds of variation occur in all manufacturing processes : both these types of process variation cause subsequent variation in the final product .
When a process is stable and does not trigger any of the detection rules for a control chart , a process-capability analysis may also be performed to predict the ability of the current process to produce conforming -LRB- i.e. within specification -RRB- product in the future .
Additional process changes may be required to reduce variation or align the process with the desired target , especially if there is a problem with process capability .
This is partially due to a reduced likelihood that the final product will have to be reworked , but it may also result from using SPC data to identify bottlenecks , wait times , and other sources of delays within the process .
The following description relates to manufacturing rather than to the service industry , although the principles of SPC can be successfully applied to either .
Deming was also instrumental in introducing SPC methods to Japanese industry , after the war had ended .
Statistical Process Control may be broadly broken down into three sets of activities : understanding the process ; understanding the causes of variation ; and elimination of the sources of special cause variation .
While SPC has been applied most frequently to controlling manufacturing lines , it applies equally well to any process which has measurable factors .
Designed experiments are critical to this phase of SPC , as they are the only means of objectively quantifying the relative importance of the many potential causes of variation .
When excessive variation is identified by the control-chart detection rules , or the process capability is found lacking , additional effort is exerted to determine causes of that variance .
W. Edwards Deming later applied SPC methods in the U.S. during World War II , thereby successfully improving quality in the manufacture of munitions and other strategically important products .
While in this case , the waste is in the form of `` free '' product for the consumer , typically waste consists of rework or scrap .
This type of action could be harmful and possibly generate even more variation in body weight .
Control charts are used to identify variation that may be due to special causes , and to free the user from concern over variation due to common causes .
SPC indicates when an action should be taken in a process , but it also indicates when NO action should be taken .
While Dr. Shewhart drew from pure mathematical statistical theories , he understood that data from physical processes seldom produces a `` normal distribution curve '' -LRB- a Gaussian distribution , also commonly referred to as a `` bell curve '' -RRB- .
Statistical process control -LRB- SPC -RRB- is the use of statistical methods in the monitoring and control of a process , by repeatedly sampling measurements , or counts , to predict results .
In contrast , Statistical Process Control uses statistical tools to observe the performance of the production process in order to predict significant deviations that may later result in rejected product .
Dr. Shewhart concluded that while every process displays variation , some processes display controlled variation that is natural to the process -LRB- common causes of variation -RRB- , while others display uncontrolled variation that is not present in the process causal system at all times -LRB- special causes of variation -RRB- .
This idea exists today within the Level 4 and Level 5 practices of the Capability Maturity Model Integration -LRB- CMMI -RRB- .
By observing at the right time what happened in the process that led to a change , the quality engineer or any member of the team responsible for the production line can troubleshoot the root cause of the variation that has crept in to the process and correct the problem .
Common cause variation may include variations in temperature , properties of raw materials , strength of an electrical current etc. .
With sufficient investigation , a specific cause , such as abnormal raw material or incorrect set-up parameters , can be found for special cause variations .
Shewhart created the basis for the control chart and the concept of a state of statistical control by carefully designed experiments .
Under SPC , a process behaves predictably to produce results with the least possible waste .
An example is a person who would like to maintain a constant body weight and takes weight measurements weekly .
Process cycle time reductions , coupled with improvements in yield , have made SPC a valuable tool from both a cost-reduction and a customer-satisfaction standpoint .
A person who does not understand SPC concepts might start dieting every time his or her weight increased , or eat more every time his or her weight decreased .
In understanding a process , the process is typically mapped out and the process is monitored using control charts .
For a description and example of how SPC applies to a service environment , refer to Roberts -LRB- 2005 -RRB- .
In 1989 , the Software Engineering Institute introduced the notion that SPC can be usefully applied to non-manufacturing processes , such as software-engineering processes , in the Capability Maturity Model -LRB- CMM -RRB- .
Generally , this includes development of standard work , error-proofing and training .
The tools used include Ishikawa diagrams , designed experiments and Pareto charts .
The first is known as natural or common cause variation and consists of the variation inherent in the process as it is designed .

The British Rail Class 502 was a type of electric multiple unit originally built by the London Midland and Scottish Railway at their Derby Works workshop .
Introduced in 1940 and withdrawn by 1980 , they spent the whole of their working lives on the electrified railway lines of north Liverpool .

The names of Titania and the other four moons of Uranus then known were suggested by Herschel 's son John Herschel in 1852 at the request of William Lassell , who had found Ariel and Umbriel the year before .
All of the moons of Uranus are named for characters from Shakespeare or Alexander Pope .

Throughout history natron has had many practical uses which are still used in the wide range of modern uses of its constituent mineral components .
Natron can be used to dry and preserve fish and meat .
The English word natron is a French cognate that came from the Spanish natrÃ n through Greek Î 1\/2 Î Ï Ï Ï Î 1\/2 nitron , which came from the Ancient Egyptian word netjeri , meaning natron .
Both the hepta - and the decahydrate effloresce -LRB- lose water -RRB- in dry air and are partially transformed into the monohydrate thermonatrite Na2CO3 Â H2O .
Most human-made sodium carbonate is soda ash , sodium carbonate anhydrate Na2CO3 , which is obtained by calcination -LRB- dry heating at temperatures of 150 to 200 Â C -RRB- of sodium bicarbonate , sodium carbonate monohydrate , or trona .
It crystallizes in the monoclinic-domatic crystal system , typically forming efflorescences and encrustations .
The modern chemical symbol for sodium , Na , is an abbreviation of that element 's New Latin name natrium , which came from natron .
Some of its ancient household roles are also now filled by ordinary baking soda , natron 's other meaningful ingredient .
Most of natron 's uses both in the home and by industry were replaced in time with closely related sodium compounds and minerals .
Natron was also a cleanser for the teeth and an early mouthwash .
The mineral natron is often found in association with other minerals such as gypsum and calcite .
Sodium carbonate decahydrate has a specific gravity of 1.42 to 1.47 and a Mohs hardness of 1 .
Historical natron was harvested as a salt mixture from dry lake beds in Ancient Egypt and has been used for thousands of years as cleaning .
Natron 's detergent properties are now commercially supplied by soda ash , the mixture 's chief compound ingredient , along with other chemicals .
Natron is white or without color when it is pure . It can be gray or yellow with impurities .
Natron is also the mineralogical name for the compound sodium carbonate decahydrate -LRB- Na2CO3 Â 10H2O -RRB- , which is the main component in historical natron .
The mineral was mixed into early antiseptics for wounds and minor cuts .
This releases a mostly clear , colorless salty kind of water with a little solid thermonatrite .
Natron deposits are sometimes found in saline -LRB- salty -RRB- lake beds which arose in arid environments .
In some cultures , natron was thought to keep both the living and the dead lime in ceramic and glass-making by the Romans and others at least until 640 CE .
The mineral was also used as a flux to solder precious metals together .
Soda ash also replaced natron in glass-making .
In modern mineralogy the word natron has come to mean only the sodium carbonate decahydrate -LRB- hydrated soda ash -RRB- which makes up most of the historical salt .
It was also an ancient household insecticide , was used for making leather and as a bleach for clothing .
Sodium carbonate decahydrate stays the same at room temperature , but it changes into the crystal material Na2CO3 Â 7H2O , then above 37 - to sodium carbonate monohydrate , Na2CO3 Â H2O , if the temperature becomes 32 Â .
The mineral was used in Egyptian mummification because it absorbs water and was a drying agent .
It softens water and removes oil and grease at the same time .
The term hydrated sodium carbonate is commonly used to encompass the monohydrate -LRB- Na2CO3 Â H2O -RRB- , the decahydrate and the heptahydrate -LRB- Na2CO3 Â 7H2O -RRB- , but is often used in industry to refer to the decahydrate only .
Natron is a natural mixture of sodium carbonate decahydrate -LRB- Na2CO3 Â 10H2O , a kind of soda ash -RRB- and about 17 % sodium bicarbonate -LRB- also called nahcolite or baking soda , NaHCO3 -RRB- along with small amounts of household salt -LRB- halite , sodium chloride -RRB- and sodium sulfate .
Together with oil , it was an early form of soap .
Also , when exposed to moisture the carbonate in natron increases pH , which makes a good environment for bacteria .

When threatened , Sipunculids can retract their body into a shape resembling a peanut kernel â `` a practice that has given rise to the name `` peanut worm '' .
Sipunculans are worm-like animals ranging from 2 t in length , with most species being under 10 c. The body consists of a narrow front section , called the introvert and a larger trunk section .
Sipunculans have a coelom -LRB- body cavity -RRB- , and a body wall somewhat similar to that of annelids .
The most recognizable part of Sipunculan worms is their mouth , which is surrounded by a mass of 18 â `` 24 ciliated tentacles , all of which may be inverted into the body .
The tentacles are used to gather organic detritus from the water or substrate , and are probably also function as gills .
The Sipuncula -LRB- or Sipunculida , or peanut worms -RRB- are a small phylum of marine worms . The phylum has 144 â `` 320 species -LRB- estimates vary -RRB- of these bilaterally symmetrical , unsegmented worms .
The introvert is retractable into the trunk .

Furthermore , Pericles fostered Athenian democracy to such an extent that critics call him a populist .
Pericles had a big influence on Athenian society . Thucydides , his contemporary historian , described him as `` the first citizen of Athens '' .
He was descended , through his mother , from the Alcmaeonid family .
The period during which he led Athens , roughly from 461 to 429 BC , is sometimes known as the `` Age of Pericles , '' though the period thus denoted can include times as early as the Persian Wars , or as late as the next century .
This project made the city more beautiful . , It also showed its glory , and gave work to the people .
Pericles promoted the arts and literature . This was a chief reason Athens holds the reputation of being the educational and cultural center of the ancient Greek world .
Pericles turned the Delian League into an Athenian empire and led his countrymen during the first two years of the Peloponnesian War .
He started an ambitious project that built most of the surviving structures on the Acropolis -LRB- including the Parthenon -RRB- .

He was awarded the Linnean Society 's prestigious Darwin-Wallace Medal in 1908 .
He was the first to provide an accurate description of the embryonic sac in gymnosperms -LRB- such as conifers -RRB- and angiosperms -LRB- flowering plants -RRB- , along with demonstrating double-fertilization in angiosperms .
After 1881 he was head of the Botanisches Institut at the University of Bonn .

Strasburger was a founder of the famous Lehrbuch der Botanik fÃ 1\/4 r Hochschulen -LRB- Textbook of Botany -RRB- , which first appeared in 1894 .
In 1869 Strasburger was appointed professor of botany at the University of Jena .
At about the same time as Walther Flemming , and Edouard van Beneden , he worked out chromosome movement during mitosis in plant cells .
He came up with one of the modern laws of plant cytology : `` New cell nuclei can only arise from the division of other nuclei '' , and originated the terms cytoplasm and nucleoplasm .
His work on the upward movement of tree sap proved that the process was physical and not physiological .

If there is only one leaf , then the plant is thought single-leafed , vice versa .
The Axillary bud is an embryonic shoot which is between the stem and petiole of a plant .
Axillary buds can be used to tell the different kinds if the plant is single-leafed or multi-leafed .
Simply count the number of leaves after an axillary bud .

Jonathan Dickinson State Park is a Florida State Park and historic site in Martin County , Florida , between Hobe Sound and Tequesta .
The park has many kinds of areas , such as sand pine scrub , pine flatwoods , mangroves , and river swamps .
Most of the camp buildings were torn down , but some of the building foundations remain .
The Loxahatchee River , which was named a National Wild and Scenic River in 1985 -LRB- the first in Florida -RRB- , runs through the park .
It also has the Elsa Kimbell Environmental Education and Research Center , with exhibits about the park 's natural and cultural history .
The camp stopped being used in 1944 , after only two years .
The park operates a 44-passenger boat for tours of Trapper Nelson 's homestead .
The park is named after Jonathan Dickinson , a Quaker merchant who was shipwrecked in 1696 , with his family and others , on the Florida coast near the present-day park .
The camp included over 1,000 buildings , and housed more than 6,000 officers and soldiers .
A man known as Trapper Nelson lived on the banks of the Loxahatchee River after coming to the area in the 1930s , living off the land trapping and selling furs .
The address is 16450 S.E. Federal Highway , Hobe Sound .
The park has such activities as bicycling , boat tours , boating , cabins , canoeing , fishing , hiking , horse trails , kayaking , picnicking areas , swimming , wildlife viewing and full camping facilities .
The United States Army established Camp Murphy , a top-secret radar training school , in the area that is now the park , in 1942 .
The property was given to the State of Florida in 1947 , and opened as a state park in 1950 .

There is a butterfly similar to the Variegated Fritillary . It is the Mexican Fritillary -LRB- Euptoieta hegesia -RRB- .
The chrysalis is shiny white with small black spots . It has a variable amount of brown markings and has orange and gold projections .
Their flight is low and fast , and they are hard to approach . Its genus name was taken from the Greek word euptoietos meaning `` easily scared '' .
This species may be seen flying from April-October in the south . It flies in the north from summer to early fall .
Variegated Fritillaries use passionflowers as a host plant . Because of this , Variegated Fritillaries have taxonomic links to the heliconians .
The underside of the fore wing is orange .
The Variegated Fritillary -LRB- Euptoieta claudia -RRB- is a butterfly in the family Nymphalidae .
The fore wing and hind wing have a row of submarginal black spots and black median lines running across the wings .
The hind wing is mottled with browns and grays . There is a pale postmedian band -LRB- postmedian means just outward of the median -RRB- .
In many individuals , the white is more noticeable than the black .
This butterfly is found in different kinds of habitats . It can by found in clover fields , alfalfa fields , fields , pastures , waste areas , roadsides , and mountain meadows .
The Variegated Fritillary is closely related to butterflies in the genus Speyeria .
The upper side of the wings is orange and black .
Adults overwinter in the south and fly north each spring and summer .
It has 2-3 broods per year .
The caterpillar eats the leaves , flowers , and stems of the food plant .
Females lay their eggs singly on the host plant 's leaves and stems . The eggs are pale green or cream colored .
There is no silvering .
Some of the differences are : Variegated Fritillaries have 2-3 broods per year vs. one per year in Speyeria . They travel more vs. staying in the same place .
The upper side of its hind wing has more orange . The underside of its wings is plainer , with no submarginal spots or median black lines .

Kopan has become famous for teaching Buddhism to visiting Western foreigners .
The monastery was established by the FPMT founders , Lamas Thubten Yeshe and Thubten Zopa Rinpoche , who bought the property from Nepal 's royal astrologer in 1969 .
Its name comes from the name of the hill on which it was built .
The first of what would become annual month-long -LRB- November-December -RRB- meditation courses was held in 1971 .
These courses generally combine traditional Lam Rim teachings with informal discussion , several periods of guided meditation , and a vegetarian diet .
It belongs to the FPMT , an international network of Gelugpa dharma centers , and once served as its headquarters .

Singaporean English mainly comes from British English The forms of English spoken in Singapore range from Standard English to a pidgin called Singlish .
The Singapore government has chosen four official languages : English , Malay , Chinese -LRB- Mandarin -RRB- , and Tamil .
Singapore 's currency is the Singapore dollar . The short name for the Singapore dollar is SGD .
Brunei dollar can be used in Singapore , because they have the same value .
Malay is a national language of Singapore because of the history of the city .
The national anthem `` Majulah Singapura '' is sung in Malay .
Singapore is also known for Singlish , or Singaporean English , which is English mixed with some words from Malay and other local languages .
Most younger Singaporeans do not speak them anymore .
The Singapore government and many Singaporeans are against using Singlish .

Since this value is near the approximate diameter of Ananke itself , it is likely the parent body was not heavily disrupted .
Their semi-major axes -LRB- distances from Jupiter -RRB- range between 19,300,000 and 22,700,000 km , their inclinations between 145.7 Â and 154.8 Â , and their orbital eccentricities between 0.02 and 0.28 .
The Ananke group is a group of retrograde non-spherical moons of Jupiter that follow similar orbits to Ananke and are thought to have a common origin .
The International Astronomical Union -LRB- IAU -RRB- reserves names ending in - e for all retrograde moons , including this group 's members .
The Ananke group is believed to have been formed when an asteroid was captured by Jupiter and broken apart by a collision .
The eatable root of zedoary has a white core and an aroma like the mango ; however , its taste is more similar to ginger , except with a very bitter aftertaste .
Zedoary has been used to treat coronary heart disease , liver cancer , anemia , chronic pelvic inflammation and helps prevent leukopenia due to cancer therapies .
Zedoary is also used in some traditional eastern medicines .
In Indonesia , it is ground to a powder and added to curry pastes , whereas in India , it tends to be used fresh or in pickling .

It runs from 19:00 to about 04:00 each night , in order to share terrestrial digital bandwidth with the CBBC channel .
Nine million people watch BBC Three every week .
As part of the BBC 's discussions with the government in whether the channel could launch originally , a longer news program had been promised to provide a daily section of news and current affairs .
BBC Three is the successor to the similar BBC Choice channel and was launched on 9 February 2003 .
These include John Humphrys , who argued that BBC Three and BBC Four should be shut down in the face of budget cuts to Radio 4 's Today program , which he presents , John Sweeney of Panorama , and Jeremy Paxman are among other journalists have also criticised the channel and its content .
It is presented in a cheeky , relaxed style in keeping with the rest of the channel .
Most recently , it won Broadcast Magazines Digital Channel of the Year Award for Best General Entertainment Channel , and MGEITF Non Terrestrial Channel of the Year .
The channel is aimed at 25-34 year olds , and competes with other digital channels including ITV2 and E4 .
80 % is original , covering all genre : from current affairs , to drama , to comedy to animation .
Its share of the audience during its transmission hours is 2.6 % among 25-34 year olds , and 1.7 % among all individuals .
The channel features hourly news updates called 60 Seconds , which includes the top news , sport and entertainment stories .
It was launched by Stuart Murphy , who previously ran BBC Choice .
The channel has had critical and popular successes , winning more awards in its four year history than its commercial rivals -LRB- Sky One , Living , E4 , ITV2 , Five and Paramount Comedy Channel -RRB- have won in their combined 25-year history .
Despite several official complaints from the BBC , BARB continues to publish figures which the BBC argues are unrepresentative .
The News Show , as it came to be called upon launch was later rebranded The 7 O'Clock News .
In 2008 , BBC Three 's Gavin and Stacey won the BAFTA audience award and the best comedy performance award was awarded to James Corden for his part .
Unlike its commercial rivals , 90 % of BBC Three 's output is from the United Kingdom and other European Union countries .
When the first episode of Torchwood was launched in October 2006 on BBC Three , 2.4 million people watched it . This broke BBC Three 's previous record of 1.8 million , .
In total BBC Three has won 7 BAFTA awards , 5 British Comedy Awards , 15 Royal Television Society Awards and 5 Rose d'Or Awards since the channel was launched in February 2003 .
However , the BBC discontinued the bulletin in 2005 , claiming that in fact , the program 's audiences were minuscule and the output was provided elsewhere on the BBC .
BARB , the official ratings agency , averages out BBC Three 's viewing figures over 24 hours even though the channel only broadcasts in the evening , giving a distorted sense of the channel 's viewership .
The channel has also come in for criticism from several corners , the most prominent of which are some of the BBC 's long-standing presenters .
British Chinese , also Chinese British , Chinese Britons or British-born Chinese -LRB- often informally referred to as BBCs -RRB- are people of Chinese ancestry who were born in the United Kingdom or have moved to the United Kingdom .
It is most often used in arenas for sports that are normally played on grass .
Artificial turf , or synthetic turf , is a man-made -LRB- something made by humans -RRB- surface made from synthetic materials , made to look like natural grass .
However , it is now being used on lawns and in commercial applications as well .

Communication is a fundamental social process , a basic human need and the foundation of all social organization .

`` We reaffirm , as an essential foundation of the Information Society , and as outlined in Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights , that everyone has the right to freedom of opinion and expression ; that this right includes freedom to hold opinions without interference and to seek , receive and impart information and ideas through any media and regardless of frontiers .
The Rupal River is an east-west glacial stream rising from the meltwater of the Rupal Glacier in northern Pakistan .
The stream flows through the Rupal Valley , south of Nanga Parbat , before turning northeast to the village of Tarashing .
The Rupal drains into the Astore River , which eventually reaches the Indus River near Jaglot .
A large area of land or water that contains a geographically distinct assemblage of natural communities that : -LRB- a -RRB- share a large majority of their species and ecological dynamics ; : -LRB- b -RRB- share similar environmental conditions , and ; : -LRB- c -RRB- interact ecologically in ways that are critical for their long-term persistence .
Ecoregions cover relatively large area of land or water , and contain characteristic , geographically distinct natural communities and species .
An ecoregion -LRB- ecological region -RRB- , sometimes called a bioregion , is the next smallest ecologically and geographically defined area beneath `` realm '' or `` ecozone '' .
The Global 200 is the list of ecoregions identified by the World Wide Fund for Nature -LRB- WWF -RRB- as priorities for conservation .
When defined by the World Wide Fund for Nature -LRB- WWF -RRB- , the boundaries of an ecoregion approximate the original extent of the natural communities prior to any major recent disruptions or changes .
The WWF has identified 825 terrestrial ecoregions , and approximately 450 freshwater ecoregions across the Earth .
LINEAR has also found these comets : 11P\/Tempel-Swift-LINEAR , 146P\/Shoemaker-LINEAR , 148P\/Anderson-LINEAR , 156P\/Russell-LINEAR , 158P\/Kowal-LINEAR , 160P\/LINEAR -LRB- LINEAR 43 -RRB- , 165P\/LINEAR -LRB- LINEAR 10 -RRB- , and 176P\/LINEAR .
The LIncoln Near-Earth Asteroid Research -LRB- LINEAR -RRB- project is a project that is used for the finding and tracking of near-Earth asteroids . The project is done together by the United States Air Force , NASA , and MIT 's Lincoln Laboratory .
LINEAR has found 226,193 new objects since it started . Out of those , 2,019 were near-Earth asteroids and 236 were comets .
LINEAR uses robotic telescopes to help them find asteroids .

In 1835 , S.D. Poisson further described it under the name `` La loi des grands nombres '' -LRB- The law of large numbers -RRB- .
Other mathematicians also contributed to make the law better . Some of them were Chebyshev , Markov , Borel , Cantelli and Kolmogorov .
Thereafter , it was known under both names , but the `` Law of large numbers '' is most frequently used .
After these studies there are now two different forms of the law : One is called the `` weak '' law and the other the `` strong '' law .
Despite this , it took him over 20 years to develop a good mathematical proof . Once he had found it , he published the proof in Ars Conjectandi -LRB- The Art of Conjecturing -RRB- in 1713 .
He named this his `` Golden Theorem '' . It became generally known as `` Bernoulli 's Theorem '' -LRB- not to be confused with the Law in Physics with the same name . -RRB-

An air door or air curtain is a machine used for separating two spaces from each other .
The most common setup for air curtains is a downward-facing blower fan placed over an opening .
It also helps keep outside air out , avoiding cold winds by mixing-in warm air from the air curtain .
The fan must be powerful enough to generate a jet of air that can reach the floor .

During the war Buckles served in England and France , driving ambulances and motorcycles for the Army 's 1st Fort Riley Casualty Detachment .
In 1917 , Buckles was sent to Europe on the RMS Carpathia , which had rescued RMS Titanic survivors five years earlier .
He was rescued on February 23 , 1945 .
He was captured by the Japanese in 1942 and spent the next three and a half years in the Los BaÃ os prison camp .
He became malnourished , with a weight below 100 lb , and developed beriberi , yet led his fellow inmates in calisthenics .
In the 1940s Buckles worked for a shipping company in Manila , Philippines .

In the case of humans , long-term partnership is more important than immediate sexual reproduction .
These animals include bonobos , dolphins , and chimpanzees which also have sexual intercourse even when the female is not in estrus , and to engage in sex acts with same-sex partners .
Sometimes sexual intercourse is called coitus or copulation and is more casually known as having sex or sleeping together . In sexual intercourse , the male reproductive organ enters the female reproductive tract .
Sex reinforces intimate social bonds between individuals .
Humans , bonobos and dolphins show cooperative behavior .
There are many other kinds of sex . Two of them are oral sex and anal sex .
The two animals may be of opposite sexes or they may be hermaphroditic , as is the case with snails .
In most instances , humans have sex primarily for pleasure . This behavior in the above mentioned animals is also presumed to be for pleasure , which in turn strengthens social bonds .
In both humans and bonobos , the female has a relatively concealed ovulation . Neither male or female partners commonly know whether she is fertile at any given moment .
In these animals , the use of sex has evolved beyond reproduction and has taken additional social functions .
Sexual intercourse between animals other than humans is often called mating . Most animals only mate when the female is at the point of estrus , which is the most fertile period of time in its reproductive cycle .

The EstÃ dio Aderbal Ramos da Silva , usually called EstÃ dio da Ressacada or just Ressacada , is a football stadium inaugurated on November 15 , 1983 in Carianos neighborhood , FlorianÃ polis , Santa Catarina , with a maximum capacity of approximately 19,000 people .
In 1982 , to replace the old EstÃ dio Adolfo Konder , AvaÃ bought a groundplot close to the city 's airport -LRB- HercÃ lio Luz International Airport -RRB- .
This stadium should not be confused with Blumenau 's stadium , which is also called EstÃ dio Aderbal Ramos da Silva , however it is nicknamed DEBA , and has a maximum capacity of 4,000 people .
The construction works were led by Cairo Bueno , and the stadium was designed by the architect Davi Ferreira Lima .
