The United Nations Children 's Fund or UNICEF is an international organization .
The United Nations established UNICEF on 11 December 1946 . At that time , its name was United Nations International Children 's Emergency Fund .
Thus , UNICEF became its short name . In 1953 , United Nations International Children 's Emergency Fund dropped the word Emergency from its name .

Also , notice setting the background-color as gray\/grey by use of the HTML CSS custom style directive -LRB- style = `` background : # DDDDDD '' -RRB- placed before the `` Notebox : '' text .
That viewpoint can focus the choice of wording , and the amount of complexity , to be used when developing infoboxes .
It is always important to think outside the infobox , as to the effect it has outside the Simple English Wikipedia , in the many other-language Wikipedia articles .
It is very easy to code a small infobox outside , and below , as an extension of a formal template-infobox .
The use of infoboxes in Wikipedia articles has both advantages and disadvantages .
Users should learn how to create infoboxes , on the fly , and learn how to spot\/correct problems in infobox format .
Note that the first line of text must begin with the vertical-bar -LRB- '' '' -RRB- , although it can be indented as a bar further along the line .
Also , if the infobox is of limited scope , there is no need to expand pages by adding a separate infobox page , infobox-talk , and infobox-history pages .
Some infoboxes should be coded inside an article .
Generally , a separate Wikipedia template page is created to store the layout of an infobox .
The phrase `` Thinking outside the infobox '' has many possible meanings , as with the underlying phrase -LRB- `` Thinking outside the box '' -RRB- .
Colors could also be dark tan -LRB- # DD9922 -RRB- .
If a standardized infobox-template does not contain enough data fields , just create a follow-on infobox after the template -LRB- using the coding method as shown above -RRB- .
Notice that the title `` I am ... '' will not be centered , unless the 2 columns are spanned -LRB- by using the column prefix '' colspan = 2 align = center '' enclosed in vertical-bars -RRB- .
Colors could also be tan -LRB- # DDAA22 -RRB- .
However , there are other issues to consider :
Rather than fear the coding of infobox details , more writers should learn how infoboxes are coded , to more easily expand , or correct , the details of various infoboxes .
Colors could also be ochre -LRB- # DDDD11 -RRB- .
The width can be set , width = 200px .
However , do n't overuse infoboxes , when the details are better explained outside the infobox , in the other text on a page .
General reminders :
However , when first creating a new infobox , it might be preferable to keep the infobox as hard-coded within the same article , to allow changing the infobox along with the article text for quick edit-preview .
For any item too wide , or too wordy , to fit in a standard infobox , just place '' -LRB- see notebox below -RRB- '' as the connection to the custom-coded notebox infobox .
Colors could also be brown -LRB- # DD7722 -RRB- .
Also , the structure of an infobox has implications , outside the Simple English Wikipedia , for the other-language Wikipedias .
It is not necessary to code every infobox into a separate template page , outside the article .

Act 188 , which was signed into law on November 12 , 1982 and came into effect on July 1 , 1983 , established the Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education , and converted those state colleges into universities .
The Office of the Chancellor is situated in the capital city of Harrisburg at the Dixon University Center .
PASSHE universities also operate four branch campuses .
Its passage created 12 school districts .
It is the tenth-largest university system in the United States and 43rd largest in the world .
The `` normal '' schools evolved from state normal schools , to state teacher 's colleges , to state colleges .
Afterward , the School Code of 1911 mandated that Pennsylvania purchase all the schools .
The Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education -LRB- PASSHE -RRB- is the second largest provider of higher education in Pennsylvania after the Commonwealth system and a large public university system in the United States .
The Normal School Act of 1857 was passed on the last day of session on 20 May 1857 .

All three parks had the intended effect of spurring residential development near them .
Shawnee Park is a park in Louisville , Kentucky .
The one-way distance between the Belvedere and Shawnee Park is 6.2 miles .
Louisville 's Riverwalk Trail , which passes through Shawnee Park , extends across Louisville 's waterfront , which is an extensive , mostly flat pedestrian pathway .
The Great Lawn , the principal feature of the park , is enclosed by plantings and a circular drive that is lined with trees .
All three were found on the geographic edges of the city , in Shawnee 's case it was the western edge bordering the Ohio River .
Dozens of subdivisions were built near Shawnee Park , and the neighborhood itself came to be called Shawnee .
River Park Drive was laid out in 1899 , but the Broadway entrance remained unfinished until 1914 .
The land at the time was still mostly used for truck farms , but it was clear residential development was imminent even without the park .
The interest was so great that developers found themselves promoting the parks rather than their own developments , as the highest prices would exist for the park perceived to be best .
The only park blacks were allowed access to was nearby Chickasaw Park , which many people entered by traveling through Shawnee .
It was created by Frederick Law Olmsted , who made 18 of the city 's 123 public parks .
The city had to declare the properties to obtain the land for park , and won the case in 1895 .
In 1896 , the city started to create access to the park , another area in which Shawnee was behind the other two parks .
Shawnee was the slowest of the parks to create , as much of the land was already owned by investors who thought they could increase the sale price by holding out .
Although now overshadowed by the Louisville Waterfront Park , Shawnee boasts an expansive Great Lawn which is very useful for formal gatherings .
Shawnee Park was first planned in 1890 to be one of the free flagship parks in Louisville 's new park system .
The Olmsted firm advised the city not to build a golf course at Shawnee Park due to the `` grave danger to visitors in the park and especially the children '' but demand was such that the course was built anyway in 1927 .
Shawnee Park allowed access only to whites from 1924 to 1954 , although park officials and police had a de facto policy of not allowing blacks access to the park for some years prior to that .
Along with the rest of the city 's Olmsted-designed park system , Shawnee Park was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1982 .

The movie is directed by Woody Allen . The film was released in December of 1996 .

It has the symbol Uut . It has the atomic number 113 .
The Roman Senate was the longest-lasting institution in Ancient Rome .
It began in the first years of the city , which was supposedly founded in 753 BC .
The Senate passed decrees called senatus consultum , which were advice from the Senate to a magistrate -LRB- senior official -RRB- .
As the Roman Empire grew , the Senate also supervised the administration of the provinces , which were governed by former consuls and praetors . It decided which magistrate should govern which province .
They usually were obeyed in practice .
It survived the kings , the Roman Republic -LRB- 509 BC -- 27 BC -RRB- , the Roman Empire -LRB- 27 BC -- 395 AD and the fall of the Western Roman Empire -LRB- 395 -- 476 AD -RRB- .
Only the Senate could authorize the disbursal of public funds from the treasury .
The Senate also had an enormous degree of power over the civil government in Rome .
As of 2004 , 1,511 people lived there .

This makes the chest look sunken in . It is also called a `` chest bowl '' and a `` dent '' .
Their melting points are lower , too . They are generally softer than other metals .

In 1969 he moved to the FUB in Speyer , and was the University President from 1971 to 1972 .

He later married Alexandra Freifrau von Berlichingen .
His wife , Christiane Herzog , died on 19 June 2000 .

In cryptography , Twofish is a symmetric key block cipher with a block size of 128 bits and key lengths up to 256 bits .
However , Twofish is not widely used like the Blowfish , which has been available for a longer period of time .
Twofish 's main features are the use of pre-computed key-dependent S-boxes , and a relatively complex key schedule .
Bruce Schneier responds in a 2005 blog entry that this paper does not present a full cryptanalytic attack , but only some hypothesized differential characteristics : `` But even from a theoretical perspective , Twofish is not even remotely broken .
Twofish algorithm is free for anyone to use without any restrictions whatsoever .
The Twofish cipher has not been patented and the software example of its specification has been placed in the public domain .
As of 2008 , the best published cryptanalysis on the Twofish block cipher is a truncated differential cryptanalysis of the full 16-round version .
Twofish uses some elements from other designs ; for example , the pseudo-Hadamard transform -LRB- PHT -RRB- from the SAFER family of ciphers .
One half of an n-bit key is used as the actual encryption key and the other half of the n-bit key is used to modify the encryption algorithm -LRB- key-dependent S-boxes -RRB- .
The paper claims that the probability of truncated differentials attacks is 2-57 .3 per block and that it will take about 251 chosen plaintexts -LRB- 32 PiB worth of data -RRB- to find a good pair of truncated differentials .
There have been no extensions to these results since they were published '' in 2000 .
Twofish uses the same Feistel structure as the DES .
On most software platforms Twofish is slightly slower than Rijndael -LRB- the chosen algorithm for Advanced Encryption Standard -RRB- for 128-bit keys , but somewhat faster for 256-bit keys .
Twofish was designed by Bruce Schneier , John Kelsey , Doug Whiting , David Wagner , Chris Hall , and Niels Ferguson ; the `` extended Twofish team '' who met to made further cryptanalysis of Twofish and other AES competitors included Stefan Lucks , Tadayoshi Kohno , and Mike Stay .

A constituency is all of the constituents of a representative .
The word constituent can also be used to refer to a citizen who lives in the area that is governed , represented , or otherwise served by a politician ; sometimes the word is restricted to citizens who elected the politician .

It became the 32th largest Wikipedia by size .
Rules in Bulgarian Wikipedia are not regarded as flexible in disputes as they are on the English project .
The Bulgarian Wikipedia was created on 6 December 2003 .
In 24 May 2010 , the distinctive Wikipedia globe logo for the Bulgarian Wikipedia was temporarily altered to include the number 100,000 to commemorate the 100,000 article milestone .
As of December 26 , 2007 it is the 30th largest Wikipedia by article count , with over 50,000 articles .
Difficult issues are resolved through the Arbitration Committee , which handles content disputes , blocks users or prohibit certain users from editing articles on certain topics .
On November 24 , 2005 , the Bulgarian language Wikipedia added its 20,000 th article , and was the 21st largest Wikipedia at the time .
Misuse of administrator privileges is typically appealed through the Arbitration Committee ; only this authority and Wikimedia stewards have the power to remove administrator flags .

Sequential hermaphrodites may produce both types of gametes over the course of their lifetime , but at any given point they are either female or male .
In many wrasse the opposite is trueâ '' most fish are female at birth and become male when they reach a certain size .
In some ferns the default sex is hermaphrodite . Ferns which grow in soil which has previously supported hermaphrodites are influenced by hormones remaining to develop as male .
In some turtles , for example , males are produced at lower incubation temperatures than females ; this difference in critical temperatures can be as little as 1-2 Â C.
Because genetic sex determination is controlled by a pair of sex chromosomes -LRB- or by the presence or absence of one of the chromosomes -RRB- , there are usually the same number of male and female offspring .
Usually , sex is determined by an organism 's genes . With genetic sex determination , most alleles or genes that influence sexual development are on the same chromosome .
That chromosome is then called the sex chromosome .
That chromosome is then called the sex chromosome . Because genetic sex determination is controlled by a pair of sex chromosomes -LRB- or by the presence or absence of one of the chromosomes -RRB- , there are usually the same number of male and female offspring .
Some bacteria use conjugation to transfer genetic material between bacteria . This is not the same as sexual reproduction , but it also results in the mixture of genetic traits .
There are other kinds of organisms -LRB- other than animals , plants and fungi -RRB- , the other eukaryotes â `` such as the malaria parasite â `` that also engage in sexual reproduction .
Some fish change sex over the course of their life . This phenomenon is called sequential hermaphroditism .
Sexual reproduction is a process that can only be found in eukaryotes . These cells have a nucleus and mitochondria .
In clownfish , smaller fish are male , and the dominant and largest fish in a group becomes female .
For some species sex is not determined by inheritance , but instead by environmental factors experienced during development or later in life .
Many reptiles have temperature-dependent sex determination : the temperature embryos experience during their development determines the sex of the organism .

Tal won the strong 1958 Interzonal tournament , and the Candidates ' tournament in Yugoslavia , 1959 .
Tal he won all four individual games against Fischer , and took 3 Â 1\/2 points out of 4 from each of GligoriÄ , Olafsson , and Benko .
In 1960 , at the age of 23 , Tal defeated Mikhail Botvinnik in the Moscow World Championship match , by 12.5 â `` 8.5 -LRB- six wins , two losses , and thirteen draws -RRB- . This made him the youngest-ever world champion , a record later broken by Garry Kasparov .
Between 23 October 1973 and 16 October 1974 , he played 95 consecutive games without a loss -LRB- 46 wins and 49 draws -RRB- , shattering his previous record .
Mikhail Tal , known as Mischa , -LRB- Riga , 9 November 1936 â `` Moscow , 28 June 1992 -RRB- was a Sovietâ `` Latvian chess player , a Grandmaster , and the eighth World Chess Champion .
Botvinnik , who had never faced Tal before , won the return match against Tal in 1961 by 13 â `` 8 -LRB- ten wins to five , with six draws -RRB- .
In the Candidates he finished first , with 20\/28 points , ahead of Paul Keres with 18.5 , followed by Tigran Petrosian , Vasily Smyslov , Bobby Fischer , Svetozar GligoriÄ , FriÃ rik Ã `` lafsson , and Pal Benko .
In 1962 at CuraÃ ao , he had serious health problems , having undergone a major operation shortly before the tournament , and had to withdraw three-quarters of the way through , scoring just seven points -LRB- +3 -10 = 8 -RRB- from 21 games .
Tal 's short reign atop the chess world made him one of the two so-called ` winter kings ' who interrupted Botvinnik 's long reign from 1948 to 1963 -LRB- the other was Smyslov , world champion 1957 â `` 1958 -RRB- .
From July 1972 to April 1973 , Tal played 86 consecutive games without a loss -LRB- 47 wins and 39 draws -RRB- .
Tal played in a total of six Candidates ' tournaments and match cycles , though he never again earned the right to play for the world title .
Between the matches Botvinnik thoroughly analyzed Tal 's style , and turned most of the return match 's games into close maneuvers and endgames , rather than the complicated tactical melÃ es which were Tal 's preference .
The Mikhail Tal Memorial tournament is held in Moscow each year since 2006 to honor his memory .
These are the two longest unbeaten streaks in modern chess history .

This scattering is one of the main things that happen when gamma rays meet matter . The Compton effect was studied by Arthur Holly Compton in 1923 .
In physics , Compton scattering , or the Compton effect , is the name used for what happens to the energy -LRB- or frequency or wavelength -RRB- of an X-ray or gamma ray photon when it interacts with matter ; the wavelength increases -LRB- or energy\/frequency decreases -RRB- as it scatters off electrons .

The Secretary of War was a member of the United States President 's Cabinet , beginning with George Washington 's administration .
At first , he was responsible for all military affairs .
In 1798 , the Secretary of the Navy was added to the cabinet , and the scope of this office was reduced to a general concern with the Army .
A similar position , called either `` Secretary at War '' or `` Secretary of War , '' was appointed to serve the Congress of the Confederation under the Articles of Confederation between 1781 and 1789 .
When Washington was inaugurated as the first president under the Constitution , he appointed Knox to continue serving .
In 1947 , the departments were recombined under the Secretary of Defense .
The Secretary of War led the War Department .
The Secretary of War was replaced by the Secretary of the Army and the Secretary of the Air Force , non-Cabinet positions under the Secretary of Defense .
It lies on the river Aude and is about 30 k due south of Carcassonne .
Alfred Waterhouse -LRB- 19 July 1830 â `` 22 August 1905 -RRB- was a British architect , particularly associated with the Victorian Gothic revival .
Though expert within Gothic and Renaissance styles , Waterhouse never limited himself to a single architectural style .
Financially speaking , Waterhouse was probably the most successful of all Victorian architects .
He is perhaps best known for his design for the Natural History Museum in London , although he also built a wide variety of other buildings throughout the country .
He worked there until 1986 and during this time was a regular visitor to the California Institute of Technology , the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee and the University of California , in Berkeley where he worked as a visiting professor .
He was director at the Fritz Haber Institute of the MPG from 1986 and was also a professor at the Humboldt University of Berlin from 1996 .
In 1986 , he became professor at the Free University of Berlin and the Technical University of Berlin .
Professor Ertl studied physics at the Technical University of Stuttgart from 1955 to 1957 . He studied at the University of Paris from 1957 to 1958 and then at Ludwig Maximillians University in Munich from 1958 to 1959 .
One was called low-energy electron diffraction -LRB- LEED -RRB- used at the beginning of his career and later he worked on ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopy -LRB- UPS -RRB- and scanning tunneling microscope -LRB- STM -RRB- .
Ertl and his wife Barbara have two children and several grandchildren .
His hobbies include playing the piano and also playing with his cats .
In 1973 , Professor Ertl returned to the Ludwig Maiximillians University of Munich to work as a professor at the Institute of Physical Chemistry .
After getting his PhD , he stayed in Munich as an assistant and a lecturer between 1965 and 1968 .
Then , he moved to the Technical University of Hannover where he worked as Professor and Director from 1968 to 1973 .

Most other uses such as for table ware , sanitary piping , or building decoration in freezing environments require that the material be glazed .
The term is also used to refer to items made out of this material and to its natural , brownish orange color , which varies considerably .
Other colors include yellow , gray , and pink .
The fired material is weak compared to stoneware .
Some types of terracotta are created from clay that includes recycled terracotta -LRB- `` grog '' -RRB- .
After pit firing the hot ware is covered with sand to cool , and after kiln firing the kiln is slowly cooled .
After thorough drying , it is placed in a kiln , or atop combustible material in a pit , and then fired .
Clay is partially dried and cast , molded , or hand worked into the desired shape .
Terracotta , if uncracked , will ring if lightly struck , but not as brightly as will ware fired at higher temperature , which is called stoneware .
Its uses include vessels , water and waste water pipes and surface embellishment in building construction , along with sculpture such as the Terracotta Army and Greek terracotta figurines .
The unglazed color after firing can vary widely , but most common clays contain enough iron to cause an orange , orangish red , or brownish orange color , with this range including various colors described as `` terracotta '' .
When unglazed , the material will not be waterproof , but it is suitable for in-ground use to carry pressurized water -LRB- an archaic use -RRB- , for garden ware , and sculpture or building decoration in tropical environments , and for oil containers , oil lamps , or ovens .

Reserve Officers ' Training Corps refers to the college-based , officer commissioning program , predominantly in the United States .
It is designed as a college elective that focuses on leadership development , problem solving , strategic planning , and professional ethics .
The Philippines established its program in 1912 , with the creation of the first unit at the University of Santo Tomas during American colonial rule .
The U.S. Armed Forces and a number of other national militaries , particularly those countries with strong historical ties to the United States , have ROTC programs .

Nigel Ernest James Mansell OBE -LRB- born August 8 , 1953 in Upton-upon-Severn , Worcestershire -RRB- is a British racing driver from England who won both the Formula One World Championship -LRB- 1992 -RRB- and CART World Series -LRB- 1993 -RRB- .
Mansell remains the most successful British Formula One driver of all-time in terms of race wins with 31 victories , and is fourth overall on the Formula One race winners list behind Michael Schumacher , Alain Prost , and Ayrton Senna .
Mansell raced in the GP Masters series and signed a one-off race deal for the Scuderia Ecosse GT race team to drive their number 63 Ferrari430 GT2 car at Silverstone on 6 May 2007 .
He is the only person in history to hold both titles simultaneously , and was the first person to win the CART title in his debut season .
He was rated in the top 10 Formula One drivers of all time by Murray Walker , who was a Formula One commentator for 50 years .
His career in Formula One spanned 15 seasons , with his final two full seasons of top-level racing being spent in the CART series .

The Royal Canadian Air Cadets is a program for Canadian youth .
The Motto of the Air Cadets is `` To Learn To Serve To Advance .
The aim of the Air Cadets is to `` develop in youth the attributes of good citizenship and leadership ; promote physical fitness ; and to stimulate the interest of youth in the sea , land and air activities of the Canadian Forces .
The rank system in Air Cadets is founded in that ranking system used by the former Royal Canadian Air Force with some modifications .
1 -RRB- Air Cadet -LRB- AC -RRB- - When people first join Air Cadets , they get the rank of an Air Cadet .
The rank system in Air Cadets is founded in that ranking system used by the former Royal Canadian Air Force with some modifications . Royal Canadian Air Cadets are not part of the Canadian Forces and do not have to join the Canadian forces .
The two other cadet programs for youth in Canada are the Royal Canadian Sea Cadets and the Royal Canadian Army Cadets .

It was discovered on 7 August 1915 by the Soviet astronomer Grigory Nikolaevich Neujmin at Simeis , Ukraine .
916 America is a minor planet that is orbiting the Sun in the main belt between Mars and Jupiter .
Observations by the Infrared Astronomical Satellite have since shown that it has a diameter of 33.2 Â 1.3 km , with an absolute magnitude of 11.20 and an albedo -LRB- the extent to which it reflects light -RRB- of 0.053 Â 0.004 .
In 1986 , believing that the asteroid was of S-type and that it had a diameter of 15 km , the length of 916 America 's day was thought to be 38 hours .
It was originally called 916 Î # I , but was renamed 916 America on 24 February 1923 after the Council of Astronomers at Pulkovo Observatory decided to pay tribute to `` the friendly relations of the astronomical observatories and astronomers '' .
Another possible reason for the name was as a mark of thankfulness for the help given during the famine in Crimea by the American Relief Administration under President Herbert Hoover .
A head coach , senior coach or manager is a person who trains and develops men and women who play sports .
In some sports such as soccer and baseball , the head coach is called a manager . In other sports , such as Australian rules football , they are called a senior coach .
Assistant coaches often work in offensive positions or defensive positions .
They usually hold a more public profile and are paid more than other coaches on the team .

Finches are passerine songbirds in the family Fringillidae .
Many birds in other families are also commonly called `` finches '' They include â cents some species in the very similar-looking waxbills -LRB- family Passeridae , of the Old World tropics and Australia ; â cents several groups of the bunting and American sparrow family -LRB- Emberizidae -RRB- ; â cents Darwin 's ` finches ' of the Galapagos Islands , which provided evidence of natural selection . They are now recognized to be peculiar tanagers -LRB- Thraupidae -RRB- .
Some species are being imported or smuggled into other countries and sold as exotic pets .

The discovery of S. sikkanniensis in British Columbia in the 1990s made S. popularis the smaller of the Shonisaurus species .
Fossils of Shonisaurus were first found in a large deposit in Nevada in 1920 .
The better known S. popularis species was about 15 metres -LRB- 50ft -RRB- long , but a more recently discovered species , S. sikkanniensis , was longer still , at about 21m -LRB- 70ft -RRB- .
All of these features suggest that Shonisaurus may be a relatively specialised offshoot of the main ichthyosaur evolutionary line .
It had a large whale-like body , a long dolphin-like snout , and its flippers were much longer , and narrower than in other ichthyosaurs .
These were named Shonisaurus , -LRB- `` Lizard from the Shoshone Mountains '' -RRB- .

Deinosuchus was probably capable of killing and eating large dinosaurs .
Deinosuchus fossils have been found in ten U.S. states , as well as northern Mexico .

Their leader , Ashot Msaker -LRB- Ashot the Meateater -RRB- -LRB- 806-827 -RRB- was given the title of ishkhan -LRB- prince -RRB- of Armenia by the Caliphate in 804 .
Long ago renowned for its splendor and magnificence , Ani has been abandoned and largely forgotten for centuries .

Arsenic trioxide , also known as white arsenic , arsenic -LRB- III -RRB- oxide , or arsenious oxide , is a chemical compound . Its chemical formula is As2O3 .
About 50,000 tons of arsenic trioxide are made each year . Arsenic trioxide is made by burning arsenic in air , reacting arsenic with concentrated sulfuric acid , or the roasting of arsenic sulfide ores .
Arsenic trioxide is made by burning arsenic in air , reacting arsenic with concentrated sulfuric acid , or the roasting of arsenic sulfide ores .
It reacts with concentrated hydrochloric acid to make arsenic trichloride .
It reacts with very strong oxidizing agents to make arsenic pentoxide .

After his death , Scott became a British hero , a status he kept for more than 50 years .
Scott became a figure of controversy , with questions raised about his competence and character .
His name became associated with the Antarctic , his field of work for the final twelve years of his life .
During this second venture , Scott led a party of five which reached the South Pole on 17 January 1912 , only to find that Roald Amundsen 's Norwegian expedition had got there first .
In a more sceptical age at the end of the 20th century , the legend was reassessed . Attention focused on the causes of the disaster , and whether Scott was responsible .
Scott led two expeditions to the Antarctic regions : the Discovery Expedition , 1901 -- 04 , and the ill-fated Terra Nova Expedition , 1910 -- 13 .
On the return journey , Scott and his four comrades died from exhaustion , starvation and extreme cold .
It was the chance for personal distinction that led Scott to apply for command of the Discovery .
Before his appointment to lead the Discovery Expedition , Scott had followed the conventional career of a naval officer in peacetime Victorian Britain , where opportunities for career advancement were keenly sought after by ambitious officers .

Its density is 1.97 g\/cm3 , much lighter than gray arsenic .
It turns into gray arsenic in light .
Arsenic and its compounds are highly toxic .
It dissolves in concentrated nitric acid to make arsenic acid and in dilute nitric acid to make arsenious acid . It reacts with concentrated sulfuric acid to make arsenic trioxide .
It is the most toxic allotrope .
Arsenic is found in three allotropes . Gray arsenic is the most common .
Other arsenic minerals have a metal and arsenic .
Water near arsenic mines is normally contaminated with arsenic . Wood that was preserved with arsenic compounds can leach arsenic into the soil .

Glow fuel is a term used to tell about fuel used for model airplanes , helicopters , cars and boats .
Methanol is the main ingredient . It provides most of the fuel 's ability to burn .
The oils included in glow fuel are not burned by the engine .
Sometimes , glow fuel is called nitro or just model fuel . Some model fuel has only a little bit of nitro , but some fuel has none at all .
`` FAI '' stands for FÃ dÃ ration AÃ ronautique Internationale .
Nitromethane contains less energy than the same amount of methanol , but it requires less oxygen .
Glow fuel can be burned by very simple two stroke engines or by four stroke engines . Engines like this provide lots of power in a small size .
Nitromethane is hard to get in some countries since it is known as an explosive . In these countries , glow fuel sometimes has no nitromethane at all .
Glow fuel can be burned by very simple two stroke engines or by four stroke engines .
For use in race cars , the nitromethane can be from 30 % to as much as 65 % .
In order to burn the glow fuel , a glow engine must have a glow plug . The glow plug burns very hot as the engine runs because of a catalytic reaction with the methanol .
The oil can be castor oil or synthetic oils . Some fuels include a mixture of the two .
Glow fuel is mostly made of methanol , nitromethane and oil .

is an old Tuscan ball game from Maremma towns between Siena and Grosseto .
The game is played by facing teams who strike , not catch , the ball with either a bare or gloved hand : every team include 3 , 4 or 5 athletes .
Pisa , Prato , Rome , Siena , and various Tuscan towns still have streets named via Pallacorda or via Della Corda .
Adjacent buildings , objects , and sometimes spectators , are considered `` in play . ''

At the death of her twin sister in 1752 , Louise Ã lisabeth returned to France in September to visit her tomb at Saint-Denis .
This alliance was to be cemented by the marriage of her daughter Princess Isabella to Archduke Joseph of Austria .
Louise Ã lisabeth was able to leave Spain in 1748 when her husband was created Duke of Parma thanks to the Treaty of Aix-la-Chapelle -LRB- 1748 -RRB- which ended the War of the Austrian Succession .
She was expected to stay for only a few weeks , but remained in Versailles for almost a year .
She married Infante Philip , younger son of Philip V of Spain , and later became Duchess of Parma .
Louise Ã lisabeth was bored when she returned to Parma , and sought a wider realm to rule .
Their tombs were destroyed during the French Revolution .

She was buried on 27 March 1760 at Saint-Denis Basilica beside her sister , Henriette .

Note that MediaWiki only parses the code when the category page is re-rendered .
When this template is placed on a category page it can count the number of items in the category -LRB- pages + images + subcategories -RRB- .
Then it can be set to automatically only report when the number of items is above some limit .
This template puts the pages into : Category : Wikipedia backlog , where any editor can see where work needs to be done .
Thus we often do n't want to know about a backlog until it has reached some size .
Usually this template is used without any parameters , then it is always visible until it is manually removed .
Often it is more efficient to handle several cases in a backlog at a time , since then we are up to speed with what needs to be done .
-LRB- We fed 0 here to make it show in this documentation , but in real usage it would show the value 10 . -RRB-
That is , when someone views the page and it is more than one week since it was last re-rendered .
This template automatically shows the appropriate style depending on what kind of page it is shown on .
It can be put at the top of pages and categories that have a backlog which require attention .
The style above is for `` other '' pages such as `` Wikipedia : '' pages , and the style shown in the examples below is for category pages .
The autoreport limit can be set to whatever value you prefer .
A backlog is a list of things that need to be done and that have not been done for some time .
This is the message box .
To get an immediate change you can purge the page , for instance by clicking the button in the template .
Thus it can take a week before this template changes when the number of items have changed .
-LRB- But if no one visits the page then it can take forever . -RRB-

In its pure form , dextromethorphan is a white powder .
Dextromethorphan can also be used for pain relief or for psychological conditions .

Reformism is the belief that gradual democratic changes in a society would mean that a society 's fundamental economic relations and political structures would change .
This belief grew out of opposition to revolutionary socialism , which challenges that revolutions are necessary to fundamentally change a society .

Oscar Wilde -LRB- Oscar Fingal O'Flahertie Wills Wilde , 16 October 1854 â `` 30 November 1900 -RRB- was an Irish writer , poet and playwright .
On the 18 February 1895 , the Marquess left his calling card at Wilde 's club , the Albemarle , inscribed : `` For Oscar Wilde , posing as a sodomite '' .
At the final trial , Wilde and Alfred Taylor were convicted of gross indecency and sentenced to two years ' hard labor .
Edward Carson approached Frank Lockwood -LRB- QC -RRB- and asked `` Can we not let up on the fellow now ?
May I say nothing , my Lord ? ''
It is intellectual , and it repeatedly exists between an older and a younger man , when the older man has intellect , and the younger man has all the joy , hope and glamour of life before him .
In his opening speech for the defense , Counsel for Queensbury , Edward Carson , announced that he had found several male prostitutes who were to testify that they had sex with Wilde .
Wilde was freed from Holloway and , shunning attention , went into hiding at the house of Ernest and Ada Leverson , two of his firm friends .
He had already begged Douglas to leave London for Paris , and Douglas fled to the Hotel du Monde .

Wilde , egged on by Douglas and against the advice of his friends , initiated a private prosecution against Queensberry , and had him arrested on a charge of criminal libel . Inception is a 2010 American science fiction action film written , produced , and directed by Christopher Nolan .
At first the story was written as a heist film , based on ideas of lucid dreaming and dream incubation .
Filming spanned six countries and four continents , beginning in Tokyo on June 19 , 2009 and finishing in Canada in late November of the same year .
Cobb has two children but can not visit them . He is offered a chance to go back to his children in exchange for one last job : performing inception , which is planting a new idea , into the mind of his client 's main business competitor .
Inception was first screened in London on July 8 , 2010 and was shown in standard and IMAX theaters on July 14 , 2010 .
In 2001 , Nolan wrote an 80-page treatment about dream-stealers , presenting the idea to Warner Bros. .
The film stars Leonardo DiCaprio , Ken Watanabe , Joseph Gordon-Levitt , Marion Cotillard , Ellen Page , Tom Hardy , Cillian Murphy , Tom Berenger , and Michael Caine .
Nolan 's success with The Dark Knight helped gain the film $ 100 million to spend on advertising .
The film had a lot of positive reviews and earned over $ 21 million on its opening day , and $ 62.7 million in the first weekend .
DiCaprio plays Dom Cobb , a thief who collects information from the subconscious mind of his victims while they dream .
The idea behind Inception was first developed over nine years before it was released .
Because Nolan wanted to have more experience working with big-scale films , he chose to work on Batman Begins , The Prestige and The Dark Knight .
He spent six months polishing up the script for Inception before Warner Bros. purchased it in February 2009 .

The 2009 Philippine region typhoon season was the period that tropical cyclones formed in the Western Pacific Ocean .
These names , however , are not in common use outside of the Philippines .
During the season , 39 Tropical depressions developed within the Western Pacific , whilst 2 formed outside the region before moving into the Western Pacific .
The season ran throughout the year during 2009 , with most tropical cyclones forming between May and November . The Philippine Atmospheric , Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration -LRB- PAGASA -RRB- assigns names to tropical cyclones -LRB- including tropical depressions -RRB- that enter or form in the Philippine area of responsibility .

Christopher Flavin is the President of the Worldwatch Institute , an independent research organization focused on natural resource and environmental issues , based in Washington , DC .
His research and writing focus is international energy and climate policy .
He has testified before national and state legislatures and meets frequently with government and international leaders .
He is also a founding member of the Board of Directors of the Business Council for Sustainable Energy -RRB- and is a member of the National Academy of Sciences Board on Energy and Environmental Systems , the Climate Institute , and the Environmental and Energy Study Institute .
Flavin has participated in several notable international conferences , including the Earth Summit in Rio de Janeiro in 1992 and the Climate Change Conference in Kyoto , Japan , in 1997 .
Flavin is a native of Monterey , California and a cum laude graduate of Williams College , where he studied economics , biology , and environmental studies .

The Scottish Premier League -LRB- currently known as the Clydesdale Bank Premier League or SPL -RRB- is a professional competition for football clubs .
If two or more teams are equal on points , then the difference between of goals scored and goals against is considered .
There are no salary caps or age restrictions . There are no restrictions on the size of the playing squad or restrictions on the number of players from other countries .

Presidents serve two-and-a-half-year terms . This time is normally divided between the two major political parties of the European Parliament .
The current President is Jerzy Buzek .
Two Presidents have been women and most have come from the older member states .
He or she also represents the Parliament within the EU and internationally .
The President of the European Parliament is the head of the European Parliament .
The President has to sign that EU laws and the EU budget can become valid .
There have been twenty-eight Presidents , since the Parliament was created in 1952 . Thirteen of whom have served since the first Parliamentary election in 1979 .
The diameter of Sycorax is estimated at 150 km -LRB- assuming albedo of 0.04 -RRB- making it the biggest non-spherical moon of Uranus , comparable in size with Himalia , the biggest non-spherical moon of Jupiter .
The orbital parameters suggest that it may belong , together with Setebos and Prospero , to the same dynamic cluster , suggesting common origin .
Sycorax is the biggest retrograde non-spherical moon of Uranus .
Sycorax follows a far orbit , more than 20 times farther from Uranus than the farthest regular moon Oberon .
Officially confirmed as Uranus XVII , it was named after Sycorax , Caliban 's mother in William Shakespeare 's play The Tempest .
The diagram illustrates the orbital parameters of the retrograde non-spherical moons of Uranus -LRB- in polar co-ordinates -RRB- with the eccentricity of the orbits represented by the segments extending from the pericentre to the apocentre .
Sycorax was found on 1997-09-06 by Brett J. Gladman , Philip D. Nicholson , Joseph A. Burns , and John J. Kavelaars using the 200-inch Hale telescope , together with Caliban and given the designation S\/1997 U 2 .
Its orbit is retrograde , moderately inclined and eccentric .

Greek numerals are a system of representing numbers using letters of the Greek alphabet .
At first , before it was used more , the Greek alphabet , Linear A and Linear B had used a different system with symbols for 1 , 10 , 100 , 1000 and 10000 operating with the following formula : = 1 , â `` = 10 , â -- = 100 , Â = 1000 , â 1\/4 = 10000 .
For example , 241 is represented as Ï Î 1\/4 Î Ê -LRB- 200 + 40 + 1 -RRB- .
A `` left keraia '' -LRB- Unicode U +0375 , â Greek Lower Numeral Signâ -RRB- is put in front of thousands to distinguish them from the standard use .
In modern Greek , uppercase letters are used more , as in Î Î Î '' Î Ï Ï Î Ï Î ' Ê = Philip II .
Each unit -LRB- 1 , 2 , â , 9 -RRB- was assigned a separate letter , each tens -LRB- 10 , 20 , â , 90 -RRB- a separate letter , and each hundreds -LRB- 100 , 200 , â , 900 -RRB- a separate letter .
They are also known by the names Milesian numerals , Alexandrian numerals , or alphabetic numerals .
In modern Greece , they are still in use for ordinal numbers , and in much of the same way that Roman numerals are in the West ; for ordinary -LRB- cardinal -RRB- numbers , Arabic numerals are used .
For example , 2008 is represented as Í Î Î Ê -LRB- 2000 + 8 -RRB- .
To represent numbers from 1,000 to 999,999 the same letters are reused to serve as thousands , tens of thousands , and hundreds of thousands .
The Greeks also used the myriad to denote 10,000 -LRB- Î Ê -RRB- and the myriad myriad for one hundred million -LRB- Î Î Ê -RRB- .
This alphabetic system operates on the additive principle in which the numeric values of the letters are added together to form the total .
To distinguish numerals from letters they are followed by the `` keraia '' -LRB- Greek Î Î Ï Î Î Î â '' insect antenna -RRB- , a symbol similar to an acute sign -LRB- Unicode U +0374 -RRB- .
This requires 27 letters , so the 24-letter Greek alphabet was extended by using three obsolete letters : fau Ï , -LRB- also used are stigma Ï or , in modern Greek , Ï Ï -RRB- for 6 , qoppa Ï for 90 , and sampi Ï for 900 . .
The earliest alphabet-related system of numerals used with the Greek letters was a set of the acrophonic Attic numerals , operating much like Roman numerals -LRB- which derived from this scheme -RRB- , with the following formula : Î = 1 , Î = 5 , Î '' = 10 , Î Î '' = 50 , Î -- = 100 , Î Î -- = 500 , Î = 1000 , Î Î = 5000 , Î = 10000 and Î Î = 50000 .
Other AOL products are AOL Spyware Protection , AOL Safety and Security Center , ICQ , AOl Computer Check-Up , AOL Explorer , AOL TopSpeed , AOL Dialer , AOL One-Click Fixes and AOL Openride .
The bond market -LRB- also known as the debt , credit , or fixed income market -RRB- is a financial market where people buy and sell debt securities , usually in the form of bonds .
In 2006 the size of the international bond market was about $ 45 trillion . The size of the outstanding U.S. bond market debt was $ 25.2 trillion .

In microarchitecture micro-operations -LRB- sometimes termed : micro-instructions , also known as micro-ops or Î 1\/4 ops -RRB- , are detailed low-level instructions used in some designs to implement complex machine instructions in which each instruction is composed of a set of low-level micro-ops .

Jhangochi -LRB- Ø Ú 3\/4 Ù Ú Ù Ú Û -RRB- is the oldest and most conservative dialect of the Punjabi -LRB- Lahndi or western Punjabi or seraeki -RRB- language .
It is spoken in the Bar areas of Punjab , i.e. areas whose names are often suffixed with ` Bar ' , for example Sandal Bar , Kirana Bar , Neeli Bar and Ganji Bar .
This area has a great culture and heritage , especially literary heritage , as it is credited with the creation of the famous epic romance stories of Heer Ranjha and Mirza Sahiba .
The Jhangochi dialect of Punjabi has several aspects that set it apart from other Punjabi variants .

The ' or German Workers ' Party -LRB- DAP -RRB- , was a political party in Germany just after World War I. It did not last for very long , and became the Nazi Party -LRB- , acronym NSDAP -RRB- .
To try to make the party more popular the DAP changed its name on 24 February 1920 to the National Socialist German Workers ' Party .
Hitler got number 555 , but he was also committee member number 7 . Later Hitler said he was party member number 7 , to make it look like he was a founder member of the DAP -RRB- .
The name was borrowed from a different Austrian party active at the time -LRB- Deutsche Nationalsozialistische Arbeiterpartei -RRB- . At first Hitler wanted the new name to be the `` Social Revolutionary Party '' ; but Rudolf Jung persuaded Hitler to use NSDAP .
Hitler was the 55th member of the party .

Socrates is usually the main person in Plato 's dialogues .
In the list on this page , a work is marked -LRB- 1 -RRB- if scholars are not sure that Plato really wrote it , and it is marked -LRB- 2 -RRB- if scholars generally agree that Plato did not really write it .
Other people in the stories often become angry with Socrates because of this ! People who study Plato argue about whether Socrates really said the same things that Plato makes him say , or whether Plato just used Socrates as a character , to make the ideas he was talking about seem more important .

It attempts a ISO 3166-2 region code for locations in Canada , France , Germany , India , and the United States .
Locations in Canada , India , and the United States generate invalid region codes -LRB- CA-X , IN-X , and US-X -RRB- if the second argument is omitted , blank , or invalid .
It attempts a ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for all other locations .
The first -LRB- required -RRB- argument specifies the name of the country , such as `` United States '' or `` Chile '' .
In some cases , however , it invokes a helper template :
can handle many inputs simply and directly .
So far , however , the template has failed to keep up with the ingenuity of infobox creators .
The second -LRB- optional -RRB- argument is the name of a state or province within the specified country , such as `` Alaska '' .
The template attempts to generate the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 or ISO 3166-2 code for a named country or geographic region , for use in the parameter of .
Interestingly , centrosomes are not required for the progression of mitosis .
Many cells can completely undergo interphase without centrosomes .
In the absence of the centrosome , the microtubules of the spindle are focused by motors allowing the formation of a bipolar spindle .
The centrosome replicates during the interphase of the cell cycle .
Fungi and plants use other structures to organize their microtubules .
The centrosome has apparently only evolved in metazoan eukaryotic cells .
The centrosome is copied only once per cell cycle so that each daughter cell inherits one centrosome , containing two centrioles .
When the centrosomes are irradiated by a laser , mitosis proceeds with a normal spindle .
The mitotic spindle then forms between the two centrosomes .
Upon division , each daughter cell receives one centrosome .
The centrosome was discovered by Edouard Van Beneden in 1883 , and was described and named in 1888 by Theodor Boveri .
During the prophase of mitosis , the centrosomes migrate to opposite poles of the cell .
Although the centrosome has a key role in efficient mitosis in animal cells , it is not necessary .

A typical woman 's orgasm lasts much longer than that of a man .
Most women find these contractions very pleasurable .
Orgasm occurs as a result of continued sexual stimulation .
When a woman experiences full orgasm , her uterus , vagina , anus , and pelvic muscles undergo a series of rhythmic contractions .

In later years Balukas explained that she `` almost never went to the pool hall and if I did go , I did n't play .
At age 62 , Mosconi was well past his best playing years .
Announcers had stopped calling Balukas `` the Little Princess , '' but introduced her to audiences as `` the Queen '' .
A vote on whether she could play went 8 -- 7 for her . However , after they asked a player who was not there at the time of the first vote , Balukas again left the women 's division of the competition .
From that early start , Balukas dominated women 's professional pool during the 1970s and 1980s .
In 1966 , McGown held a billiards exhibition at New York City 's Grand Central Terminal .
On August 6 , 1978 Balukas became the first woman to qualify to play in the men 's side of the World Open Pocket Billiards Championship . This was a tournament with a 100-year history .
Well , see you later .
In 1999 , Balukas was ranked number fifteen on Billiard Digest 's Fifty Greatest Players of the Century .
I felt it should have been done by an outside panel , not by my competitors '' .
It just got to a point where I had so much animosity toward the pool world .
In summing up these events in a 1992 article , The New York Times stated , `` So America 's greatest woman pool player competes only for the odd soda .
However , after she traveled to the tournament she learned she had been tricked : `` I found out that the first - and second-place winners in the womenâ s event were going to be invited to play in the menâ s event .
Balukas finished the tournament by tying for 9th place among many of the best male players in the world .
In her first appearance in 1976 , while a junior in high school , Balukas placed second with 192 points . She won titles in tennis and bowling .
Not long afterward , she told a reporter that she was `` thinking of dropping out of women 's competition altogether . ''
A reporter described her at the match as `` a little girl with honey-blond hair ... wearing a short yellow dress and green leotards ... who resembles a young Shirley Temple . ''
On August 18 , 1972 , when she was thirteen years old , Balukas won the women 's side of the U.S. Open Straight Pool Championship . For the win she beat five time champion Dorothy Wise .
Another professional named Loree Jon Jones was also interviewed . Her feelings were more mixed : `` Her not playing is , I guess , sad '' , but she also said that without Balukas playing , `` we 've all learned how to win . ''
In 1969 , Balukas was nine years old . She competed in her first Billiard Congress of America U.S. Open Straight Pool Championship .
She was a defending champion and , in fact , has lost only two games to women in the past eight years '' .
I taught myself to play pool . ''
It was made just for her in 1965 by the very famous cue stick maker , George Balabushka . When she was five and six years old she would practice a game called straight pool to 50 points after family dinners .
The women held a vote on whether Balukas should be allowed to play .
Balukas says no : `` when they find out that my father does n't play , many people think I must have learned the game from Frank McGown .
Despite Bell and Balukas 's friendship , after the match Bell made a formal complaint to the WPBA about the incident .
In 1975 she averaged 4.05 , while no other player averaged even 3 .
Later that year , Balukas and her younger sister Laura , appeared on very popular CBS television show called I 've Got a Secret .
She had a streak of 16 first place finishes in women 's professional tournaments . Balukas was also the only woman to compete equally with men in professional play in her era .
Balukas was the U.S Open 's youngest winner ever and by a large amount of years .
Balukas was not only talented at pool but also good at other sports .
After she reached the very top of her profession , `` That 's when I started getting nervous ... thatâ s when I started putting a lot of pressure on myself '' .
I felt uncomfortable , and besides , girls did n't go in those days . ''
She recalls , ` Whenever my brother Paul , the youngest of my four brothers , beat me at pool on the table downstairs at home , he would run through the house shouting ' I won , I beat her ' .
She quit the sport during a time of controversy in 1988 while at the very height of her ability . This was because of a dispute that happened in a match at the World Open Nine-ball Championship of that year .
Jean Balukas 's father , Albert Balukas , and business partner , Frank McGown , owned a forty-eight-table pool hall . McGown was a professional pool player .
In the 1974 U.S. Open held at the Sheraton Hotel in Chicago , Balukas defended her title , again beating out Harada , but by a much closer score : 100-99 .
Balukas heard many complaints from the men upon her entry to a Chicago tournament in 1988 . They said it was n't fair that she got to play on both the men 's and women 's side , when the men could only play on their own side .
Balukas later said that her break with the sport '' ... was a buildup of everything , ... A little burnout , a little frustration .
This meant that Balukas would be competing in both the women 's and men 's sides of the tournament . The tournament was to be held on August 12 of that year at the Biltmore Hotel located at 43rd Street and Madison Avenue Madison Avenue in New York City .
In the next two U.S. Opens , in 1970 and 1971 , she placed 4th and 3rd .
Top athletes from one sport competed in a different sport that was not the one for which they were famous . The cash prizes were $ 69,000 in total .
Balukas refused to pay and the WPBA refused to lift the fine . They would not allow Balukas to play again until she paid .
That is n't true .
She took over management of her family 's pool hall , Hall of Fame Billiards on Ovington Avenue in Brooklyn . She says `` I 'm enjoying my life immensely ... I have moved on '' .
By the late 1960s , Balukas was playing in exhibition matches with top male players of the era . For example , she played with Willie Mosconi and Irving Crane who were together considered between 1941 and 1956 the `` best in the world , flat out '' .
According to an interview with Balukas by New York Woman magazine in 1991 , Balukas 's exact words were `` Some world championship ... beat me with skill , not luck '' .
Balukas would win the next two U.S. Open straight pool championships for a total of seven wins in a row . Her streak of wins ended after 1978 because the U.S. Open itself was canceled , not because she was beaten .
Balukas was entered in both the men 's and women 's divisions of the 1987 B.C. Classic , a nine-ball competition .
In 1973 , at fourteen , Balukas successfully defended her straight pool U.S. Open title . She beat runner-up Donna Ries , a psychologist from Kansas City , Missouri , with a final score of 75 â `` 72 in 42 innings .
She had appeared on other television programs with a number of billiard stars and other celebrities . These include Willie Mosconi , Sammy Davis , Jr. , Peter Falk , Hugh Downs , and Sonny Fox .

A number of museums cooperated in excavations at the Cleveland Lloyd Dinosaur Quarry . By 1976 , museums in eight countries on three continents had Cleveland-Lloyd allosaur material or casts .
The authors suggested that Allosaurus used its skull like a hatchet against prey , attacking open-mouthed , slashing flesh with its teeth , and tearing it away without splintering bones .
Allosaurus appeared in the second episode of the 1999 BBC television series Walking with Dinosaurs and the follow-up special The Ballad of Big Al , which speculated on the life of the ` Big Al ' specimen , as revealed by the numerous injuries and pathologies in its skeleton .
Allosaurus was at the top of the food chain . It probably preyed on large herbivorous dinosaurs and perhaps even other predators -LRB- e.g. Ceratosaurus -RRB- .
Potential prey included ornithopods , stegosaurs , and sauropods .
Another study showed the skull was very strong but had a relatively small bite force .
Allosaurus , like Tyrannosaurus , has come to represent the quintessential large , carnivorous dinosaur in popular culture .
Finally , the top speed of Allosaurus has been estimated at 30 to 55 kilometers per hour -LRB- 19 to 34 miles per hour -RRB- .
An Allosaurus tail vertebra has been found with a partially healed puncture which fits a Stegosaurus tail spike . Also , there is a Stegosaurus neck plate with a U-shaped wound that correlates well with an Allosaurus snout .
Allosaurus was used as the starring dinosaur of the 1956 film The Beast of Hollow Mountain , and the 1969 film The Valley of Gwangi .
Gwangi is billed as an Allosaurus , though Ray Harryhausen based his model for the creature on Charles R. Knight 's depiction of a Tyrannosaurus .
Allosaurus is the official ` state fossil ' of Utah .

In the United States the standard lengths of lumber are 6 , 8 , 10 , 12 , 14 , 16 , 18 , 20 , 22 , and 24 feet .
It is available in many species , usually hardwoods .
Boards are usually supplied in random widths and lengths of a specified thickness , and sold by the board-foot -LRB- 144 cubic inches -RRB- .
Lumber is supplied either rough or finished .
It is thus possible to find 2 Ã -- 4s that are four , eight , or twelve feet in length .
The length of a board is usually specified separately from the width and depth .
Examples of common sizes are 2 Ã -- 4 -LRB- also two-by-four and other variants -RRB- , 2 Ã -- 6 , and 4 Ã -- 4 .
In the U.K. and Australia , `` timber '' is a term also used for sawn wood products -LRB- that is , boards -RRB- , whereas generally in the United States and Canada , the product of timber cut into boards is referred to as lumber .
In North America sizes for dimensional lumber made from hardwoods varies from the sizes for softwoods .
Lumber or Timber is a term used to describe wood from the time trees are cut down , to its end product as a material suitable for industrial use -- as structural material for construction or wood pulp for paper production .
Engineered lumber is lumber created by a manufacturer and designed for a certain structural purpose .

Paul Steinitz -LRB- born Chichester , 25 August 1909 ; died Old Oxted , Surrey , 21 April 1988 -RRB- was an English conductor and organist .
Paul Steinitz was born in Chichester , West Sussex , in the south of England in 1909 . His father was an Anglican clergyman .
Every Lent they performed one of the two great Bach passions : the St Matthew Passion , or sometimes the St John Passion .
In the 1930s he was Director of Music at the church of St. Mary 's Ashford , Kent . There he became very interested in the music of Bach while studying for his Doctorate
Paul Steinitz had many honors . He was a Fellow of the Royal Academy of Music and Royal College of Organists .
In 1952 he conducted the first performance in Britain of Bachâ s St Matthew Passion in its complete and original German form .
He got together a group of players which he called the Steinitz Bach Players .
Dr. Steinitz died in April 1988 at home in his lovely 18th century cottage in Old Oxted , just south of London . He was a Quaker who believed strongly that music could help to bring peace in the world .
He was a very good organist and got his FRCO diploma in 1930 .
Today Steinitzâ wife Margaret continues her husband 's work with the London Bach Society , of which Steinitz Bach Players is an integral part .
ParquÃ s is played with two dice ; two to eight players can compete in the same match , depending on what type of game board is used .
If a player does not roll any pairs during his turn , he passes the dice to the player on his right .
Each player can throw the dice once .
The board itself is usually placed on a box covered by glass .
The objective of the game is to advance all the pieces to the end .
When the pieces are freed , they are placed in a special box next to the jail .
He throws again and must move the values of the dice with his pieces .
The player can capture an opponentâ s piece by placing his own piece on the same box as the other playerâ s piece .
Capturing in Colombia is called â eatingâ -LRB- â comerâ in Spanish -RRB- .
The player throws the dice three times and attempts to get a pair in order to `` free '' the pieces .
ParquÃ s is the Colombian version of Pachisi , which originated in India .
The pieces can not advance backwards and they can not be in any of the four boxes before their `` Home '' box .
There are boards for 4 , 6 and 8 players .
There are some exceptions to this rule :
There is no proof to the claim that it stems from a country other than India .
Otherwise , he frees the pieces and wins an extra turn to move them .
ParquÃ s is the Colombian board game . The game is similar to those in the Cross and Circle family -LRB- the category that includes Pachisi -RRB- .
The boards usually contain pictures of soccer teams , singers , actors , or other cultural figures on the jail boxes .
There are versions of the board that are made from paper to make it portable .
Moreover , no ParquÃ s game is played in any other Latin American countries , neither the world .
In Colombia , people from all parts of the country play the game ; it is very popular , played by both children and adults .
ParquÃ s stems directly from Pachisi in the same way as Parcheesi , ParchÃ s or Ludo .
The player can avoid capturing the piece .
However , the player can capture pieces on his HOME box .
The jail box is where the pieces are placed at the beginning of the match and is where they go whenever an opponent `` captures '' them .
There are three types of special boxes .
Although it could be argued that the game comes from Spain -LRB- exactly as a derivation from ParchÃ s -RRB- due to the similarity between both games , there is wide agreement in Colombia that the game is completely Colombian .
If nobody notices , nothing happens .
Rolling different pairs or `` doubles '' allows more pieces to be `` freed '' :
Each player is given four pieces and uses a specific color .
However , he can not capture a piece that is on a SAFE or a HOME box .
On that case , an opponent has to accuse him and the piece that did not capture must go to jail .
The game is described as a `` random thinking '' one : the moves depend on the roll of the dice but players must consider possible strategies before executing their move .
When he frees any piece from jail , the pieces placed on his HOME are captured , that is , sent to its jail , losing all their advances .
This box is called `` Home '' , or `` Salida '' -LRB- literally , `` exit '' in Spanish -RRB- .
The most common colors are red , blue , yellow and green , usually arranged in that order .
Adults usually play the game by betting money on the first piece , on capturing pieces , or on winning the game , to make gameplay more interesting .
ParquÃ s is a mixture of the original Indian game and the influences of local Colombian culture .
The use of glass is to allow dice to be thrown more easily .
The game can also be played with fewer than four pieces

Plutonic or intrusive rocks are made when magma cools and crystallizes slowly within the Earth 's crust -LRB- example granite -RRB- . Volcanic or extrusive rocks result from magma reaching the surface either as lava or ejecta -LRB- examples pumice and basalt -RRB- .
Igneous rocks are formed when molten magma cools . They are divided into two main categories : plutonic rock and volcanic rock .
Rocks have had an impact on human life .
Rocks may be igneous , sedimentary and metamorphic .
The mining of rocks for their metal has been one of the most important things in human advancement .

When the storm became a tropical cyclone , it was also the first Atlantic tropical storm in the month of April .

Ana was the second subtropical cyclone on record in the Atlantic basin in the month of April . When the storm became a tropical cyclone , it was also the first Atlantic tropical storm in the month of April .
It quickly lost strength because of wind shear and a close cold front . On April 24 , Ana became an extratropical cyclone .
It is estimated that Ana became a tropical storm by 0000 UTC on April 21 .
Before Ana was formed , the government of Bermuda declared a gale warning for the island .
The remnants of Ana dropped 0.87 inches -LRB- 22 mm -RRB- of rainfall in the city of Ponta Delgada in the Azores .
The storm moved close to Bermuda and dropped 2.63 inches -LRB- 67 mm -RRB- of rainfall the Bermuda International Airport .
When it became a tropical cyclone , Ana reached its highest winds of 60 mph -LRB- 95 km\/h -RRB- .
On April 21 , the subtropical cyclone became a tropical cyclone .

Ana was the second subtropical cyclone on record in the Atlantic basin in the month of April .
Ana continued to move eastward , and early on April 22 , the wind shear again removed the thunderstorms from the center of the storm .

Others are not radioactive . These are called stable isotopes .
Also , some isotopes are radioactive .
As there are more protons , more neutrons are needed to have a stable nucleus .
These are called stable isotopes .
Neutrons are electrically neutral , and they attract the protons more than the protons push against other protons .
Heavier isotopes react slower than lighter isotopes of the same element .
Atomic nuclei are protons and neutrons held together by the strong nuclear force .
So , we need neutrons for more than two protons to be in a nucleus .
This `` mass effect '' is large for protium -LRB- 1H -RRB- and deuterium -LRB- 2H -RRB- , because deuterium has twice the mass of protium .
For heavier elements , the relative mass difference between isotopes is much less , and the mass effect is usually small .
Different isotopes of the same element have the same atomic number . They have the same number of protons .

Graph theory is a field of mathematics about graphs .
Cayley linked his results on trees with the contemporary studies of chemical composition .
Then make a comment about how all trees are just subsets of graphs . It could also be proven that all connected graphs may be represented as a Tree .
Today , this is called Enumerative graph theory . It developed from Cayleys results , a scientific publication done by PÃ lya between 1935 and 1937 and the generalization of these by De Bruijn in 1959 .
The works of Ramsey on colorations and more specially the results obtained by TurÃ n in 1941 was at the origin of another branch of graph theory , extremal graph theory .
Euler 's formula was about the number of edges , vertices , and faces of a convex polyhedron was studied and generalized by Cauchy and L'Huillier , and is at the origin of topology .
A simpler proof considering only 633 configurations was given twenty years later by Robertson , Seymour , Sanders and Thomas .
One of the most famous and productive problems of graph theory is the four color problem : `` Is it true that any map drawn in the plane may have its regions colored with four colors , in such a way that any two regions having a common border have different colors ? ''
This article , as well as the one written by Vandermonde on the knight problem , carried on with the analysis situs initiated by Leibniz .
A proof produced in 1976 by Kenneth Appel and Wolfgang Haken , which involved checking the properties of 1,936 configurations by computer , was not fully accepted at the time due to its complexity .
Another important factor of common development of graph theory and topology came from the use of the techniques of modern algebra .
The autonomous development of topology from 1860 and 1930 fertilized graph theory back through the works of Jordan , Kuratowski and Whitney .
The four color problem remained unsolved for more than a century .
This problem was first posed by Francis Guthrie in 1852 and its first written record is in a letter of De Morgan addressed to Hamilton the same year .
The first example of such a use comes from the work of the physicist Gustav Kirchhoff , who published in 1845 his Kirchhoff 's circuit laws for calculating the voltage and current in electric circuits .
Tait 's reformulation generated a new class of problems , the factorization problems , particularly studied by Petersen and KÅ ` nig .
The study and the generalization of this problem by Tait , Heawood , Ramsey and Hadwiger led to the study of the colorings of the graphs embedded on surfaces with arbitrary genus .

The name cystic fibrosis refers to the scarring -LRB- fibrosis -RRB- and cyst formation in the pancreas , which was first recognized in the 1930s .

CF is one of the most common fatal inherited diseases . It is most common among Caucasians and Ashkenazi Jews ; one in 25 people of European descent carry one gene for CF , making it the most common genetic disease among them .
Therefore , CF is considered an autonomic recessive disease .
Although most people without CF have two working copies of the CFTR gene , only one is needed to prevent cystic fibrosis .
A large number of symptoms include sinus infections , poor growth , diarrhea and infertility . This is a result from the effects of CF on other parts of the body .
CF is caused by a change in a gene called the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator -LRB- CFTR -RRB- .
CF develops when neither gene works normally .
This gene helps create sweat , digestive juices , and mucus .
Cystic Fibrosis -LRB- also known as CF -RRB- is a common inherited disease that affects the whole body , eventually causing disability and early death .

In astronomy , a Julian year -LRB- symbol : a -RRB- is a unit of measurement of time defined as exactly 365.25 days of 86,400 SI seconds each , totalling 31,557,600 seconds .
Nevertheless , because a Julian year measures duration rather than designates date , the Julian year does not correspond to years in the Julian calendar or any other calendar .
That is the average length of the year in the Julian calendar used in Western societies in previous centuries , and for which the unit is named .

Cephalopods usually move by jet propulsion -LRB- squirting water -RRB- . This uses a lot of energy to travel compared to the tail propulsion used by fish .
Bioluminescence may also be used to attract prey , and some species use colourful shows to get mates , amaze predators , or even signal to one another .
As well as blending with their background , some cephalopods bioluminesce , shining light downwards to hide their shadows from any attackers .
That in turn is used to transport the spermatophores to the female .
In species where the hectocotylus is missing , the penis is long and able to extend beyond the mantle cavity and transfers the spermatophores directly to the female .
The bioluminescence is made by bacterial symbionts ; the host cephalopod is able to find the light made by these animals .
Rapid color change is usually more common in near-shore species than those living in the open ocean . Those in open ocean mostly use camouflage to make their body outline less easy to see .
Like most molluscs , cephalopods use hemocyanin , a copper-containing protein , rather than hemoglobin to transport oxygen .
Devonian cephalopods bear more complex color patterns , whose function may be more complex .
The nervous system of cephalopods is the most complex of the invertebrates , and their brain to body mass ratio falls between that of warm and cold blooded vertebrates .
As a result , their blood is colourless when deoxygenated and turns blue when placed in air .
Most of the energy from their food is used for growing .
Evidence of original colouration has been found in cephalopod fossils as far back as the Silurian ; certain straight-shelled species had lines round their shell , which are thought to have used as camouflage of their body outline .
Cephalopods are the most intelligent invertebrates and have good senses and large brains .
Colouration can be changed in milliseconds as they adjust to their environment , and the pigment cells can expand or contract .
The giant nerve fibers of the cephalopod mantle have been a favorite experimental material for many years ; their large diameter makes them easier to study .
The penis in most male Coleoidea is a long and muscular end of the gonoduct -LRB- tube for sperms -RRB- used to transfer spermatophores -LRB- sperm packages -RRB- to a modified arm called a hectocotylus .
Squids and cuttlefish can move short distances in any direction by moving a flap of muscle around the mantle .
Some octopus species are also able to walk along the sea bed .
With a few exceptions , Coleoideans live short lives with fast growth .

The Andromeda Galaxy is the nearest big galaxy to the Milky Way , which is the galaxy Earth is in .
The Andromeda Galaxy and the Milky Way are thus expected to collide in perhaps 4.5 billion years .
The Andromeda Galaxy is approaching the Milky Way at about 100 to 140 kilometres per second -LRB- 62 to 87 mi\/s -RRB- , so it is one of the few blue-shifted galaxies .
Such events are frequent among the galaxies in galaxy groups .
The Andromeda Galaxy is approaching the Milky Way at about 100 to 140 kilometres per second -LRB- 62 to 87 mi\/s -RRB- , so it is one of the few blue-shifted galaxies . The Andromeda Galaxy and the Milky Way are thus expected to collide in perhaps 4.5 billion years .
A likely outcome of the collision is that the galaxies will merge to form a giant elliptical galaxy .

In 1997 Ignacio Ramonet , editor of Le Monde Diplomatique , started the debate around the Tobin tax again with an editorial titled `` Disarming the markets '' .
According to the legislation , Belgium will introduce the Tobin tax once all countries of the eurozone introduce a similar law .
On June 15 , 2004 , the Commission of Finance and Budget in the Belgian Federal Parliament approved a bill implementing the Spahn tax -LRB- a version of the Tobin tax proposed by Paul-Bernd Spahn -RRB- .
However , there have been initiatives of national dimension about the tax .
Ramonet proposed to create an association for the introduction of this tax , which was named ATTAC -LRB- Association for the Taxation of financial Transactions for the Aid of Citizens -RRB- .
A Tobin tax is a tax on all trade of currency across borders .
It has been proposed that having the United Nations manage a Tobin tax would solve this problem and would give the U.N. a large source of funding independent from donations by participating states .
Tobin suggested a new system for international currency stability , and proposed that such a system include a charge on foreign-exchange transactions .
On August 15 , 1971 , Richard Nixon told that it would no longer be possible to change the US dollar to gold , so ended the Bretton Woods system .
Since one country acting alone would find it very difficult to introduce this tax , many argue it would be best done by an international institution .
The tax has then become an issue of the antiglobalization movement and a matter of discussion not only behind academic institutions but even in the streets and in parliaments around the world , such as the UK and France .

Jhelum and Ravi join Chenab , Beas joins Sutlej , and then Sutlej and Chenab join to form Panjnad near Uch Sharif .
Panjnad River is formed by successive confluence of the five rivers of Punjab , namely Jhelum , Chenab , Ravi , Beas and Sutlej .
A dam on Panjnad has been erected ; it provides irrigation channels for Punjab and Sind provinces south of the Sutlej and east of the Indus rivers .

The combined stream runs southwest for approximately 45 miles and joins Indus River at Mithankot .

The Utman Khel or Utmankhel -LRB- Urdu : Ø Ø Ù Ø Ù Ø Û Ù -RRB- are a Pashtun tribe who live in the hills to the north of Peshawar in the North-West Frontier Province of Pakistan .
They claim to be descendants of Baba Utman Shamraiz , who accompanied Mahmud of Ghazni in his expedition into India in 997 .
Their land is very hilly and difficult , but has well cultivated in terraces .
The British conducted military campaigns against them in 1852 , 1878 , and 1898 .
The Utman Khel are a tall , stout and fair race , but their dress and general customs have been assimilated by the neighbouring peoples of Bajour .
Their land lies between the Mohmands and the Ranizais of Swat , to the west and south-west of the junction of the Swat and Panjkora rivers .

Coats of arms has a golden anchor on blue reason .

City colors are blue and gold .
Such is in addition , in the coats of arms of some close places .

It came back under Prussian rule on January 1 , 1816 , resulting to be assigned to the district of Tecklenburg .
