Hamilton County is a county in the U.S. state of Florida .
24.10 % of all households were made up of people living alone and 9.10 % had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older .
For every 100 females there were 135.00 males .
Hamilton County was created in 1827 from portions of Jefferson County .
The per capita income for the county was $ 10,562 .
The population density was 26 people per square mile -LRB- 10\/km Â -RRB- .
Males had a median income of $ 26,999 versus $ 20,552 for females .
As of the census of 2000 , there were 13,327 people , 4,161 households , and 2,995 families living in the county .
The median age was 35 years .
About 21.70 % of families and 26.00 % of the population were below the poverty line , including 35.70 % of those under age 18 and 16.10 % of those age 65 or over .
There were 4,161 households out of which 32.90 % had children under the age of 18 living with them , 50.30 % were married couples living together , 16.80 % had a female householder with no husband present , and 28.00 % were not related .
The Suwannee River forms the borders it shares with all of the neighboring Florida counties - Suwannee County , Columbia County , and Madison County .
For every 100 females age 18 and over , there were 145.40 males .
The median income for a household in the county was $ 25,638 , and the median income for a family was $ 30,677 .
According to the 2000 census , the county has a total area of 519.31 s , of which 514.86 s -LRB- or 99.14 % -RRB- is land and 4.45 s -LRB- or 0.86 % -RRB- is water .
Its county seat is Jasper , Florida .
There were 4,966 housing units at an average density of 10 per square mile -LRB- 4\/km Â -RRB- .
It contains approximately 2700 a of redwood and grassland .

It was found by Mark Showalter and Jack J. Lissauer in 2003 using the Hubble Space Telescope .
The orbit of Cupid is only 863 km from the orbit of the bigger moon Belinda .

It is the smallest of the closer Uranian moons , estimated to be only about 18 km in diameter .

The museum is a 560,000 square foot -LRB- 52,000 mÂ -RRB- , Beaux-Arts building . Approximately 500,000 people visit the museum each year .
The museum is at 200 Eastern Parkway , in the New York City borough of Brooklyn .
In 2000 , the Brooklyn Museum started the Student Museum Apprentice Program . The museum hires teens ages 13 â `` 17 , to give tours in the museum during the summer , help with the museum 's weekend family programs during the year , and help plan teen events .
The Brooklyn Museum is the second-largest art museum in New York City .
Of 30 works of art , Russman believes 10 are faked .
It has been in the museum 's Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art since 2007 .
Arnold L. Lehman is the museum 's Director .
On March 12 , 2004 , the museum announced that it would revert to its old name , the Brooklyn Museum .
The Brooklyn Museum changed its name to Brooklyn Museum of Art in 1997 .
In 2005 , the museum was one of 406 New York City arts and social service institutions to get part of $ 20 million from the Carnegie Corporation , made possible by a donation by New York City mayor Michael Bloomberg .
In 2002 , the museum bought the work The Dinner Party by artist Judy Chicago .
In 2008 , Edna Russman said that a third of the Coptic art in the museum 's collection , the second-largest in North America , is fake .
Thomas S. Buechner was made the museum 's director in 1960 . He was one of the youngest directors in the country . .
The museum is known for its large collections of Egyptian and African art , and 17th , 18th , and 19th century paintings .
Buechner made a large change in the way the museum displayed the art art . Also one thousand pieces of art that had been in the museum 's archives were put back on display .
The first Saturday of the month in the summer , the Brooklyn Museum stays open late with free family events , which include arts and crafts , live music and a dance party .
Artists like Patrick Kelly , Chuck Close , Denis Peterson , Ron Mueck , Takashi Murakami , Mat Benote , Kiki Smith , Jim Dine , Robert Rauschenberg , Sylvia Sleigh , William Wegman and Banksy have also been found in the museum . .
Daniel Chester French , the man who made the Lincoln Memorial , made two allegorical figures , Brooklyn and Manhattan -LRB- carved in 1916 , and moved to the museum in 1963 -RRB- , and of the figures on the building .
The fake artworks have been displayed since 2009 .

The nuclear emergencies at Japan 's Fukushima I Nuclear Power Station and other nuclear facilities raised questions about the future of nuclear power .
Platts has said that `` the crisis at Japan 's Fukushima nuclear plants has prompted leading energy-consuming countries to review the safety of their existing reactors and cast doubt on the speed and scale of planned expansions around the world '' .
Supporters , such as the World Nuclear Association and IAEA , think that nuclear power is a sustainable energy source that reduces carbon emissions .
There is a debate about the use of nuclear power .
Anti-nuclear opponents , such as Greenpeace International and NIRS , believe that nuclear power poses threats to people and the environment .
Nuclear-powered submarine mishaps include the Soviet submarine K-19 reactor accident -LRB- 1961 -RRB- , the Soviet submarine K-27 reactor accident -LRB- 1968 -RRB- , and the Soviet submarine K-431 reactor accident -LRB- 1985 -RRB- .
In 2007 , 14 % of the world 's electricity came from nuclear power .

Plymouth Colony -LRB- sometimes New Plymouth or The Old Colony -RRB- was an English colonial venture in North America from 1620 until 1691 .
The settlement , which served as the capital of the colony , is today the modern town of Plymouth , Massachusetts .
At its height , Plymouth Colony occupied most of the southeastern portion of the modern state of Massachusetts .
The first settlement was at New Plymouth .

According to an early review by website iFixIt , the new Kindle 2 features a 532 MHz 90 nm processor , 2GB main memory , and 1530 mAh lithium polymer battery .
The internal memory of the Amazon Kindle can hold approximately 200 books without pictures , and the memory is expandable with a memory card .
Amazon 's first offering of Kindle sold out in five and a half hours and the device remained out of stock until late April 2008 .
Amazon estimates that the Kindle 2 will hold about 1500 books .
Two hardware devices , known as `` Kindle '' and `` Kindle 2 , '' support this platform .
Upon the initial launch of the Kindle , Amazon 's Kindle Store had more than 88,000 digital books available for download , with the number of books increasing .
Amazon does not sell the Kindle outside the United States as Whispernet only works in the U.S. Plans for a launch in the UK and other European countries are being delayed by problems with signing up suitable Wi-Fi operators .

The most potent toxin present in these mushrooms is amanitin , of which at least eight versions are known .
The genus Amanita contains about 600 species of basidiomycete mushrooms , including some of the most toxic known . It is found worldwide .
This genus is responsible for approximately 95 % of the fatalities resulting from mushroom poisoning , with the death cap accounting for about 50 % on its own .

The Independent Group -LRB- IG -RRB- , founded in London in 1952 , is regarded as the precursor to the pop art movement .
This material consisted of ` found objects ' such as , advertising , comic book characters , magazine covers and various mass produced graphics that mostly represented American popular culture .
that he had assembled during his time in Paris between 1947 â `` 1949 .
They were a gathering of young painters , sculptors , architects , writers and critics who were challenging modernist approaches to culture as well as traditional views of Fine Art .
The group discussions centered on popular culture implications from such elements as mass advertising , movies , product design , comic strips , science fiction and technology .
Pop art and minimalism are considered to be the last modern art movements and so the precursors to postmodern art , or some of the earliest examples of postmodern art themselves .
After Paolozzi 's seminal presentation in 1952 , the IG focused on the imagery of American popular culture , particularly mass advertising .
Pop art has themes and techniques drawn from popular mass culture , such as advertising and comic books .
At the first Independent Group meeting in 1952 , co-founding member , artist and sculptor Eduardo Paolozzi presented a lecture using a series of collages titled Bunk !
Pop art employs images of popular as opposed to elitist culture in art .
One of the images in that presentation was Paolozzi 's 1947 collage , I was a Rich Man 's Plaything , which includes the first use of the word `` popâ , appearing in a cloud of smoke emerging from a revolver .

Unter den Linden -LRB- `` under the linden trees '' -RRB- is a boulevard in the Mitte district of Berlin , the capital of Germany .
While the western part of the boulevard retained its character , the area around present-day Bebelplatz was changed after the Thirty Years ' War and fortified . There are no trees .

It is named for its linden -LRB- lime in British English -RRB- trees that line the grassed pedestrian mall in the middle of the road
Unter den Linden at the heart of the historic section of Berlin developed from a bridle path laid out by Elector John George of Brandenburg in the 16th century to reach his hunting grounds in the Tiergarten .
In 1851 the famous equestrian -LRB- horse-riding -RRB- statue of King Frederick the Great , designed by Christian Daniel Rauch , was put up on the center strip .

Marcel Duchamp -LRB- 28 July 1887 -- 2 October 1968 -RRB- was a French artist whose work is most often associated with the Dadaist and Surrealist movements .
Duchamp can be seen , very briefly , playing chess with Man Ray in the short film Entr ` acte -LRB- 1924 -RRB- by RenÃ Clair .
Duchamp 's output influenced the development of post-World War I Western art .
Instead , he played chess , which he studied for the rest of his life to the exclusion of most other activities .
He advised modern art collectors , such as Peggy Guggenheim and other prominent figures , thereby helping to shape the tastes of Western art during this period .
The creative act is not performed by the artist alone ; the spectator brings the work in contact with the external world by deciphering and interpreting its inner qualifications and thus adds his contribution to the creative act .
During this period his fascination with chess so distressed his first wife that she glued his pieces to the board .
A playful man , Duchamp challenged conventional thought about artistic processes and art marketing , not so much by writing , but through subversive actions such as dubbing a urinal art and naming it Fountain .
Duchamp continued to play in the French Championships and also in the Chess Olympiads from 1928 â `` 1933 , favoring hypermodern openings such as the Nimzo-Indian .
Upon his return to Paris in 1923 , Duchamp was , in essence , no longer a practicing artist .

Generally , the differences between one balkline game and another are defined by two different things : 1 -RRB- where the balkines are drawn on the table , and 2 -RRB- the number of points that are allowed in each balk space before at least one ball must leave that region of the table . Balkline games are named by giving two numbers that tell us about the spacing used and how many points can be scored in the balk spaces .

Some of the most well known games are straight rail , cushion caroms , balkline , three-cushion billiards and artistic billiards .
In three-cushion billiards , sometimes called three-cushion carom , three-cushion , three-cushions , three-rail , rails and the angle game , the object is to carom off both object balls with at least three rails being contacted before the contact of the cue ball with the second object ball .

The object of cushion caroms is to score cushion caroms , meaning a bounce off of both of the other balls on the table , with at least one rail of the table being struck by the cue ball before the contact with second object ball .

The object of straight rail is simple : one point , called a `` count '' , is scored each time a player 's cue ball makes contact with both object balls -LRB- the second cue ball and the third ball -RRB- on a single strike of the cue ball .
The game is played mostly in western Europe , especially in France , Belgium and the Netherlands .

In the balkline games , rather than drawing balklines a few inches from the corners as was done in the champion 's games , the entire table is divided into rectangular spaces . This is done by drawing balklines a certain distance across the length and the width of the table .
The slate bed of a billiard table is often heated to about 5 Â C\/9 Â F above room temperature , which helps to keep moisture out of the cloth to aid the balls rolling and rebounding in a consistent manner , and generally makes a table play faster .

The most important of these nurse techniques , called the rail nurse , involves nudge the balls down a rail , moving them just a few centimeters on each score and keeping them close together and positioned at the end of each stroke in the same or near the same arrangement so that the rail nurse can be repeated .

A film comic , or anime comics , also referred to as ani-manga , are Japanese manga volumes which use images from an anime series , film , or video release instead of the standard drawn panels .
Companies such as Tokyopop and Viz release films comics but refer to them as Cine-manga and Ani-manga , respectively .
They generally contain the full dialog from the anime from which they are adapted .
While generally published in book form , they are also sometimes released electronically as e-books , occasionally called e-manga .
This format has been adopted by companies such as Disney and companies from other countries ' television and film , and may even be based on live-action productions .
Films comics have been well received in English speaking countries , with some titles selling more than 500,000 copies .

New South Greenland , which is also known as Morrell 's Land , was an appearance of land recorded by the American captain Benjamin Morrell . Morrel reported the sighting on the schooner Wasp in , during a sealing and exploration voyage in the Weddell Sea area of Antarctica .
Here , a depth sounding recorded 1,676 fathoms -LRB- 10,060 feet , 3,065 m -RRB- , leading Shackleton to write : `` I decided that Morrell Land must be added to the long list of Antarctic islands and continental coasts that have resolved themselves into icebergs '' .
Although Filchner 's and Shackleton 's investigations and observations were accepted as conclusive proof that New South Greenland was a myth , there remained the question of Sir James Ross 's reported appearance of land in a position around 65 Â S , 47 Â W. Ross 's reputation was sufficient for this possibility to be taken seriously , and for his alleged sighting to be recorded on maps and Admiralty charts .
This scepticism remained even after Sir James Clark Ross reported an appearance of land in 1843 , not far from Morrell 's alleged observation : Ross 's sighting was occasionally proffered as supportive of Morrell 's claim .

Hugh Robert Mill , writing in 1905 before the non-existence of New South Greenland had been proved conclusively , refers to the sheer absurdity of some of the incidents described in Morrell 's account , and concludes that because of Morrell 's blunders , and his habit of incorporating the experiences of others into his story , all his claims must be treated as not proven .

Benjamin Morrell sailed to the South Sandwich Islands . Morrel was appointed commander of the schooner Wasp for a two-year voyage of sealing , trading and exploration in the Antarctic seas and the southern Pacific Ocean in 1822 .
Wasp sailed for Tierra del Fuego , then through the Magellan Strait into the Pacific Ocean , reaching Valparaiso , Chile , on 1823 .
Great white and golden cities of Oriental appearance at close intervals along these cliff-tops indicate distant bergs ... The lines rise and fall , tremble , dissipate , and reappear in an endless transformation scene '' .
Robert Johnson , a former captain of the Wasp , had made an exploratory voyage along the western coast of the Antarctic peninsula in 1821 . Johnson had called it `` New South Greenland '' .
In search of an explanation Mills suggests that since Morrell 's account was written nine years after the voyage he may not have had access to the ship 's log , and hence may `` have felt constrained to invent details that appeared plausible '' in order to sustain his narrative .
The first determined search for New South Greenland came during the Second German Antarctic Expedition , 1911 â `` 13 , under Wilhelm Filchner .
Other sightings may have been of actual land , wrongly located through observational errors due to chronometer failure , bad weather or simple incompetence .
He also records seeing 3,000 sea elephants .
This showed that no land was near .
Filchner 's view that the supposed sighting of New South Greenland could be explained by a mirage is echoed by Simpson-Housley .
His account continues : `` At half past we were close on with the body of land to which Captain Johnson had given the name of New South Greenland '' .
Finding the sea remarkably free of ice , Morrell advanced to 70 Â 14 'S before turning north-westward on .
The credibility of this claim of such fast , direct travel in ice-infested waters has been widely disputed , particularly as Morrell quotes southerly latitudes during the voyage which later proved to be at least 100 miles inside the then undiscovered Antarctic continental mainland .

This would explain the profusion of positional and date errors .

In 1939 the orchestra 's sponsors stopped giving money to the orchestra . The orchestra became a self-governing body , which meant that , like the London Symphony Orchestra , the players organized the orchestra themselves , deciding on their pay , their members , what music they should play etc.

The London Philharmonic Orchestra -LRB- LPO -RRB- is one of the major orchestras of the United Kingdom . It is based in the Royal Festival Hall , London .
At one of the orchestra 's early concerts in November 1932 the sixteen-year old Yehudi Menuhin played a program of violin concertos including the concerto by Elgar which the composer himself conducted .
The associate conductor at the time was Malcolm Sargent .
In 1967 the LPO appointed Bernard Haitink as its principal conductor .
The orchestra was formed in 1932 by Sir Thomas Beecham , and played its first concert on October 7 1932 at the Queen 's Hall , London .

The calcium-channel blocker , verapamil is useful in the treatment of hypomania and in those cases where lithium and mood stabilizers are contraindicated or ineffective . .
It can also often be complicated by the sufferer 's lack of judgment and insight regarding periods of exacerbation of symptoms .
Lithium is the classic mood stabilizer to prevent further manic and depressive episodes .
When the symptoms of mania have gone , long-term treatment then focuses on prophylactic treatment to try to stabilize the patient 's mood . Very often , this is done using a combination of drugs and psychotherapy .
Although `` severely elevated mood '' sounds somewhat desirable and enjoyable , the experience of mania is often quite unpleasant and sometimes disturbing , if not frightening , for the person involved -LRB- and those close to them -RRB- , and may lead to impulsive behavior that may later be regretted .
This negative experience creates an inability to function and an absentmindedness where the manic individual 's thoughts totally preoccupy him or her , making him or her unable to keep track of time or be aware of anything besides the neurological pattern of thoughts .
The word itself comes from from Greek Î 1\/4 Î Î 1\/2 Î Î -LRB- Mania -RRB- and that from Î 1\/4 Î Î Î 1\/2 Î Î 1\/4 Î Î - mainomai , `` to rage , to be furious '' .
Anticonvulsants such as valproic acid and carbamazepine are also used for prophylaxis .
The mania in bipolar disorder is usually treated using a combination of mood stabilizers and antipsychotic drugs .
More recent drug solutions include lamotrigine .
Another symptom of mania is racing thoughts during which the sufferer is excessively distracted by unimportant stimuli .

After that , Esperanto speakers began to see the language and the culture that was shared is owned by themselves , even if Esperanto is never chosen by the United Nations or other international organizations .
The Boston Globe , 12 May 1999 Those who focus on the basic value of the language are commonly called raÅ mistoj , from Rauma , Finland , where a statement on the near-term -LRB- not far from today -RRB- not believing in the `` fina venko '' and the value of Esperanto culture was made at the International Youth Congress -LRB- meeting -RRB- in 1980 .
The largest is the Universala Kongreso de Esperanto -LRB- Universal Congress of Esperanto -RRB- , held in a different country each year .
This goal was widely shared with Esperanto speakers in the early years of the Esperanto movement .
Those Esperanto speakers who want Esperanto to be chosen by organizations or used worldwide are commonly called finvenkistoj , from fina venko , meaning `` final victory '' , or pracelistoj , from pracelo , meaning `` original goal '' .

A Java Virtual Machine -LRB- JVM -RRB- is a set of computer software programs and data structures which use a virtual machine model for the execution of other computer programs and scripts .
The model used by a JVM accepts a form of computer intermediate language commonly referred to as Java bytecode .
The JVM is an important component of the Java Platform . Because JVMs are available for many hardware and software platforms , Java can be both middleware and a platform in its own right -- hence the expression `` write once , run anywhere . ''
The use of the same bytecode for all platforms allows Java to be described as `` compile once , run anywhere '' , as opposed to `` write once , compile anywhere '' , which describes cross-platform compiled languages .
Java Virtual Machines operate on Java bytecode , which is normally -LRB- but not necessarily -RRB- generated from Java source code ; a JVM can also be used to implement programming languages other than Java .
Swat -LRB- Urdu : Ø Û Ø Ø Ø Ø Ù Ø Ø -RRB- was a princely state and is now part of Pakistan .
Swat was part of the Mughal Empire ruled by local rulers known as Akhoond or Akhwand .
It lay to the north of the modern North-West Frontier Province of Pakistan until it was dissolved in 1969 .
From 1926 until 1947 , Swat was a princely state in British Raj , and in 1947 it acceded to Pakistan .
It incorporated the current states of Swat , Buner and Shangla .

The subsolar point on a planet is when its sun looks like it is directly overhead -LRB- in zenith -RRB- .
For planets with a rotation like the Earth 's , the subsolar point will move westward , circling the globe once a day .
The hero of the story is Greatheart , the servant of the Interpreter , who is a pilgrim 's guide to the Celestial City .

Bunyan presents a decrepit and harmless giant to confront Christian at the end of the Valley of the Shadow of Death that is explicitly named `` Pope '' : Now I saw in my Dream , that at the end of this Valley lay blood , bones , ashes , and mangled bodies of men , even of Pilgrims that had gone this way formerly : And while I was musing what should be the reason , I espied a little before me a Cave , where two Giants , Pope and Pagan , dwelt in old times , by whose Power and Tyranny the Men whose bones , blood ashes , & c. lay there , were cruelly put to death .

Because of its explicit English Protestant theology The Pilgrim 's Progress shares the feeling of most English , in the 17th century , against the Roman Catholic Church .

The book is divided into two parts , and is 108,260 words long . Each part is a continuous narrative , with no chapter divisions .
You must needs go along with us ; we will wait for you , we will lend you our help , we will deny ourselves of some things , both opinionative and practical , for your sake ; we will not enter into doubtful disputations before you , we will be made all things to you , rather than you shall be left behind .

On the way , Christian and Hopeful meet a man called Ignorance .
Faithful is put on trial , and executed .
Just outside the Valley of the Shadow of Death he meets Faithful , who also used to live in the City of Destruction . They go together to Vanity Fair , where they are both arrested because they do not like the kind of business which is being done at the fair , all based on greed .
Using the key , they escape .
The giant wants them to commit suicide , but they refuse . Suddenly Christian realizes that a key he has , called Promise , will open all the doors and gates of Doubting Castle .
Samuel Johnson said that `` this is the great merit of the book , that the most cultivated man can not find anything to praise more highly , and the child knows nothing more amusing '' .

The explicit Protestant theology of The Pilgrim 's Progress made it popular .
Three years after its publication -LRB- 1681 -RRB- , it was reprinted in colonial America , and was widely read in the Puritan colonies .

He must go to the Wicket Gate .
In the Second Part , Goodwill is shown to be Jesus himself .
Christian and Hopeful eventually reach the Celestial City .
He kills four giants , including Giant Despair , and helps to kill a monster that terrorizes the city of Vanity .
It clarifies and reinforces and justifies the story of Part I. The beam of Bunyan 's spotlight is broadened to include Christian 's family and other men , women , and children ; the incidents and accidents of everyday life are more numerous , the joys of the pilgrimage tend to outweigh the hardships ; and to the faith and hope of Part I is added in abundant measure that greatest of virtues , charity .
Part Two was published in 1684 .
The Second Part of The Pilgrim 's Progress presents the pilgrimage of Christian 's wife , Christiana ; their sons and the maiden , Mercy .
Expert critics think the second part is important , and brings in more ideas : `` Part II , which appeared in 1684 , is much more than a mere sequel to or repetition of the earlier volume .

The Pilgrim 's Progress is an English language book written by John Bunyan .
It was published over the years of the Popish Plot -LRB- 1678 â `` 1681 -RRB- and ten years before the Glorious Revolution of 1688 , and it shows the influence of John Foxe 's Foxe 's Book of Martyrs .
The two parts of The Pilgrim 's Progress in reality constitute a whole , and the whole is , without doubt , the most influential religious book ever written in the English language .

The Red City Hall is the town hall of Berlin , located in the Mitte borough on RathausstraÃ e near Alexanderplatz .
The Neues Stadthaus , which survived the bombing and had been the head office of the Berlin city fire insurance company in ParochialstraÃ e was the temporary city hall for the post-war city government for all four sectors of Berlin until September 1948 .
The reconstructed Rotes Rathaus , then located in the Soviet sector , served as the town hall of East Berlin , while the Rathaus SchÃ neberg in SchÃ neberg borough was seat of the West Berlin Senate .
It is the home to the governing mayor and the government -LRB- the Senate of Berlin -RRB- of the Federal state of Berlin .
The Rathaus was built between 1861 and 1869 in the style of the north Italian High Renaissance by Hermann Friedrich Waesemann .
After German reunification , the administration of reunified Berlin officially moved into the Rotes Rathaus on 1 October 1991 .
It was modelled on the Old Town Hall of ToruÅ , now in Poland , while the architecture of the tower is reminiscent of the cathedral tower of Notre-Dame of Laon in France .
Following that time , it housed only those of the Soviet sector .
The building was heavily damaged by Allied bombing in World War II and rebuilt to the original plans between 1951 and 1956 .

Gili Trawangan is the largest of Lombok 's Gili Islands .
Some of the first people to live on Gili Trawangan were from Sulawesi . They were fishermen and farmers .
For traveling to and from each of the Gilis , motorized boats and speedboats are used .
The economy of Gili Trawangan centres on tourism . The island is too small to support large amounts of agriculture .
Of the Gilis , Trawangan has the most tourist facilities . The pub TÃ r na NÃ g says that Trawangan is the smallest island in the world with an Irish pub .

It was made on May 9 ; three weeks earlier than when the 2007 season was supposed to start . Andrea started from a non-tropical rain weather area off the coast of Daytona Beach , Florida .
The storm was also the first named storm to form in the month of May since Tropical Storm Arlene from the 1981 season .
After staying close to the same area , on May 10 , Andrea weakened into a subtropical depression after coming near to dry air and wind shear , and on the next day , the National Hurricane Center stopped looking at the storm and stopped giving out advisories .
Andrea was the first tropical storm to form before the official start of the season since Tropical Storm Ana from the 2003 season which formed on April 2003 .

For approximately fifteen years some cultural associations have offered courses in Leonese , sometimes with the support or collaboration of local administrations in the provinces of Leon and Zamora .
Leonese was the language of the Kingdom of LeÃ n in the Middle Ages .
The UNESCO in its Atlas of Languages in Danger in the World , places Leonese among languages in danger .
The language has a system with five vowels in a stressed position , represented by a , e , i , o , and u and three -LRB- two archiphonemes \/ I \/ , \/ U \/ and one phoneme \/ a \/ -RRB- in non-stressed position , represented by e , u , and a at the end of word .

It was thought to be the same as the Pipistrellus tenuis , but new research on the bat 's baculum , -LRB- a penis bone -RRB- , has shown that Pipistrellus murrayi is a different species .

Sidecar-Cross racing , also known as Sidecar Motocross , is a race that uses a different motorcycle chassis than regular motocross . It also uses a team of two people riding together , a `` driver '' and a `` passenger '' .
Sidecarcross is done on the same tracks as normal motocross , but the driver has to ride differently then when riding solo .
The passenger does much more work than the driver because he moves his whole body around all the time .
One of the most important things in sidecar racing is teamwork ; the best teams race together for many years .
The driver can not lean over in the turns . To make sure that the sidecar does not flip over , the passenger leans out of the sidecar when they are in the corners .
How much of a carcinogen a radiation is depends on the type of radiation , the type of exposure to it and its penetration .
Marie Curie , one of the pioneers of radioactivity , died of a cancer that was caused by the radiation she was exposed to during her experiments .
For example , alpha radiation has low penetration and is not a danger outside the body .
Not all types of electromagnetic radiation are carcinogenic .
Radio waves , microwave radiation , infrared radiation , and visible light are examples of this .
Higher-energy radiation , including ultraviolet radiation , usually is carcinogenic , if a person is exposed to it long enough .

LiÃ ge Airport , also called LiÃ ge-Bierset , is an important cargo airport in Belgium .
It is mainly used for freight operation but also serve more than 21 destinations for passengers -LRB- mainly charters -RRB- .
LiÃ ge Airport is the world hub of TNT Airways , and the European hub of CAL Cargo Air Lines , El Al Cargo and Ethiopian Cargo -LRB- using Southern Air aircrafts -RRB- .
The airport is also used as a regular refuelling stop on New York City - Middle East routes by Kalitta Air -LRB- including the Newark - Baghdad route for US mail -RRB- .
It was at the end of 2007 the 8th biggest cargo airport in Europe and the 38th biggest in the world .
The airport is located in the north-west of the city of LiÃ ge , in the east of Belgium .
Like many Egyptian writers and intellectuals , Mahfouz was on a `` death list '' by Islamic fundamentalists .
`` You could say , '' he later noted , `` that the one thing which most shook the security of my childhood was the 1919 revolution . ''
The Egyptian Revolution of 1919 had a strong effect on Mahfouz , although he was at the time only seven years old .
Before his death , Mahfouz was the oldest living Nobel Literature laureate and the third oldest of all time , only Bertrand Russell and Halldor Laxness were older .
He defended Salman Rushdie after the Iranian spiritual leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini condemned him to death , but later he criticized Rushdie 's Satanic Verses as `` insulting '' to Islam .
At the time of his death , he was the only Arabic-language writer to have won the Nobel Prize for Literature .
Because of his outspoken support for Sadat 's Camp David peace treaty with Israel , his books were banned in many Arab countries until after he won the Nobel prize .
In his childhood Mahfouz read extensively .
His mother often took him to museums and Egyptian history later became a major theme in many of his books .
Mahfouz was born in the Gamaliya quarter of Cairo and was named after Professor Naguib Pasha Mahfouz -LRB- 1882-1974 -RRB- , the renowned Coptic physician who delivered him .
From the window he often saw English soldiers firing at the demonstrators , men and women .
Naguib Mahfouz -LRB- , NagÄ `` b Maá fÅ `` á `` -RRB- -LRB- December 11 , 1911 â `` August 30 , 2006 -RRB- was an Egyptian novelist who won the 1988 Nobel Prize for Literature and who managed to modernize Arabic literature .
He is one of the few writers of Arabic literature , who explored themes of existentialism .

Icing in ice hockey is a rule the happens when a player shoots the puck across at least two red lines , the other team 's goal line being the last , and the puck remains untouched but it is not icing if the player shoots the puck from behind the halfway line of the ice into the goal .
If the goal went into the net it would be counted as a goal .
There is also automatic or no-touch icing which is used mostly in lower-level professional hockey leagues like the ECHL and Central Hockey League , It was enforced in 1990 after LudÄ k Ä ajka , a Czech player rushed to get to the puck in an icing situation , he crashed into the boards , suffered severe spinal injuries , and died a few weeks later .

228 locomotives in the class were built by English Electric between 1957 and 1968 . The large number was partly to do with the failure of other early designs in the same power range , and reliable locomotives veing needed .
The locomotives were originally numbered D8000 â `` D8199 and D8300 â `` D8327 .
They are known by railway enthusiasts as `` Choppers '' , a name taken from the distinctive beat the engine produces under load which resembles the sound of a helicopter .

A baseball glove , or mitt , is a leather glove that baseball players use to catch a baseball that are hit by a batter or thrown by a fielder .
While catching in baseball was two handed , gloves grew to a size that made it easier to catch the ball in the webbing of the glove , and use the off-hand to keep it from falling out .
Before the mid 1890s , baseball gloves were worn normally by baseball players .
A glove is worn on the non-dominant hand , leaving the dominant hand for throwing the ball ; for example , a right-handed player would wear a glove on the left hand .
The shape and size of the baseball glove is decided by official baseball rules ; Section 1.00 , Objectives of the Game , defines limits of catcher 's , first baseman 's and fielder 's glove in parts 1.12 , 1.13 and 1.14 .
By convention , the type of glove that fits on the left hand is called a `` right-handed '' or `` RH '' glove .
This design soon became added to baseball gloves and webbed gloves were starting to be used by all baseball players .
In , Bill Doak , a pitcher for the St. Louis Cardinals , suggested that a web be placed between the first finger and the thumb in order to create a pocket .
Anna Fitzgerald 's older sister , Kate , suffers from acute promyelocytic leukemia , a cancer of the blood and bone marrow .
My Sister 's Keeper is a 2004 novel written by Jodi Picoult .
Set in Rhode Island , it tells the story of a 13-year-old girl named Anna Fitzgerald , a `` designer baby '' , who sues her parents so that they can no longer legally control her medical decisions once she learns expected to donate a kidney to her older sister Kate , who is dying from leukemia , cancer of the blood and bone marrow .
Once Anna is born , her umbilical chord blood was used in treatments for Kate to save her life .
Although the treatment was initially successful , Kate relapsed -LRB- became sick again -RRB- . Since then , Anna had been used as a donor for any other bodily substance needed to treat Kate , who continues to swing between remission and relapse as she grows up .

This process is called hematopoiesis -LRB- = blood growth -RRB- .
In the circulatory system they move from lymph node to lymph node .
A low normal to low absolute lymphocyte count is found with infections after surgery or trauma .
After they mature , the lymphocytes enter the circulation and lymphoid organs -LRB- e.g. the spleen and lymph nodes -RRB- where they are able to sense invading pathogens and tumor cells .
B cells mature into B lymphocytes in the bone marrow , while T cells migrate to and mature in a distinct organ , called the thymus .
Throughout the lifetime of an animal , these cells will ` remember ' each specific pathogen encountered , and are able to make a strong response if the pathogen is detected again .
The function of T cells and B cells is to recognize foreign antigens .
The effects of other virus or lymphocyte disorders can also often be estimated by counting the numbers of lymphocytes present in the blood .
Natural killer cells can tell the difference between infected cells , tumors , and normal cells . They recognize changes in the level of a surface molecule called MHC -LRB- major histocompatibility complex -RRB- class I.
Human immunodeficiency virus -LRB- HIV -RRB- infects and destroys T cells .
Natural killer -LRB- NK -RRB- cells are a part of the immune system a person is born with . They protect the organism from tumors and from cells infected by viruses .
All lymphocytes come from a common basic lymphocyte cell before differentiating into their distinct lymphocyte types .
Mammalian stem cells change or differentiate into several kinds of blood cell within the bone marrow .
Once they are made active , B cells and T cells produce memory cells .
Cytokines signal to other immune cells that there is a foreign antigen present . Other T cells , called cytotoxic T cells , produce toxic granules which cause the death of infected cells .
This contrasts with macrophages , which are rather stationary in the nodes .
T cells -LRB- thymus cells -RRB- and B cells -LRB- bone cells -RRB- are the main cells of the adaptive immune response .
When white blood cells are counted , the lymphocyte count is the percentage of lymphocytes present .
Other T cells , called cytotoxic T cells , produce toxic granules which cause the death of infected cells .
The extent of HIV progression is found by measuring the percentage of CD4 + T cells in the patient 's blood .
The NK cells then release cytotoxic -LRB- cell-killing -RRB- granules which then destroy the altered cells .
An increase in lymphocyte concentration is usually a sign of a viral infection -LRB- in some rare case , leukemias are found through an abnormally high lymphocyte count in an otherwise normal person -RRB- .
Without the key defense that these T cells provide , the body becomes prone to infections that otherwise would not affect healthy people .

Potato , rice , wheat , and maize are major sources of starch in the human diet .
The structural components of plants are formed primarily from cellulose .
Examples include storage polysaccharides such as starch and glycogen and structural polysaccharides such as cellulose and chitin .
Starches are insoluble in water .
They tend to be amorphous , insoluble in water , and have no sweet taste .
They can be digested by hydrolysis , catalyzed by enzymes called amylases .
Wood is largely cellulose and lignin , while paper and cotton are nearly pure cellulose .
Certain animals can digest cellulose , because bacteria possessing the enzyme are present in their gut .
Cellulose is a polymer made with repeated glucose units .
Humans and many other animals do not digest cellulose .
Humans and other animals have amylases , so they can digest starches .

Because the closure itself has a reference to , it can use that variable each time calls it .

secret-message msg -RRB- -RRB- -RRB- -LRB- set !
Note : Some speakers call any data structure that binds a lexical environment a closure , but the term usually refers specifically to functions .
Because the closure in this case outlives the scope of the function that creates it , the variables and live on after the function returns .
In this example , the function named gradient forms a closure together with the variables f and dx . This closure is then returned by the outer function named derivative .
-LRB- let -LRB- -LRB- secret-message `` none '' -RRB- -RRB- -LRB- set !
\/ \/ Return a function that approximates the derivative of f \/ \/ using an interval of dx , which should be appropriately small .
When the lambda expression is evaluated , Scheme creates a closure consisting of the code for the lambda and a reference to the variable , which is a free variable inside the lambda .
The term closure is often mistakenly used to mean anonymous function .
This is probably because most languages implementing anonymous functions allow them to form closures and programmers are usually introduced to both concepts at the same time .
Closures typically appear in languages in which functions are first-class values -- in other words , such languages allow functions to be passed as arguments , returned from function calls , bound to variable names , etc. , just like simpler types such as strings and integers .
The closure is then passed to the function , which calls it repeatedly to determine which books are to be added to the result list and which are to be discarded .
The keyword is used here instead of , and an method instead of a global function , but otherwise the structure and the effect of the code are the same .
In this example , the lambda expression appears within the function .
These are however different concepts .
A function may create a closure and return it . The following example is a function that returns a function .
The concept of closures was developed in the 1960s and was first fully implemented as a language feature in the programming language Scheme .
In languages without closures , the lifetime of a local variable coincides with the execution of the scope where that variable is declared .
bar -LRB- lambda secret-message -RRB- -RRB- -RRB-
function bestSellingBooks -LRB- threshold -RRB-
\/ \/ Return a list of all books with at least ` threshold ' copies sold .
foo -LRB- lambda -LRB- msg -RRB- -LRB- set !
In languages with closures , variables must continue to exist as long as any existing closures have references to them .

From 1927 â `` 28 onwards it was awarded to the champion of the NHL American Division while the O'Brien Trophy was awarded to the NHL Canadian Division . It was then repurposed to being the trophy for the overall regular season champion in the 1938-39 NHL season when the NHL reverted to a single division .
However , a traditional superstition that is prevalent among many of today 's NHL players is that no player should either touch or hoist the Wales Trophy -LRB- or the Western Conference 's trophy , the Clarence S. Campbell Bowl -RRB- when they have won the conference playoffs as the Eastern Conference champions . Players feel that the Stanley Cup is the only true championship trophy and thus it should be the only trophy that should be hoisted .
After the WHL folded and the Stanley Cup was awarded only to the NHL playoff champion , the Prince of Wales Trophy was awarded to the regular season champion .
The trophy was first established in the 1923-24 NHL season , for the champion of the NHL playoffs , but it has been the trophy for eight different accomplishments , which also include being the NHL regular season champions , American Division regular season champions , regular season champions , East Division regular season champions , Wales Conference regular season champions , Wales Conference playoffs champions , and Eastern Conference playoffs champions .
When the league formed two conferences in the season of 1974 â `` 75 , the award was transferred to the team that finished with the best regular-season record in the Wales Conference . Starting with the 1981 â `` 82 campaign , when the league changed its playoff format so that the two teams meeting in the Stanley Cup finals could no longer come from the same conference , the trophy was presented to the Wales Conference playoff champions , and since the 1993 â `` 94 season , the Eastern Conference playoff champions have won the award .
The Prince of Wales Trophy , or simply the Wales Trophy , is a National Hockey League -LRB- NHL -RRB- trophy awarded to the Eastern Conference -LRB- formerly the Wales Conference -RRB- playoff champions .
It was first presented to the playoff champion of the NHL -LRB- replacing the O'Brien Trophy -RRB- who then went on to face the Western Hockey League -LRB- WHL -RRB- champion for the Stanley Cup .
Starting with the 1981 â `` 82 campaign , when the league changed its playoff format so that the two teams meeting in the Stanley Cup finals could no longer come from the same conference , the trophy was presented to the Wales Conference playoff champions , and since the 1993 â `` 94 season , the Eastern Conference playoff champions have won the award .
The Prince of Wales Trophy , or simply the Wales Trophy , is a National Hockey League -LRB- NHL -RRB- trophy awarded to the Eastern Conference -LRB- formerly the Wales Conference -RRB- playoff champions . The trophy is awarded prior to the final series which are the championship games to decide the winner for the Stanley Cup against the Western Conference 's champions .

Please remember that time spent on the Simple English Wikipedia and number of edits made , do not show the quality of an editor 's work , or how useful they are as a member of the community .
It is done strictly by counting the time you have been an editor and number of edits .
Unlike other awards which are only given by one editor to another , these awards can be given to yourself , though they can also be given by another editor .
Service awards also do not show any level of authority . Senior editors have no more authority than `` novice '' editors .
There is no special process for getting these awards . You decide which one you are eligible for , and place it on your user page .

The Formula One World Constructors ' Championship -LRB- WCC -RRB- is awarded the most successful constructor of the year .
For the purposes of the Championship , different combinations of car makes and engines are different constructors .
Constructors ' Championship points are awarded by adding the points scored in each race by all the drivers for that constructor .
The Constructors ' Championship was first awarded in 1958 , to Vanwall .
For most seasons up until 1979 , a constructor was awarded only the points from the highest-scoring driver in each race .
Scientific understanding of Iguanodon has evolved over time as new information has been obtained from the fossils .
As one of the first scientifically well-known dinosaurs , Iguanodon has occupied a small but notable place in the public 's perception of dinosaurs , its artistic representation changing significantly in response to new interpretations of its remains .
Discovered in 1822 and described three years later by English geologist Gideon Mantell , Iguanodon was the second dinosaur formally named , after Megalosaurus .
The taxonomy of the genus continues to be a topic of study as new species are named or long-standing ones reassigned to other genera .
A large , bulky herbivore , Iguanodon is in the same family as the duck-billed hadrosaurs .
Together with Megalosaurus and Hylaeosaurus , it was one of the three genera originally used to define Dinosauria .
The numerous specimens of this genus , including nearly complete skeletons from two well-known bonebeds , have allowed researchers to make informed hypotheses regarding many aspects of the living animal , including feeding , movement , and social behavior .

The Woolly Flying Squirrel -LRB- Eupetaurus cinereus -RRB- is a sqirrel . It is the only species of the genus Eupetaurus .
It is the longest member of the family Sciuridae and the most massive gliding animal known , but observations confirm that despite its size , it does glide effectively like other flying squirrels .
However , recent research has confirmed that it is still extant in Pakistan-administered Kashmir -LRB- P.A. K -RRB- .
Until recently scientific knowledge of this rare species was limited to 11 skins collected in the late nineteenth century .

GParted is a graphical program using the parted libraries .

The term fortification comes from the Latin words fortis -LRB- `` strong '' -RRB- and facere -LRB- `` to make '' -RRB- .
Many military installations are known as forts , although they are not always fortified .
People have constructed defensive works for many thousands of years , but the designs have become more and more complex .
Fortifications are military constructions and buildings designed for defense during war .
The word fortification can also mean the practice of improving an area 's defense with defensive works .
Larger forts may class as fortresses , smaller ones formerly often bore the name of fortalices .
City walls are fortifications but not necessarily called fortresses .

The Royal Coat of Arms of the United Kingdom is the official coat of arms of the British monarch , currently Queen Elizabeth II .
The shield is quartered , depicting in the first and fourth quarters the three passant guardant lions of England ; in the second , the rampant lion and double tressure fleury-counter-fleury of Scotland ; and in the third , a harp for Ireland .
Different versions are used by other members of the Royal Family ; and by the British Government in connection with the administration and government of the country .
In Scotland , the Queen has a separate version of the Royal Arms , a variant of which is used by the Scotland Office .
These arms are used by the Queen in her official capacity as monarch of the United Kingdom , and are officially known as her Arms of Dominion .
It is now the London Jewish Cultural Centre but a blue plaque marks it as Pavlova 's previous home and a site of significant historical interest .
Pavlova is most recognized for the creation of the rÃ le The Dying Swan and , with her own company , would become the first ballerina to tour ballet around the world .
She is widely regarded as one of the finest classical ballet dancers in history and was most noted as a principal artist of the Imperial Russian Ballet and the Ballets Russes of Serge Diaghilev .
The house had an ornamental lake where she would feed her pet swans , and where there is a statue of the ballerina by the Scots sculptor George Henry Paulin .
After leaving Russia , Pavlova settled in Ivy House on North End Road , near Hampstead , where she lived for the rest of her life .
While in London Pavlova was influential in the development of British ballet , most notably inspiring the career of Alicia Markova .

Well-known pelycosaurs include the genera Dimetrodon , Sphenacodon , Edaphosaurus , and Ophiacodon .
Fossil evidence from some ophiacodonts shows that parts of the skin was naked , but that the belly was covered in dermal scutes . These scutes looked like the scutes present in reptile groups , but they are of a different type of structure .
Unlike lepidosaurian reptiles , pelycosaurs lacked epidermal scales .
In 1940 the group was reviewed in detail and every species known at the time described -LRB- and many illustrated -RRB- in an important monograph .
In life , this would have been covered by skin , and possibly functioned as a thermoregulatory device and\/or a mating display .
At least two pelycosaur clades independently evolved a tall sail , consisting of elongated vertebral spines : the edaphosaurids and the sphenacodontids .
Pelycosaur fossils have been found mainly in Europe and North America , although some small , late-surviving forms are known from Russia and South Africa .

Napoleon dealt with Prussia very harshly , Prussia lost many of its Polish territories , as well as all territory west of the Elbe , and had to pay for French troops that occupied Prussia .
He died on 7 June 1840 .
Frederick William III -LRB- 3 August 1770 â `` 7 June 1840 -RRB- was king of Prussia from 1797 to 1840 .
At the Congress of Vienna , Frederick William 's ministers succeeded in securing important territorial increases for Prussia .
He was considered to be a shy and reserved boy ,
After the war , Frederick William did not keep the promises he had made in 1813 to supply Prussia with a constitution .
As a soldier he received the usual training of a Prussian prince , obtained his lieutenancy in 1784 , became a colonel in 1790 , and took part in the campaigns against France of 1792-1794 .

A very pure form of iodine is made by reacting copper sulfate and potassium iodide . This makes copper -LRB- II -RRB- iodide which is not stable .
Iodine is used for a disinfectant .
Air is blown over the water to evaporate the iodine .
Chlorine is reacted with seawater to change the iodide to iodine .
It breaks down into copper -LRB- I -RRB- iodide and iodine , which is pure .
Iodine is one of the heaviest elements needed by living things .
Tincture of iodine is a common iodine disinfectant .
The radioactive iodine easily goes into the thyroid and causes cancer . When people take iodine tablets , it fills up the thyroid with non-radioactive iodine which prevents any radioactive iodine from coming in .

The convention was approved at a special United Nations conference on 28 July 1951 .
It also makes clear which people are not seen as refugees , such as war criminals .
Articles from 1 to 12 consist Chapter I and Article 1 of the Convention as amended by the 1967 Protocol provides the definition of a refugee : `` A person who owing to a well-founded fear of being persecuted for reasons of race , religion , nationality , membership of a particular social group or political opinion , is outside the country of his nationality and is unable or , owing to such fear , is unwilling to avail himself of the protection of that country ; or who , not having a nationality and being outside the country of his former habitual residence as a result of such events , is unable or , owing to such fear , is unwilling to return to it . . ''
Denmark was the first state to ratify the treaty -LRB- on 4 December 1952 -RRB- and there are now 147 signatories to either the Convention or the Protocol or to both .
Because the convention was approved in Geneva , it is often referred to as `` the Geneva Convention , '' though it is not one of the Geneva Conventions specifically dealing with allowable behavior in time of war .
The United Nations Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees is an international agreement that defines who is a refugee , and makes clear what are the rights of individuals who are granted asylum and the responsibilities of nations that grant asylum .
It was initially limited to protecting European refugees after World War II but a 1967 protocol removed the geographical and time limits .

In 1913 the school moved to the site in Deakin Leas as the school was growing quickly and the library was not big enough .
Tonbridge Grammar School started in 1905 on the top floor of the Tonbridge Library with only 13 pupils .
The Sooty Barbthroat -LRB- Threnetes niger -RRB- is a species of hummingbird .
Its habitat is humid tropical lowland forest .
Freire 's Sooty Barbthroat -LRB- T. n. freirei -RRB- is average between the Sooty and Bronze-tailed Barbthroats however , and thus its status needs to be more clear before the problem is fixed .
Some authors thought the Sooty Barbthroat to be a `` melanistic variant '' of the Pale-tailed Barbthroat -LRB- T. leucurus -RRB- .
Though normally restricted in range , it is common enough to be thought a Species of Least Concern by the IUCN .
Not only that , but some suggest that the Bronze-tailed Barbthroat -LRB- T. n. loehkeni -RRB- should also be thought a valid species and have the doubtful Christina 's Barbthroat -LRB- T. n. christinae -RRB- as a subspecies .
It is found in French Guiana and far north-eastern Brazil .
The taxonomy and systematics of the Sooty Barbthroat complex has made much confusion .

It often happens that all the mayflies in a population mature at once -LRB- the hatch -RRB- , and for a day or two in the Spring or Autumn -LRB- Fall -RRB- , mayflies will be everywhere , dancing around each other in large groups , or resting on every available surface .
Mayflies are unique in that they moult one more time after getting functional wings -LRB- this is also known as the alate stage -RRB- . This second-to-last winged stage is usually very short , a matter of hours .
The stage is a favorite food of many fish , and many ` fishing flies ' are modelled on them .

The club is a founding member of the European Club Association , which was formed after the dissolution of the G-14 , a collection of Europe 's most elite clubs .
The club was the first Italian and Southern European side to win the UEFA Cup . In 1985 , Juventus , the only team in the world to have won all official international cups and championships became the first club in the history of European football to have won all three major UEFA club competitions .
The club is the most successful team in the history of Italian football . Overall , the club have won 51 official trophies , more than any other team in the country ; 40 in Italy , which is also a record , and 11 in European and world competitions .

In Northern Europe , societies were able to live well on rich food supplies from the marshlands .
It was not much used until V. Gordon Childe popularized it in his book The dawn of Europe -LRB- 1947 -RRB- .
Such conditions produced distinctive human behaviors which are preserved in characteristic finds .
The Mesolithic was a period in the development of human technology between the Paleolithic and Neolithic periods of the Stone Age .
These conditions also delayed the coming of the Neolithic until as late as 4000 BC -LRB- 6,000 before present -RRB- in northern Europe .
The term was introduced by John Lubbock in his work Pre-historic times , published in 1865 .
Regions that experienced greater environmental effects as the last ice age ended have a much more evident Mesolithic era . This lasted millennia .
They occur only in the New World .
Phengodidae is a family of beetles . They are known as glowworm beetles or glowworms .
The larvae and the females -LRB- which keep their larval form -RRB- ate predators . They feed on millipedes and other animals they find in the soil and litter .
The females and larvae have organs that can produce light .
They are attracted to lights at night . They are probably short-lived and do not feed at all .

It was found by Spacewatch on October 6 , 1999 and originally designated as an asteroid .
It belongs to the PasiphaÃ `` group , non-spherical retrograde moons orbiting Jupiter at distances ranging between 22,800,000 and 24,100,000 km , and with inclinations ranging between 144.5 Â and 158.3 Â .

`` Buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo '' is a sentence that uses correct grammar .
The sentence means `` The bison from Buffalo , who are frightened by other bison from Buffalo , also frighten the bison from Buffalo . ''
It can be broken down to `` Buffaloa buffalon Buffaloa buffalon buffalov buffalov Buffaloa buffalon '' , where `` a '' is adjective , `` n '' is noun , and `` v '' is verb .
It is often used as an example of how homonyms -LRB- words that are spelled the same -RRB- and homophones -LRB- words that sound the same -RRB- can be used to create complicated constructs .

Because of copyright , a work can only be copied if the owner of the copyright gives permission .
But others believe that copyright laws make it harder to be creative . Without copyright , other people could reuse existing work , and copyright law often stops that .
People who copy a work that is protected under copyright without permission can be punished by the law , usually with a fine . In other , more serious cases , a person who copies a work that is protected under copyright could be arrested and go to prison .
Copyright laws make it easier for authors to make money by selling their works . Because of copyright , a work can only be copied if the owner of the copyright gives permission .

Jura is a department in the east of France . It is named after the Jura mountains -LRB- not to be confused with the Swiss canton of Jura -RRB- .
It was created from part of the former province of Franche-Comt Ã .
This is made from the local Savagnin grape variety .
Jura is one of the original 83 departments created during the French Revolution on March 4 , 1790 .
The Jura wines are very distinctive and unusual wines , such as vin jaune , which is made by a similar process to sherry . It develops under a flor of yeast .
It is now a sous-pr Ã fecture of Jura .
Other grape varieties include Poulsard , Trousseau , and Chardonnay .
Jura is one of four departments of the Franche-Comt Ã region .
The departments of Jura , Doubs , and Haute-Sa Ã ne form the modern Franche-Comt Ã region of France .
Many lakes can be found throughout the Jura . The largest natural lake is called Lac De Chalain .
Lac de Vouglans was formed after the building of a hydro-electric dam .
Historically , Jura belonged to the Free County of Burgundy , known in French as the Franche-Comt Ã .
Dole was the capital until the region was conquered by Louis XIV and it was moved to BesanÃ on .
The Jura mountains are wooded and rolling , not craggy and rocky like the Alps .
As early as the 13th century , inhabitants of the southern 2\/3 of Jura spoke a dialect of Arpitan language .
The lower valleys are temperate and pleasant , but the high mountain valleys have bitterly cold winters .
The Jura mountains provide ample opportunities for hiking , skiing , and other winter sports .

In 1913 Streicher married Kunigunde Roth , a baker 's daughter , in NÃ 1\/4 rnberg .
Streicher was born in Fleinhausen , Bavaria .
His publishing firm released three anti-Semitic books for children , including the 1938 Der Giftpilz -LRB- The Poison Mushroom -RRB- , one of the most widespread pieces of propaganda . The book said that Jews were dangerous , just like an attractive yet deadly mushroom .
Streicher was born in Fleinhausen , Bavaria . He was an elementary school teacher until joining the German Army in 1914 .
Streicher won the Iron Cross and was a lieutenant by the time the Armistice was signed in 1918 .
Streicher 's wife , Kunigunde Streicher , died in 1943 after 30 years of marriage .
He published Der StÃ 1\/4 rmer newspaper , became a part of the Nazi propaganda machine .
They had two sons , Lothar -LRB- born 1915 -RRB- and Elmar -LRB- born 1918 -RRB- .
In 1923 Streicher founded the racist newspaper , Der StÃ 1\/4 rmer .
Eventually the newspaper reached a peak circulation of 480,000 in 1935 .
Julius Streicher was found guilty of crimes against humanity at the Nuremberg War Crimes Trial and sentenced to death on October 1 , 1946 .
He claimed that Jews were white-slavers and were responsible for over 90 percent of the prostitutes in the country .
Streicher was not a member of the military and was not part of planning the Holocaust , the invasion of Poland , or the Soviet invasion .
After the war , he was convicted at the Nuremberg Trials of crimes against humanity and executed .

Goth people also make and listen to Goth music .
It began in the United Kingdom during the early 1980s in the gothic rock scene , an offshoot of the post-punk genre .
The goth subculture has survived much longer than others of the same era , and has continued to diversify .
Styles of dress within the subculture range from death rock , punk , androgynous , some Renaissance and Victorian style clothes , or combinations of the above , most often with black attire , makeup and hair .
Its imagery and cultural proclivities indicate influences from nineteenth century Gothic literature , mainly through horror movies .
The goth subculture is a contemporary subculture found in many countries .
The goth subculture has associated tastes in music and fashion , whether or not all individuals who share those tastes are , in fact , members of the goth subculture .
Gothic music encompasses a number of different styles .

The Territory of Ashmore and Cartier Islands is two groups of small low-lying uninhabited tropical islands in the Indian Ocean north-west of Australia and south of the Indonesian island of Roti .
They have a long coastline , over 74 k , but there are no ports or harbors , only offshore anchorage .
The territory includes Ashmore Reef -LRB- West , Middle , and East Islets -RRB- and Cartier Island 70 k east with , a total area of 199.45 k within the reefs and including the lagoons , and 114400 m of dry land .

A cuvette is a kind of laboratory glassware , usually a small tube of circular or square cross shape , closed at one end and open at the other , made of plastic , glass , or optical grade quartz and made to hold samples for spectroscopic experiments .

The 1900 Summer Olympics , officially known as the Games of the II Olympiad , were held in 1900 in Paris , France .
No opening or closing ceremonies were held but competitions began on May 14 and ended on October 28 .
Women took part in the games for the first time and Charlotte Cooper became the first female Olympic champion .
The Games were held as part of the 1900 World 's Fair .

The British Army is the land armed forces branch of the British Armed Forces .
The new British Army incorporated Regiments that had already existed in England and Scotland and was administered by the War Office from London .
The British army was heavily involved in the Napoleonic Wars in which the army served in Spain , across Europe , and in North Africa .
Although the Royal Navy is widely regarded as having been vital for the rise of Empire , and British dominance of the world , the British Army played important roles in colonisation .
The British Empire expanded in this time to include colonies , protectorates , and Dominions throughout the Americas , Africa , Asia and Australasia .
Since 1963 it has been managed by the Ministry of Defense .
It came into being with unification of the Kingdoms of England and Scotland into the Kingdom of Great Britain in 1707 .

Ricardo Achiles Rangel -LRB- 15 February 1924 - 11 June 2009 -RRB- was a Mozambican photojournalist and photographer .
He was appointed the chief photographer of Noticias in 1977 , after most other photojournalists had left the country following Mozambique 's independence .
The film , lasting 52 minutes , is a documentary 80 years of Ricardo Rangel , 60 of which were dedicated to photography , directed by Licinio de Azevedo and co-produced by Camilo de Sousa and Ebano MultimÃ dia .
In 2008 , Rangel was awarded an honorary doctorate in social science for his `` contribution to Mozambican culture '' from Eduardo Mondlane University , which is Mozambique 's oldest and largest university .
Rangel was born in the city of Lourenco Marques , now known as Maputo , Portuguese East Africa in February 1924 .

He returned to the city of Lourenco Marques during the late 1960s and returned to NotÃ cias .

Rangel 's funeral , which was held at Maputo City Hall on June 15 , 2009 , was attended by several dignitaries , including Prime Minister Luisa Diogo .

The Small White -LRB- Pieris rapae -RRB- is a small to mid-sized butterfly of the Yellows and Whites Pieridae family .
Its underwings are yellowish with black speckle .
The eggs are laid singularly on foodplant leaves .
Its caterpillars can be a pest on cultivated cabbages , but it will lay eggs as well on wild members of the cabbage family such as Charlock Sinapis arvensis and Hedge Mustard Sisybrium officinale .
Females also have two black spots in the center of the forewings .
The upperside is creamy white with black tips to the forewings .
It looks like a smaller version of the Large White .
It is common across Europe , North Africa and Asia and has also been accidentally introduced to North America , Australia and New Zealand where they have become pests on cultivated cabbages and other mustard family crops .
It has two flight periods , Aprilâ `` May and Julyâ `` August .
Along with the Large White it is sometimes known as the Cabbage White or Cabbage Butterfly .
Southeast Alaska , sometimes called the Alaska Panhandle is the southeastern portion of the U.S. state of Alaska . It is west of the northern half of the Canadian province of British Columbia .
A lot of of the panhandle is part of the Tongass National Forest , which is the biggest national forest in the United States .
This part of Alaska is known for its mild rainy climate and beautiful scenery .
The most common trees are evergreens called the sitka spruce and the western hemlock .
Because of all the mountains , glaciers , and towns on islands in Southeastern Alaska , almost all the towns except Hyder , Skagway , and Haines have no roads that go to other places . Airplanes and boats are the major means of transport .
The Alaska Marine Highway passes through Southeast Alaska .
Some other towns are Petersburg , Wrangell , Angoon , Craig , Klawock and Skagway .
The 2000 census population of the Panhandle was 72,954 people . About 42 % of them live in the city of Juneau .
The big cities in Southeast Alaska are Juneau , Ketchikan , and Sitka .
The Panhandle has a land area of 35138 m. This is only 6.14 % of Alaska 's land area , but the Panhandle is bigger than Maine , and almost as big as the state of Indiana .
Wildlife you might see on land there include brown bears , black bears , wolves , and deer . In the ocean there are humpback whales , orcas , five species of salmon and many other kinds of fish .
Later during the gold-rush steam ships used it . Today it is used by ferries and cruise ships .
On August 20 , 1902 , President Theodore Roosevelt opened the Alexander Archipelago Forest Reserve , which became the Tongass National Forest later .
Southeast Alaska is a rain forest within what is called the Pacific temperate rain forest zone .

These users are native speakers of Croatian .

The North Atlantic oscillation is a climatic phenomenon in the North Atlantic Ocean .
It controls the strength and direction of westerly winds and storms ' tracks over the Atlantic Basin .

The Wesley children 's early education was given by their parents in the Epworth rector .
In 1696 Samuel Welsey was appointed rector of Epworth , where John , the fifteenth child , was born . The Wesley children 's early education was given by their parents in the Epworth rector .
John was admitted to Charterhouse school , London , when he lived the stations methodical and -LRB- for a while -RRB- religious life in which he had been trained at here .
At the age of five , John was rescued from the burning rectory .
This escape made deep impression on his mind , and he regarded himself as proventially set apart , as a `` brand plucked from burning '' .
He examined and sent out preachers , began aid charities , prescribed for the sick , helped the use of electric shock for the treatment of illness .
Each child including the girls , was taught to read as they can could walk , and talk .
In 1869 Samuel married Susanna Annesley .

Street furniture are objects and pieces of equipment installed on streets and roads for different purposes , including traffic barrier , benches , bollards , post boxes , phone boxes , streetlamps , street lighting , traffic lights , traffic signs , bus stops , grit bins , tram stops , taxi stands , public lavatories , fountains and memorials , and waste receptacles .
An important consideration in the design of street furniture is how it affects road safety .
Croats are a South Slavic nation mostly living in Croatia , Bosnia and Herzegovina and nearby countries .
There are around 5 million Croats living in the southern Central Europe region , along the east bank of the Adriatic Sea and an estimated 9 million throughout the world .
Croats are noted for their unique culture , which has been throughout the ages variously influenced by both the Eastern world and the Western world .
The Croats are predominantly Catholic and their language is Croatian .
Large Croat communities exist in a number of countries , including Chile , the United States , Argentina , Australia , Germany , New Zealand and South Africa .

She was instrumental in the mod fashion movement , and one of the designers who took credit for inventing the miniskirt and hot pants .
In addition to the miniskirt , Mary Quant is often credited with inventing the colored and patterned tights -LRB- pantyhose -RRB- that often went with the miniskirt . These are also attributed to Cristobal Balenciaga or John Bates .
In November 1955 , she teamed up with her husband , Alexander Plunkett-Grene , and a former solicitor , Archie McNair , to open a clothes shop on the Kings Road in Chelsea called Bazaar .
In the late 1960s , Quant popularized hot pants .
Mary Quant named the miniskirt after her favorite make of car , the Mini .
Mary Quant OBE FCSD -LRB- born 11 February 1934 in Blackheath , London -RRB- is a British fashion designer .
Bazaar 's best sellers were small white plastic collars to brighten up black dresses or t-shirts .
Through the 1970s and 1980s she concentrated on household goods and make-up , rather than just her clothing lines .
She loved the car so much , she had one designed especially for her .
In 2000 she resigned as director of Mary Quant Ltd. , her cosmetics company , after a Japanese buy-out .
At a talk at the Victoria and Albert Museum in 2007 she claimed to have invented duvet covers .
Skirts had been getting shorter since about 1958 â `` a development Mary Quant thought was practical and liberating , allowing women to run for a bus .
The miniskirt , which she is most famous for , became one of the defining fashions of the 1960s .
Like most fashion , the short - and ever-shorter skirt was evolving already among individual fashion-minded young women : The designers who adapted it just helped spread the style and , in Quant 's case , gave it a name .
There are over 200 Mary Quant Colour shops in Japan , where Quant fashions continue to enjoy popularity .

The Linux kernel was made up of 2.4 million lines of code , or 8 % of all the code .
There is a lot of software for Linux , and since Linux is open source it means that most of the software for it is open source and free . This is one of the reasons why some people like to use Linux .
A little more than half of all lines of code were licensed under the GPL .
Linux is commonly used as an operating system for supercomputers . As of November 2007 , out of the top 500 systems , 426 -LRB- 85.2 % -RRB- run Linux .
Most of the code -LRB- 71 % -RRB- was written in the C programming language , and many other languages were used , including C + + , assembly language , Perl , Python , Fortran , and various shell scripting languages .
Linux relied on software code from MINIX at first .
To make the Linux kernel suitable for use with the code from the GNU Project , Linus Torvalds started a switch from his original license -LRB- which did not allow people to sell it -RRB- to the GNU GPL .
CrossOver is a proprietary solution based on the open source Wine project that supports running older Windows versions of Microsoft Office and Adobe Photoshop versions until CS2 .
â Other key components of a Linux system may use other licenses ; many libraries use the GNU Lesser General Public License -LRB- LGPL -RRB- , a type of the GPL that is less restricted , and the X Window System uses the MIT License .
A 2001 study of Red Hat Linux 7.1 found this distribution had 30 million lines of code .
the study also said , if all this software had been made by proprietary means , it would have cost about 1.08 billion dollars -LRB- in year 2000 U.S.A. dollars -RRB- to make in the United States .
The study said red hat 7.1 required about eight thousand man-years of time to development .
Linux and GNU developers worked together to integrate GNU code with Linux to make a free operating system .
The Linux kernel and most GNU software are licensed under the GNU General Public License -LRB- GPL -RRB- .
The GPL requires that anyone who distributes the Linux kernel must make the source code -LRB- and any modifications -RRB- available to the recipient under the same terms .

-LRB- Mean Time Between Failures -LRB- MTBF -RRB- is closely related to Failure rate .
For example , as an automobile grows older , the failure rate in its fifth year of service may be many times greater than its failure rate during its first year of service -- one simply does not expect to replace an exhaust pipe , overhaul the brakes , or have major transmission problems in a new vehicle .
A similar ratio used in the transport industries , especially in railways and trucking is ` Mean Distance Between Failure ' , a variation which attempts to correlate actual loaded distances to similar reliability needs and practices .
It is often written as the Greek letter Î '' -LRB- lambda -RRB- and is important in reliability theory .
Failure rate is usually time dependent , and an intuitive corollary is that the rate changes over time versus the expected life cycle of a system .
In the special case when the likelihood of failure remains constant with respect to time -LRB- for example , in some product like a brick or protected steel beam -RRB- , and ignoring the time to recover from failure , failure rate is simply the inverse of the Mean Time Between Failures -LRB- MTBF -RRB- .
Failure rate is the frequency with which an engineered system or component fails . Usually it is expressed in a number of failzres per time period , like failures per hour .
