Her father , pressured by his mistress , Madame de Montesson , sent her to a convent .
Finally , in 1770 , when she was twenty years old , she was allowed to leave the convent and marry her younger cousin , the Louis Henri de Bourbon , son and heir of Louis Joseph de Bourbon , Prince of CondÃ and his wife Charlotte Ã lisabeth Godefride de Rohan .
She fell out with her royalist husband and son , who both chose to leave France after the storming of the Bastille .
In 1804 , she learned that NapolÃ on I , whom she admired , had had her only son , Louis Antoine , Duke of Enghien , kidnapped , and executed by firing squad in the moat of the ChÃ cents teau de Vincennes .
She was known as Citoyenne VÃ ritÃ during the French Revolution .
In 1822 , while she was taking part in a march towards the PanthÃ on , she lost consciousness , and drew her last breath in the home of a law professor who taught at the Sorbonne .
Relegated to a place near Barcelona , Bathilde founded , despite her small means , a pharmacy and dispensary for the poor , and her house became a gathering place for those who needed aid .
Instead , she resumed her affair with the police officer who had escorted her to Spain in 1797 .
Badly rewarded for her fidelity to the democratic ideals of the Revolution , she survived a year and a half in a prison cell .
She was buried in the OrlÃ ans family chapel the CollÃ giale de Dreux .
Initially , Bathilde was considered as a possible bride for a distant cousin , Ferdinand , Duke of Parma , the favorite grandson of King Louis XV of France , however , that marriage never materialised .
In retribution , the National Convention decreed the imprisonment of all Bourbons remaining in France .
In November of the same year , her brother was guillotined .
In 1797 , the Directoire decided to exile the last of the Bourbons still living in France .
In 1815 , at the start of the Bourbon Restoration , she returned to France . Louis XVIII traded with her the HÃ tel Matignon for the Ã lysÃ e Palace .
For ten years , the emperor kept the mother of his most famous victim from setting foot in France .
Despite being forty-seven years old at the time , during the months which this journey took , she had an amorous intrigue with a handsome twenty-seven year old police officer -LRB- gendarme -RRB- under whose responsibility she had been put .
Descended from both Louis XIV of France and his younger brother , Philippe of France , Duke of OrlÃ ans , Bathilde was born a princesse du sang and baptised with the names Louise Marie ThÃ rÃ se Bathilde . She was the youngest child of Louis Philippe d'Orl Ã ans and Louise Henriette de Bourbon .
After her death , her nephew , Louis-Philippe , wanting to give an air of respectability to her bohemian lifestyle , burned the manuscript of her memoirs and a file on her young police officer located in the war archives .
Bathilde was born at the ChÃ cents teau de Saint-Cloud on 9 July 1750 .
As the Ancien RÃ gime crumbled , she took the name , Citoyenne VÃ ritÃ , `` Citizeness Truth '' .
Her mother died in 1759 when Bathilde was just eight years old .
The scandal of her husband 's adultery came out in 1778 , and the consequences fell entirely on her shoulders .
In April 1793 , her nephew , the young Duke of Chartres -LRB- future Louis Philippe of the French -RRB- , fled France and sought asylum with the Austrians .
While other members of the OrlÃ ans family still in France were kept under house arrest , Bathilde , Philippe Ã galitÃ and his sons were imprisoned in the Fort Saint-Jean in Marseille .
The two maintained a correspondence during her exile .
Bathilde promptly installed a community of nuns on the premises and charged them with praying for the souls of the victims of the Revolution .
During the French Revolution , just like her brother Philippe Ã galitÃ , Bathilde discovered democracy .
With her sister-in-law , Louise Marie AdÃ laÃ de de Bourbon , she went to Spain with her illegitimate daughter .
Her family , in the new moral order of the day , wanted to see her rejoin her husband after a separation of thirty-five years , but she refused .
Later , she passed the child off as the daughter of her secretary , in order to keep the little girl close to her .
She was sister of Philippe Ã galitÃ , the mother of the executed duc d'Enghien and aunt of Louis-Philippe King of the French .
Threatened by the new revolutionary government , she offered her wealth to the First French Republic before it could be confiscated .
During her time at the convent , she became a very spiritual person .
Bathilde d'Orl Ã ans -LRB- Louise Marie ThÃ rÃ se Bathilde ; 9 July 1750 -- 10 January 1822 -RRB- , was a French princess .
Bathilde got her revenge in 1814 , when the people , seeing in her the mother of the `` Martyr of Vincennes , '' cheered her as she traveled the route back to Paris .

The Gottlieb Animal Health and Conservation Center is in a restricted area of the zoo .
The first zoo opened in 1912 and was about two miles -LRB- 3.2 km -RRB- north of its current site until about 1965 .
The City of Los Angeles owns the entire zoo , its land and buildings , and the animals .
The zoo is open from 10am -- 5pm every day of the year except December 25 .
Animal care , grounds maintenance , construction , education , public information , and administrative staff are city employees .
In 2002 , the zoo became a certified Botanical Gardens and the official name of the institution was changed to the Los Angeles Zoo and Botanical Gardens .
The zoo , located in Los Angeles ' Griffith Park , is home to 1,100 animals from around the world .

Gamma-ray bursts were first observed in the late 1960s by the U.S. Vela satellites , which were built to detect gamma radiation pulses emitted by nuclear weapons tested in space .
They are the most luminous electromagnetic events known to occur in the universe .
Bursts can last from milliseconds to several minutes , although a typical burst lasts a few seconds .
Gamma-ray bursts -LRB- GRBs -RRB- are flashes of gamma rays from extremely energetic explosions . They have been seen in distant galaxies .
Most observed events last longer than two seconds and are classified as long gamma-ray bursts .
Most GRBs are a narrow beam of intense radiation released during a supernova , as a huge rapidly spinning star collapses to form a black hole .
Observations suggest significant variation in the jet angle from between 2 and 20 degrees .
The sources of most GRBs are billions of light years away from Earth . This suggests the explosions are extremely energetic : a typical burst releases as much energy in a few seconds as the Sun will in its entire 10 billion year lifetime .
Gamma-ray bursts are thought to be highly focused explosions , with most of the explosion energy in a narrow relativistic jet traveling at speeds over 99.995 % of the speed of light .
Almost every well-studied long gamma-ray burst has been associated with a rapidly star-forming galaxy and in many cases a core-collapse supernova as well . This links long GRBs with the deaths of massive stars .
It has been suggested that a gamma-ray burst in the Milky Way could cause a mass extinction on Earth .
The initial burst is usually followed by a longer-lived ` afterglow ' emitted at longer wavelengths -LRB- X-ray , ultraviolet , visible light , infrared and radio waves -RRB- .
A subclass of GRBs -LRB- the ` short ' bursts -RRB- seem to come from a different process , perhaps the merger of binary neutron stars .
The approximate angular width of the jet -LRB- that is , the degree of beaming -RRB- can be estimated directly by observing `` jet breaks '' in afterglow light curves : a time after which the slowly-decaying afterglow begins to fade suddenly , as the jet slows down and can no longer beam its radiation so effectively .
On July 2 , 1967 , at 14:19 UTC , the Vela 4 and Vela 3 satellites detected a flash of gamma radiation unlike any known nuclear weapons signature .
Long GRB afterglow observations at high redshift -LRB- great distances -RRB- also suggest GRBs originate in star-forming regions .
Because their energy is strongly beamed -LRB- very narrow -RRB- , the gamma rays emitted by most bursts miss the Earth and are never detected .
When this effect is taken into account , typical gamma-ray bursts are observed to have a true energy release of about 1044 J , or about 1\/2000 of a Solar mass energy equivalent .
All observed GRBs have come from outside the Milky Way galaxy . Similar phenomena , soft gamma repeater flares , are associated with magnetars within the Milky Way .
Uncertain what had happened but not considering the matter particularly urgent , the team at the Los Alamos Scientific Laboratory filed the data away for investigation .
When a gamma-ray burst is pointed towards Earth , the focusing of its energy along a relatively narrow beam causes the burst to appear much brighter than it would have been were its energy emitted spherically .
They have been studied in much greater detail than their short counterparts .

It is no longer considered a true vitamin nor part of the Vitamin B complex .
In DNA , adenine sticks to thymine with two hydrogen bonds to help in making the nucleic acid structures stronger .
Adenine is a chemical part of DNA and RNA .
In older books , adenine was sometimes called Vitamin B4 .
However , two B vitamins , niacin and riboflavin , bind with adenine to form the essential cofactors NAD and FAD respectively .

Feynman diagrams are used in quantum mechanics .
A Feynman diagram is a diagram which shows what happens when elementary particles collide .
A Feynman diagram has lines in different shapesâ '' straight , dotted , and squigglyâ '' which meet up at points called vertices . The vertices are where the lines begin and end .
The points in Feynman diagrams where the lines meet represent two or more particles that happen to be at the same point in space at the same time . The lines in a Feynman diagram represent the probability amplitude for a particle to go from one place to another .
The points in Feynman diagrams where the lines meet represent two or more particles that happen to be at the same point in space at the same time .

Because the difference between right and left hands is well known and easy to observe , chemists call many pairs of enantiomers `` right - '' and `` left-handed . ''
Molecular chirality is important because of it is used in stereochemistry in inorganic chemistry , organic chemistry , physical chemistry , biochemistry , and supramolecular chemistry .
A molecule is achiral -LRB- not chiral -RRB- if it has an axis of symmetry .
In chemistry , chirality usually refers to molecules .
Human hands are chiral . The left hand is a mirror image of the right hand .
The symmetry of a molecule -LRB- or any other object -RRB- tells us whether it is chiral .
The symmetry of a molecule -LRB- or any other object -RRB- tells us whether it is chiral . A molecule is achiral -LRB- not chiral -RRB- if it has an axis of symmetry .
This is why you can not put a left handed glove on your right hand , or shake the right hand of a person using your left hand .
The word chiral is derived from the Greek word for hand , Ï Î Î Ï -LRB- \/ cheir \/ -RRB- .
If a molecule is chiral it has two forms that are mirror images of each other but are not the same . Chemists call these enantiomers or optical isomers .

Flag design also follows a historical process , where later flag designs are based on earlier flag designs .
The Flag Identification System was created by Whitney Smith and adopted by FÃ dÃ ration internationale des associations vexillologiques -LRB- FIAV -RRB- .
Other symbols are used to describe other uses of the flag , such as official status and which side of the flag is shown .
This means that many flags in an area may look similar because they are all based on one historical flag . Examples include the Pan-African colors , Pan-Arab colors , and the Nordic Cross .
The first row is for use on land and the second row is for use on water , each divided into private -LRB- civil -RRB- , government -LRB- state -RRB- , and military -LRB- war -RRB- use .

The Dicynodontia are a group of therapsids or mammal-like reptiles .
They were small to large herbivorous animals with two tusks , hence their name , which means ` two dog tooth ' .
They are also the most successful and diverse of the non-mammalian therapsids , with over 70 genera known .
Cucurbitaceae is a plant family commonly known as melons , gourds or cucurbits and includes crops like cucumbers , squashes -LRB- including pumpkins -RRB- , luffas , melons and watermelons .
The family is predominantly distributed around the tropics , where those with edible fruits were amongst the earliest cultivated plants in both the Old and New Worlds .

The four Tezcatlipocas were the sons of Ometecuhtli and Omecihuatl , lord and lady of the duality , and were the creators of all the other gods , as well as the world and man .
Tezcatlipoca was often described as a rival of another important god of the Aztecs , the culture hero , Quetzalcoatl .
In later myths , the four gods who created the world , Tezcatlipoca , Quetzalcoatl , Huitzilopochtli and Xipe Totec were referred to respectively as the Black , the White , the Blue and the Red Tezcatlipoca .
He had many names in context with different aspects of his deity : Titlacauan -LRB- `` We are his Slaves '' -RRB- , Ipalnemoani -LRB- `` He by whom we live '' -RRB- , Necoc Yaotl -LRB- `` Enemy of Both Sides '' -RRB- , Tloque Nahuaque -LRB- `` Lord of the Near and the Nigh '' -RRB- and Yohualli Ã ecatl -LRB- Night , Wind -RRB- , Ome acatl -LRB- `` Two Reed '' -RRB- , Ilhuicahua Tlalticpaque -LRB- `` Possessor of the Sky and Earth '' -RRB- .
Similarities exist with the patron deity of the K ` iche ' Maya as described in the Popol Vuh .
A central figure of the Popol Vuh was the god Tohil whose name means `` obsidian '' and who was associated with sacrifice .
The Tezcatlipoca figure goes back to earlier Mesoamerican deities worshipped by the Olmec and Maya .
His name in the Nahuatl language is often translated as `` Smoking Mirror '' because of his connection to obsidian , the material from which mirrors were made in Mesoamerica and which was used for shamanic rituals .
Quetzalcoatl became the ruler of the following creation `` Sun of Water '' , and Tezcatlipoca destroyed the third creation `` The Sun of Wind '' by striking down Quetzalcoatl .
Tezcatlipocas Nagual , his animal counterpart , was the jaguar and his Jaguar aspect was the deity Tepeyollotl `` Mountainheart '' .
In one version of the Aztec creation account the myth of the Five Suns , The first creation , `` The sun of the Earth '' was ruled by Tezcatlipoca but destroyed by Quetzalcoatl when he struck down Tezcatlipoca who then transformed into a jaguar .

An International Standard Serial Number -LRB- ISSN -RRB- is an eight-digit number used to identify a print or electronic periodical publication .
The ISO subcommittee TC 46\/SC 9 is responsible for the standard .
The ISSN system was first created known as international standard ISO 3297 in 1975 .

The HPC issues storm summaries on storm systems bringing significant rainfall and snowfall to portions of the United States .
The HPC was created in October 1995 , when the former National Meteorological Center was reorganised into the NCEP . It is based at the World Weather Building in Camp Springs , Maryland , along with a few of the other National Centers such as the Climate Prediction Center -LRB- CPC -RRB- , the Ocean Prediction Center -LRB- OPC -RRB- , and the Environmental Modeling Center -LRB- EMC -RRB- .
The Hydrometeorological Prediction Center -LRB- a.k.a. HPC -RRB- is one of nine Service Centers that are part of the National Centers for Environmental Prediction -LRB- NCEP -RRB- , which is part of the National Weather Service , which in turn is part of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration -LRB- NOAA -RRB- of the U.S. government .
The HPC serves as a center of excellence in Quantitative Precipitation Forecasting , Medium Range Forecasting -LRB- three to seven days -RRB- and the interpretation of numerical weather prediction models .
The HPC also acts as the backup office to the National Hurricane Center in the event of a complete communications failure .

This exists in most all genres of music and is commonly found in punk rock , indie rock , and extreme metal , among others .
Mainstream music refers to music that is familiar to and popular with the majority of people in their culture . For example , popular music or pop music .
Punk rock has set itself apart from other non-mainstream genres by self-asserting an active anti-mainstream social movement that resists commercialism and corporate control .
The boundary is vague .

In virtually all Christian traditions , this regular public worship is accompanied by other forms of worship , such as prayer and study , small group prayer -LRB- often linked with Bible study -RRB- , and formal ceremonies on special occasions , including weddings , funerals and events of Church or state .
Throughout most centuries of Church history , Christian worship has been primarily liturgical , symbolised by prayers and hymns , whose texts were closely related to , the Scripture .
Set times for prayer during the day were made -LRB- based mostly on Jewish models -RRB- , and a festal cycle throughout the Church year pointed out the celebration of feasts and holy days relating to the events in the life of Jesus , the lives of the saints , and features of the Church 's view of God .
To change the patterns and content of worship were to change the faith itself .
A large amount of importance was placed on the forms of worship , as they were seen in terms of the Latin phrase lex orandi , lex credendi -LRB- `` the rule of prayer is the rule of belief '' -RRB- -- that is , the details of someone 's worship show , teach , and govern the principle beliefs of the community .
Orthodoxy in faith also meant orthodoxy in worship , and vice versa .
Each time a heresy appeared in the Church , it normally came by a shift in worship for the heretical group .
The heat capacity of a single material is called the specific heat capacity of the material . The term `` heat capacity '' by itself means the general idea .

The Illinois Senate is the upper chamber in the Illinois General Assembly , the legislative branch of the government of the state of Illinois .
In contrast , the Illinois House of Representatives is made up of 118 members with its entire membership elected to two-year terms .
House districts are formed by dividing each Senate district in half .
According to Illinois ' 1970 constitution , senators are divided into three groups , each group having a two-year term at a different part of the decade between censuses , with the rest of the decade being taken up by two four-year terms . .
Depending on the election year , roughly one-third , two-thirds , or all Senate seats may be contested .
Created in 1818 by the constitution of the first state , the Illinois senate is comprised 59 senators elected from individual legislative districts determined by population .

Step on the pedal all the way to the left , move the throttle lever to `` give it the gas '' and gently move the floor lever forward . This is low gear , the powerful gear used to get the Model T moving .

Southwark Cathedral , in Southwark , London , lies on the south bank of the River Thames close to London Bridge .
The cathedral has three choirs , The main Cathedral Choir is supported financially by the St Olave 's & St Saviour 's Schools Foundation . They were two parochial schools set up in the 1560s , and still hold their annual services here as their ` foundation ' church .

The present building is mainly Gothic , from 1220 to 1420 .
Borough Market and the Hall of the Worshipful Company of Glaziers and Painters of Glass by the river are close by .
It is the mother church of the Anglican Diocese of Southwark .

The water organ works by having water and air arriving together in the camera aeolis -LRB- wind chamber -RRB- .
Here , water and air separate and the compressed air is driven into a wind-trunk on top of the camera aeolis , to blow the organ pipes .
It then drives a water wheel , which in turn drives the musical cylinder and the movements attached .
A hydraulis is an early type of pipe organ that was powered by water .
The water organ or hydraulic organ is a kind of pipe organ .
Two perforated â splash platesâ or â diaphragmsâ stop the water spray from getting into the organ pipes .
It was invented in the 3rd century B.C. , probably by the Hellenistic scientist Ctesibius of Alexandria .
It was the world 's first keyboard instrument .
To start the organ , the tap above the entry pipe is turned on and , given a continuous flow of water , the organ plays until the tap is closed again .
The water , having been separated from the air , leaves the camera aeolis at the same speed as it enters .

The term is used mainly in igneous petrology .
In biochemistry , a trace element is also referred to as a micronutrient .
In biochemistry , a trace element is a chemical element that is needed in minute quantities for the proper growth , development , and physiology of the organism .
In geology , a trace element is a chemical element whose concentration is less than 1000 ppm or 0.1 % of a rock 's composition .
In analytical chemistry , a trace element is an element in a sample that has an average concentration of less than 100 parts per million -LRB- ppm -RRB- measured in atomic count , or less than 100 micrograms per gram .

I. On the natural history of the man-like Apes p1 -- 56 .
Evidence as to Man 's Place in Nature is an 1863 book by Thomas Henry Huxley , in which he gives evidence for the evolution of man and apes from a common ancestor .
Darwin 's sequel came eight years later , with The Descent of Man , and Selection in relation to Sex -LRB- 1871 -RRB- .
In the Origin Darwin had deliberately avoided tackling human evolution , except for a sentence : `` Light will be thrown on the origin of man and his history '' .
Robert Chambers in his anonymous Vestiges also clearly made the point .
In the 18th century Linnaeus and others had classified man as a primate , but without drawing evolutionary conclusions .
The book came five years after Charles Darwin and Alfred Russel Wallace announced their theory of evolution by means of natural selection , and four years after the publication of Darwin 's Origin of Species .
On some fossil remains of Man p119 â `` 159 .
Backed by this evidence , the book said that evolution applied as fully to man as to all other life .
This contains a summary of what was known of the great apes at that time .
A neanderthal skull-cap and other bones had been found , and various remains of early Homo sapiens .
On the relations of Man to the lower animals p57 â `` 112 .
It was Lamarck , the first to develop a coherent theory of evolution , who discussed human evolution in this context .
Huxley compares these remains with existing human races .
It was the first book devoted to the topic of human evolution , and discussed much of the anatomical and other evidence .

WAW dependencies are also known as output dependencies .
In order to have a compact instruction encoding , most processor instruction sets have a small set of special locations which can be directly named .
Different instructions may take different amounts of time -LRB- e.g. , CISC architecture -RRB- .
Instead of delaying the write until all reads are completed , two copies of the location can be maintained , the old value and the new value .
Instructions 4 , 5 , and 6 are independent of instructions 1 , 2 , and 3 , but the processor can not finish 4 until 3 is done , because 3 would then write the wrong value .
When all reads needing the old value have been satisfied , it can be discarded .
While the general-purpose and floating-point registers are the most , flag and status registers or even individual status bits are commonly renamed as well .
Programs are composed of instructions which operate on values .
Anything that is read and written can be renamed .
The false dependency is broken and additional opportunities for out-of-order execution are created .
A typical instruction might say , add X and Y and put the result in Z. In this instruction , X , Y , and Z are the names of storage locations .
Memory locations can also be renamed , although it is not commonly done to the level used in register renaming .
This is the essential concept behind register renaming .
The instructions must name these values in order to distinguish them from one another .
For instance , a processor may be able to execute hundreds of instructions while a single load from main memory instruction is in progress .
This is the sort of false dependency that can be resolved by renaming .
In computer engineering , register renaming refers to a technique used to avoid unnecessary serialized execution of program instructions because of the reuse of the same registers by those instructions .
Shorter instructions executed while the load is outstanding will finish first , thus the instructions are finishing out of the original program order .
Now instructions 4 , 5 , and 6 can be executed in parallel with instructions 1 , 2 , and 3 , so that the program can be executed faster .
WAR dependencies are also known as anti-dependencies .
In smaller processors , the names of these locations correspond directly to elements of a register file .
A read from a register or memory location must return the last prior value written to that location , and not one written programmatically after the read .
For example , the x86 instruction set architecture has 8 integer registers , x86-64 has 16 , many RISCs have 32 , and IA-64 has 128 .
Successive writes to a particular register or memory location must leave that location containing the result of the second write .
Reads that precede , in program order , the write of the new value can be provided with the old value , even while other reads that follow the write are provided with the new value .
Out-of-order execution has been used in most recent high-performance CPUs to achieve some of their speed gains .
This can be resolved by squashing -LRB- synonyms : canceling , annulling , mooting -RRB- the first write if necessary .
This is referred to as a true dependency or flow dependency , and requires the instructions to execute in program order .
A read from a register or memory location must return the value placed there by the last write in program order , not some other write .
Many high performance CPUs have more physical registers than may be named directly in the instruction set and they can rename registers in hardware to achieve better instruction level parallelism .
The Turing test is a test to see if a computer can trick a person into believing that the computer is a person too .

The waggle phase of the dance is the most notable and informative part of the dance .
People study the swarm intelligence of social insects and animals such as fish , birds , and ants . Recently , there has been research on using bee waggle dance behavior for fault-tolerant routing .
From the abstract of Wedde , Farooq , and Zhang -LRB- 2004 -RRB-
Flowers that are located directly in line with the sun are shown by waggle runs in an upward direction on the vertical combs . If the flowers are at an angle to the right or left of the sun , the waggle run is done at the same angle to the upward direction .
It is now known that a round dance is only a waggle dance with a very short `` waggle run '' -LRB- see below -RRB- .
The bee will run through a small wave-like pattern -LRB- a waggle run or waggle phase -RRB- . After this , it will turn to the right and circle back to the starting point -LRB- the return phase -RRB- .
The distance between hive and flowers is shown in the duration of the waggle runs .
For every 100 meters the flowers are distant from the hive , the waggle phase lasts about 75 milliseconds .
The direction and duration of waggle runs show the direction and distance to flowers .
These phases are the waggle phase and the return phase .
It used to be thought that bees have two distinct `` recruitment '' dances . There were the `` round dances '' and waggle dances .
Georges Head fort was built in 1871 after the British Army decided to leave Australia in 1870 .
It took three months and 250 soldiers to roll the gun barrels all the way from North Sydney to the forts .
In 1877 large mounds of earth were placed between the pits to make sure the guns neither could fire upon each other and to help protect the gun crew from enemy fire .
Their job was to explode the mine closest to an approaching enemy ship .
The Georges Head Fort is located on the Georges Head , in the suburb of Mosman in Sydney , New South Wales , Australia .
They came along a dirt road which later became Military Road .
Georges Head was armed with four 80 pounder cannons and two 68 pounder cannons .
